title: Supply Chain Localization Leader
location:
locations
AE-ABU DHABI-AL GHAITH HOLDING TOWER, AIRPORT ROAD
description:
Do you enjoy working on Supply Chain projects?

Would you like the opportunity to work for oilfield services company?

Join our team

Our Oilfield Services business provides intelligent, connected technologies to monitor and control our energy extraction assets. Our team arranging technical expertise to meet our client expectation. We provide customers with the peace of mind needed to reliably and efficiently improve their operations.

Partner with the best

As the Supply Chain Localization Leader you will be responsible for leading and executing an integrated Supply Chain Localization strategy under UAE Unified ICV Program v4.0, targeting Goods Manufactured and Third-Party Spend to shift sourcing from import-heavy to locally optimized. You will drive measurable ICV uplift, ensuring compliance with MOIAT and ADNOC frameworks, and spearheading facility optimization projects across UAE to enhance operational efficiency and local value creation.

As a Supply Chain Localization Leader, you will be responsible for:
Developing and executing Supply Chain Localization Strategy for Baker Hughes business in the UAE. Targeting shift to UAE Based ICV-Certified Suppliers. Specific categories focus is needed on are Goods Manufactured as well as Third Party Spend.
Performing analysis of current supply chain Practices, conducting existing spend diagnostics, mapping high spend categories to UAE-Made alternatives.
Revamping Supply Chain for Local Sourcing, Partner with Local suppliers for active participation in Local Supplier Development programs.
Engaging with Suppliers to support their ICV Certifications and Scores, Conducting supplier training workshops in Conjunction with the ICV Leader.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams (Business Segments, GeoZones, Supply Chain) to drive UAE-based supply chain localization in alignment with the established localization strategy
Ensuring compliance with MoIAT and ADNOC ICV frameworks; Supporting with Internal / External ICV Audits specific to Third Party Spend and Goods Manufactured categories.
Identifying and leading facility cost optimization projects throughout the UAE Baker Hughes business.
To be successful in this role you will have:
Bachelors in supply chain, Engineering, Procurement or Business.
Minimum 5 Years with Supply Chain function, preferably within the Oil and Gas industry.
Thorough understanding of the MoIAT and ADNOC In Country Value frameworks (is preferred).
Proven Supply Chain Localization and/or Supplier Development experience.
Strong Analytical and Data Driven Decision making, ability to work within a matrix organization while leading with influence, executive communication Skills.

Working with Us 

Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train, reward talent, and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.

Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:

Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities

description:
ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
•    Ensure compliance with manage the Job Cycle (MtJC) process
•    Work with the assigned Service Delivery Coordinator/Salesperson to understand the client’s well construction or production objectives as well as the commercial terms for Baker Hughes (i.e. outcome based contract, line item contract, etc.)
•    Perform offset job analysis and product/service specific engineering modelling calculations to understand application hazards and incident potential
•    Work together with all disciplines and stakeholders to ensure all aspects and constraints of the application and suggested products/services have been considered
•    Design a job program, including risk mitigation plans and contingency plans, that can meet the client’s objective(s), maximize revenue potential and ensure future job assignments for Baker Hughes
•    Work with the assigned Service Delivery Coordinator/Salesperson to ensure any risk of not meeting the client’s objective is communicated to the client using the appropriate channels/processes for the respective client
•    Accurately document any calculations/simulations/plan revision and/or changes during the project cycles for visibility to dependent teams and audit purposes
•    Provide on-demand support in accordance with product portfolio or on-call schedule for job execution
•    Compare job as-planned versus job as-executed, document any lessons learned and develop recommendations for further improvements to procedures to ensure continuous improvement takes place
•    Work on Field Incidents related to products/services
•    Participate in Incident Investigations when required, ensuring the end to end process is considered, (including job planning, preparation, and execution), when determining incident root cause(s) alongside appropriate corrective actions
•    Ensure timely incident management to enable fast customer issue resolution and cash collection
•    Advise on product improvement opportunities for repetitive component/product failures 
•    Responsible for providing sales support and product application recommendations
•    Product line specific responsibilities as applicable
•    Handles special projects as required
QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS:
•    Bachelor’s degree in engineering
•    Excellent leadership, strong interpersonal, influencing and planning skills
•    Ability to be on call outside of normal business hours
•    Ability to work in a global matrix organization
•    Excellent communication and presentation skills
•    Strong organizational, analytical and problem solving skills
•    Must have the ability to travel (potential for travel to rig sites, customer facilities, meetings, training, etc.)
DESIRED CHARACTERISTICS:
•    Significant operational experience
•    Comfortable presenting in front of an audience of experienced peers
•    Ability to manage, develop, coach, and mentor teams across organizational boundaries
•    Ability to learn and use various computer tools to prepare data and visualizations for analysis
•    Ability to work independently

Reports To: Service Delivery Technical Manager

title: Applications Engineer Gen - Service Delivery Applications
description:
Driving Operational Excellence Through Engineering, Job Planning, and Technical Service Delivery

Partner with the Best

Baker Hughes delivers advanced energy technology solutions across more than 120 countries. The Service Delivery organization ensures flawless execution for our customers by leveraging engineering expertise, risk management, and optimized job planning. As part of this team, the Applications Engineer plays a critical role in ensuring safe, reliable, and efficient service delivery aligned with Baker Hughes’ standards and customer expectations.

Fuel Your Passion

The Applications Engineer – Service Delivery Applications supports the full job lifecycle by providing technical evaluations, job design, risk assessments, incident reviews, and operational support. This role ensures that engineering practices, process discipline, and technical governance are consistently applied across all projects. The engineer collaborates closely with Sales, Service Delivery Coordinators, and field teams to ensure customer objectives are met while driving operational excellence and continuous improvement.

As an Applications Engineer, you will be responsible for:

Ensuring compliance with the Manage the Job Cycle (MtJC) process.
Working with the assigned Service Delivery Coordinator/Salesperson to understand the client’s well construction or production objectives, along with associated commercial terms (e.g., outcome-based or line-item contracts).
Performing offset job analysis and conducting engineering modeling calculations to identify potential hazards and incidents.
Collaborating with all disciplines and stakeholders to ensure full consideration of application constraints and product/service requirements.
Designing job programs, including risk mitigation and contingency plans, to meet client objectives and maximize business potential.
Communicating any risks to client objectives through appropriate channels in alignment with defined processes.
Accurately documenting all calculations, simulations, revisions, and changes during the project lifecycle for visibility and audit readiness.
Providing on-demand support according to product portfolio or on-call rotation for job execution.
Comparing planned vs. executed job data, capturing lessons learned, and recommending improvements for continuous enhancement.
Working on field incidents involving products/services.
Participating in Incident Investigations, ensuring end-to-end evaluation (planning, preparation, execution) to determine root causes and corrective actions.
Enabling timely incident management to support customer issue resolution and cash collection.
Advising on product improvement opportunities for recurring component or equipment failures.
Providing sales support through technical recommendations and product application expertise.
Supporting product‑line‑specific responsibilities as applicable.
Handling special projects as assigned.


To be successful in this role, you will:

Hold a bachelor’s degree in science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics (STEM).
Demonstrate excellent leadership, interpersonal, influencing, and planning skills.
Be available for on‑call support outside normal working hours.
Be capable of working effectively in a global matrix organization.
Have strong communication and presentation abilities.
Possess strong organizational, analytical, and problem‑solving skills.
Be willing and able to travel, including to rig sites, customer facilities, meetings, and training.


Desired Characteristics

Significant operational experience.
Confidence in presenting to experienced peer groups.
Ability to manage, coach, and mentor teams across organizational boundaries.
Ability to learn and use various digital tools, data preparation systems, and visualization platforms.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.

Drive and improve quality control to eliminate escaping defects.

Creating, refining, educating, and implementing standard work changing the quality culture of operators

Supporting shop to implement processes as per procedures, corrective or preventive actions coming from NCA\RCA or escaping defects.

Supporting QL for QMS processes are established, implemented, and maintained by review of internal audits (including station audit), discussions with process owners or review of the processes including suggestion of modification of existing procedure.

title: Quality Project Manager
description:
Responsibilities, authorities and accountabilities

As a Project Quality Manager TPS Equipment & Projects, you will be accountable for ensuring that the project scope of supply meets the quality contractual requirements. You will work in collaboration with the Project Manager and all supporting functions involved in the project requisition processes, timely managing risks and the relevant mitigation plan in order to minimize the number of escaping defects and ensure that our customers’ needs and expectations are met or exceeded.

As a Project Quality Manager, you will be responsible for:

Creating quality plans based on the standard template incorporating additional customer quality and technical regulation and product certification requirements
Taking ownership for the quality requirements to ensure effective project execution for our customers, putting in place adequate quality surveillance and risk mitigation plan
Managing non-conformance and concessions approval process to ensure compliance with contractual requirements
Communicating with internal and external customers to share project related information and build effective relationships
Preparing and present quality performance reporting to internal leadership and customers
Monitoring the punch list during the scope of supply execution so to achieve zero punch list at shipment
Driving On Time Delivery of quality documents and certification book to customer
Feeding continuous learning nurturing Lesson Learned process and application

Have an appropriate level qualification in Project Management, Engineering or Quality Management, or equivalent experience (a Master Degree is recommended)
Show solid experience in Quality Assurance, Quality Control processes and their application
Have analytical and reporting skill and show understanding and experience of problem-solving methodology and Continuous Improvement
Be fluently English and Italian
Have Quality auditor training & qualification (desired)
Exploit previous experience in Oil & Gas industry (desired)

Strong oral and written communication skills. Strong interpersonal and leadership skills. Ability to influence others and lead small teams. Lead initiatives of moderate scope and impact. Enjoy travelling to manufacturing locations and being flexible to customer demands (available to travel on short notice)

title: Mechanik jeřábové techniky (m/ž)
description:
Mechanik jeřábové techniky (m/ž)

Chcete se podílet na výrobě generátorů?

Chcete pracovat v Plzni?

Spolupracujte s těmi nejlepšími

Baker Hughes je přední globální energeticko‑technologická společnost, která poskytuje inovativní řešení zvyšující bezpečnost, čistotu a efektivitu energie napříč celým hodnotovým řetězcem. Společnost působí ve více než 120 zemích a kombinuje hluboké znalosti odvětví s pokročilým inženýrstvím a digitálními technologiemi na podporu výroby energie, její transformace a dekarbonizace. S více než stoletou tradicí spolupracuje Baker Hughes se zákazníky v ropném a plynárenském průmyslu, v průmyslových odvětvích i na rozvíjejících se energetických trzích, aby urychlila pokrok směrem k udržitelnější energetické budoucnosti.

Rozviňte svou vášeň

Jako mechanik jeřábové techniky budete zajišťovat provozuschopnost zdvihacích zařízení, provádět jejich opravy a poskytovat technickou podporu. Budete zpracovávat analýzy technického stavu strojů, navrhovat preventivní údržbu a podílet se na zvyšování efektivity správy majetku. Součástí práce je také technická spolupráce při objednávkách, účast ve výběrových řízeních a výkon funkce provozního technika zdvihacích zařízení s odpovědností za jejich bezpečný provoz.

Jako mechanik jeřábové techniky budete:

Provádět činnosti spojené se zajištěním chodu strojů a zařízení, a to včetně dodržování legislativních požadavků. Pozice je zaměřena především na zdvihací zařízení, jako jsou jeřáby, plošiny či vysokozdvižné vozíky.

Aktivně se podílet na realizaci oprav strojů a zařízení, řídit průběh oprav a poskytovat odbornou technickou podporu.

Zpracovávat přehledy a analýzy technického stavu strojů a zařízení a navrhovat postupy preventivní údržby i oprav.

Aktivně se účastnit procesů zlepšování a přispívat ke zvyšování efektivity a produktivity v oblasti správy a údržby majetku.

Technicky spolupracovat na objednávkovém procesu a podílet se na výběrových řízeních týkajících se údržby a oprav zařízení.

Abyste byli v této roli úspěšní, budete potřebovat:

SŠ technického směru (strojní nebo elektro).

Zkušenosti s prováděním údržby a oprav strojů

Zkušenosti s jednáním s dodavateli (výhodou)

Zkušenosti s obsluhou zdvihacích zařízení (výhodou)

Pracujte způsobem, který vám vyhovuje

Uznáváme, že každý je jiný a že každý chce pracovat a podávat nejlepší výkon jiným způsobem. V této roli můžeme nabídnout následující flexibilní pracovní uspořádání:

Možnosti flexibilní práce proberte prosím s náborářem.

Spolupráce s námi

Naši lidé jsou srdcem všeho, co v Baker Hughes děláme. Víme, že jsme lepší, když se všichni naši zaměstnanci rozvíjejí, jsou angažovaní a mohou být sami sebou. Investujeme do jejich zdraví a pohody, školíme je, odměňujeme talent a rozvíjíme lídry na všech úrovních, abychom ze sebe navzájem dostali to nejlepší.

Co nabízíme vám

Naše vynálezy mění energetiku už více než století. Abychom mohli pokračovat i zítra, musíme posouvat hranice už dnes. Odměňujeme ty, kteří přijímají změny, balíčkem benefitů, který odráží, jak moc si jejich přínosu vážíme.

Můžete očekávat:

Pracovní doba 7,5 hodiny denně

Příspěvek na doplňkové penzijní pojištění 15 600 Kč ročně

Zajímavé platové ohodnocení a čtvrtletní bonusy (dle splnění firemních a osobních cílů)

Pravidelné každoroční navyšování mzdy

Firemní vzdělávání (povinná školení i rozvoj hrazený zaměstnavatelem)

Vlastní jídelna, výběr z několika jídel

Stravenkový paušál 115 Kč za odpracovanou směnu

5 týdnů dovolené

Flexi passy (volnočasové poukázky)

Výborná dostupnost MHD

Stabilní zaměstnání ve firmě s dlouhou tradicí

title: Pipe Systems Tendering Engineer
description:
Join our global team

We devise smarter systems to support our customers in meeting their energy supply needs. Innovating in the energy industry, our flexible pipe systems are industry leading. Our global engineering team are responsible for delivering all aspects of design, development, and delivery of our customer projects.

Partner the best

As a Pipe Systems Tendering Engineer, you will work within a multidisciplinary team to design technical solutions for proposal to global customers on major projects.

You will be responsible for owning the design engineering in our tendering process for subsea flexible pipe systems. As part of our team you will design solutions, perform detailed engineering assessments and facilitate the input of other disciplines to build successful system proposals. Our tendering team is a rounded engineering function, with significant requirement for strong communication and task ownership to deliver for our customers. This includes engagement with customers on pre-contract requirements and engineering strategy. You will provide technical design support throughout all stages of the project tendering process from early concept evaluation to full tender proposal as part of a motivated and supportive engineering team. The role offers an opportunity to learn about the products and services of a global business whilst developing your engineering skillset as part of our diverse technical business.

As Pipe Systems Tendering Design Engineer, you will be responsible for:

Use of sound engineering practice to develop pipe systems design to customer specification.

Technical focal point for tendering process, owning the technical solution and inputs to risk mitigation as well as facilitating engineering process.

Providing technical support throughout all stages of project tendering process from early concept to full tender proposal.

Performing engineering calculation, using company software tools and design guidelines, to develop and verify design of pipe structure and associated ancillary items.

Facilitating engineering output from other departments and sub-suppliers as required to develop quality output.

Communicating on aspects of the technical proposal to internal and external stakeholders, acting as company representative

Providing technical expertise to and working closely with the commercial and sales teams.

Staying commercially aware; possessing an understanding of relevant markets and customer economic value to aid strategy.

Contribute to improvement of process and tools, including product development and cost-out.

Fuel your passion

To be successful in this role you will:

Have a Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Science or Mathematics.

Looking for Mechanical Engineers with experience in Tendering

Be an active solution seeker who owns tasks and drives solutions with collaborative approach.

Experience in tendering is desirable.

Experience in offshore industry would be beneficial

Have strong oral and written communication skills.

Ability to coordinate several projects simultaneously, effectively managing time, output and risk.

Proven analytical and organizational ability.

Be a team player, contributes to a close engineering team dynamic.

Work in a way that works for you

We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:

One of our core values as a business is collaboration and, as such, whilst flexible work options are available, we believe there is a great benefit of having our teams co-located in one of our many office in the United Kingdom.

Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. title: Manufacturing - Fall Co-op Internship (Skaneateles, NY) 2026 Opportunities
description:
University Internships: Manufacturing – July 2026 opportunities

Would you like the opportunity to work in a global energy company?

Do you enjoy taking on challenging projects?

Join our innovative Internship Program - Start date July 13th 

The Baker Hughes Internship is designed to enable students pursuing a Bachelors’ or Masters’ degree to gain hands-on work experience as the foundation of their professional lives. Our internships will give you first-hand insights into the processes, systems, and practices that are aligned to ensure customer needs are met through flawless execution and the application of leading-edge technology.

Partner with the best

You’ll participate in focused training, and team meetings, work on projects, and present your results. During your internship, you will be supported by a buddy and your manager who will ensure you have a valuable learning experience. You can expect to receive coaching and mentoring to enable you to complete assignments and projects to develop your learning and skillset.

You will also have the opportunity to become familiar with the Health, Safety, and Environment (HS&E) and culture of Baker Hughes. as well as our strong commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion.

As an Intern, you will be responsible for:

Assisting with the day-to-day manufacturing operations, which may include monitoring equipment, overseeing processes, and ensuring production goals are met.
Participating in quality control and quality assurance processes, inspecting products for defects, and ensuring they meet industry standards and company specifications.
Identifying opportunities for process optimization, efficiency improvements, and cost reduction in manufacturing operations.
Collecting and analyzing data related to manufacturing processes, equipment performance, and product quality.
Learning and applying principles of lean manufacturing to minimize waste, improve efficiency, and enhance productivity.
Preparing reports, work instructions, and process documentation to ensure consistency and adherence to best practices.
Applying Health, Safety, and Environment (HS&E) standards and procedures in all situations to ensure compliance is maintained

Fuel your passion

To be successful in this role you will:

Be currently enrolled in a Bachelors’ or Masters’ level degree in Engineering, Technology, Mechanics, other STEM-related or business related program.
Have maintained a GPA grade greater than or equal to 3.0 out of 4.0 or the equivalent in your country
Be fluent in oral and written English and have effective communication skills
Be able to relocate for the duration of your internship (locations vary)

description:
About the position

Baker Hughes is currently hiring a Solution Architect – Process Optimization to join the team. We are looking for an experienced industry expert with a background and experience in implementing advanced process control and/or real-time optimization applications for process plants. The principal engineer will lead technical pre-sales activities followed by implementation of Cordant Process Optimization solution. Baker Hughes Cordant Process Optimization solution is based on a novel approach that combines process domain knowledge along with advanced machine learning techniques. As a Principal Engineer, you are expected to provide process and optimization domain expertise for extending existing product offerings in varied industrial processes.

Responsibilities


• Supporting the sales teams in identifying, quantifying, and presenting complex process optimization opportunities to our customers.
• Developing technical proposals for process optimization in LNG, fertilizers, gas processing, refining and olefins industry.
• Leading delivery teams during the implementation and ensuring the technical success of our solution.
• Serving as a subject matter expert in advising the product team on industry use cases, ideation, and feature implementation.
• Working with product managers, data scientists and customers to drive the adoption of AI / ML-based process optimization applications.
• Collaborating with global pre-sales and regional sales to promote and develop opportunities for the Cordant platform, including Asset Performance Management solutions.
• Staying informed of industry technology and innovation, disseminating new technology information to the Baker Hughes engineering and services teams.
• Providing coaching, technical mentoring & development of subject matter experts globally.
• Promoting a safe working environment, being responsible and driving compliance, quality & EHS culture in the organization.

Requirements


• A bachelor's degree (or higher) in Chemical Engineering or equivalent.
• Minimum of 10 years of experience implementing Advanced Process Control (APC) and/or optimization solutions.
• Experience and passion with data driven/ML based optimization models.

• Proven ability to successfully lead technical implementation of APC and/or optimization projects on complex industrial processes.
• Effective communication, interpersonal, and customer engagement skills.
• Business Acumen and the ability to influence senior-level management investment decisions.
• Proven experience working with people in an operating plant or other operational setting.
• Extensive experience communicating and working with senior executive stakeholders.

Nice-to-haves


• Expert-level knowledge of APC and optimization technologies and methodologies.
• Knowledge of plant data-driven process modelling/analytics and its limitations.
• Experience with varied and complex industrial processes, preferably LNG, cryogenic processes, syngas and/or fertilizer industries, gas processing, refining and olefins.

Mechanical Maintenance Technician
 

Are you ready to refresh your career in an exciting and rewarding opening?
 

Would you like the opportunity to work for a world class oilfield services company?

Baker Hughes is seeking a mechanical maintenance technician for - In-Line inspection (ILI) part of PPS to support our operations, the position is workshop based in Cramlington Northeast UK. We offer a very attractive compensation package for the role.
 

Take your career to the next level!
 

As a mechanical maintenance technician, you will be responsible
 

being a vital member of the PPS ILI team, the role is responsible for carrying out maintenance, preparation and mobilization of equipment to be field deployed. This includes ensuring that all equipment is fully maintained to the recognized standard as outlined in the relevant work instructions and method statements.  Delivering tools and support equipment in field successfully is a key part of PPS ILI, ability to deliver on time reports to our customers around the world so they can ensure the safe operating of oil and gas pipelines.

Although the skills required to become a fully qualified maintenance technician in the Pipeline Inspection industry are developed over time, the ideal candidate for a maintenance technician is self-driven, persistent problem solver who has a high attention to detail and enjoys working to deadlines.  This individual must be process oriented, as adherence to PPS ILI work instructions and industry standards, and should also be deeply committed to quality and maintain hydraulic, Pneumatic and mechanical support machinery

Executing flawless project mobilizations with on‑time delivery while preparing, maintaining, and deploying in‑field mechanical inspection tools.

description:

Do you relish the prospect of working with advanced cutting-edge energy technology products?

Join our Industrial & Energy Technology Team!


The Industrial & Energy Technology (IET) organization brings together incredible expertise, technologies, and services. Together we are creating a portfolio of powerful technologies and solutions. Partner with the best


As a Lead Mechanical Design Engineer – Aeroderivative Gas Turbine, you will be responsible for activities contributing to the design and development of products, solutions, and systems. Also, you will be responsible for activities linked to the technical improvement of existing products and components which requires a Comprehensive in-depth understanding of complex and highly technical concepts and principles in the own part of the function


As a Aeroderivative Mechanical Design Engineer, you will be responsible for:

Leading various projects on Aeroderivative Gas turbines Systems of various existing fleets & New products with broad scope and delivering with high impact to the business.
Being accountable for assigned Mechanical Design activities & Mechanical Durability activities on Aero Gas Turbine components and assembly design.
Responsibilities on Mechanical design includes: 3D parts modelling , performing hand calculation to arrive at suitable design, performing tolerance stack-up, defining geometrical tolerances, resolving non-conformities on manufactured parts/assembly, performing supplier qualification, managing the BOM & configurations as part of PLM.
Responsibilities on Mechanical durability includes: Understanding Interface and components design requirements, thermal/structural FEM, both static & dynamic analysis, failure analyses (HCF & LCF initiation and crack propagation)
Support component qualification through laboratory testing and field performance reviews.
Collaborate with aero and thermal teams to ensure cohesive and integrated design execution.
Coordinate global engineering teams and facilitate cross-functional technical discussions.
Manage outsourced engineering tasks and Condition-Based Maintenance (CBM) activities.
Coordinating with the global engineering team and facilitating technical discussions within Engineering, Manufacturing, Procurement, and the Supply chain.
Presenting ideas & analysis results through design reviews and drawing sign-off.
Documenting all work in design record books.
Be responsible and be forefront to innovate and penetrate the culture into the team
Develop & provide advanced technical training to team members.

Fuel your passion.

To be successful in this role you will:

Have a master’s / bachelor’s degree in mechanical/ machine design/ Aerospace engineering with a minimum 5 years of experience in Mechanical design calculations, 3D modeling, PLM, finite element analysis.
Be familiar with design and analysis tools and systems such as NX (Unigraphics), Teamcenter, ANSYS Classic, ANSYS Workbench, ANSYS Topology Optimization or similar.
Have a Deep understanding of the technical documentation, GD&T, its management process (e.g., Bill of Material) and Supply Chain Processes

Join our innovating pre-commissioning and maintenance team

Our engineered solutions for pre-commissioning, commissioning, and maintenance shutdowns include specialized services for the oil and gas, power generation, metals and mining, and other process industries.

Supervise teams and provide instructions how to safely perform intermediate hands-on technical duties for the product line services.

High school diploma or equivalent

Ability to use computer, specific knowledge in Microsoft Word, and Excel
Strong understanding of pipeline products, services and processes.
Good verbal and written communication skills.

General mechanic knowledge.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Senior Software Engineer

Are you a highly motivated, creative individual and passionate about sales and proposals?

Would you like to be a part of successful team?

Join our team!

Our Digital Solutions business provides intelligent, connected technologies to monitor and control our energy extraction assets. We provide customers with the peace of mind needed to reliably and efficiently improve their operations. Our team is building a next-generation platform of software for intelligent decisions, supporting the mission-critical requirements of customers.

Partner with the best

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will responsible for designing and programming a small module or a large component and designing a feature, set of features, or whole feature area. She/he will work independently and contribute to the immediate team and to other teams across business. She/he will Lead design discussion in a limited manner.

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will also be responsible for:

 Capturing system level requirements by brainstorming with Architects, Data Scientists, Businesses & Product Managers. Identifying the scope of the work, provide initial estimate and justify the estimate with facts.
Demonstrating the understanding of Agile software development lifecycle and able to distinguish the core inputs and outputs in each cycle.
Engaging in technical discussions; participate in technical designs and present technical ideas through white boarding. Working closely with your peers and keep engaging in a fast pace technical design and development team.
Providing guidance to a team of 2 to 3 developers with either planning and execution and/or design architecture using agile methodologies such as SCRUM.
Working with Product Line Leaders (PLLs) to understand product requirements & vision. Demonstrating the ability to make informed technology choices after due diligence and impact assessment.
Executing in a fast-paced delivery mode and focus in delivering tasks to meet the product release goal. Maintaining code quality through best practices, unit testing and code quality automation. Also, Seek and provide feedback on design and development.
Possessing advanced domain knowledge and show great customer focus. Expert in processes / methodologies and Skilled in build, release & deployment processes.

Fuel your passion!

To be successful in this role you will:

Have 6+ years of hands-on Desktop and/or Web application development using .Net.
Have proficiency in development using C#, WCF Services, ASP.Net Core. Have proficiency in Database (MySQL, PostgreSQL).
Have hands on experience in backend like Session management, caching, algorithms & data structures, secure coding, etc.
Proficiency in development on Microservices & RESTful Web services. Hands-on experience on data communication protocols like AMQP/MQTT & message brokers like RabbitMQ/Kafka etc. 
Flexible to learn and develop in any language/technology/tools as per the project’s needs. Open to work on building Tools or Automation of developed features to own it end to end. Have good Problem-solving skills, Collaboration, Influencing and articulation.
Deep understanding and hands on experience of Programming concepts: OOPS, best practices, refactoring, maintainable/reusable code, Design principles and patterns, Architecture, TDD, Unit testing, debugging, automation.  
Can break down problems and estimate time for development tasks. Be a graduate of Computer Science or in STEM Majors (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math).

Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive.

Join a dynamic UX team that brings energy, curiosity, and craft to everything we design. 2–4 years of professional experience in UX design for web/mobile products.

Foundation in UX principles, user research methodologies, information architecture, and interaction design.

description:
Product Manager - Customer Qualifications

Do you enjoy being part of team that provides high-quality Product Management for our customers?

Are you passionate about defining, leading, and executing the customer qualification strategy?

Join a team that delivers essential projects

Role Purpose

 The Product Manager – Customer Qualification is responsible for defining, leading, and executing the customer qualification strategy for subsea equipment portfolios. The role ensures that customer requirements, operating conditions, and regulatory expectations are rigorously understood, translated into product and system requirements, and validated through structured qualification, testing, and evidence generation.

This role sits at the intersection of customers, engineering, operations, and commercial teams—reducing technical and commercial risk, accelerating time to market, and enabling confident customer adoption of subsea technologies.

Fuel your passion

As a Product Manager, you will be responsible for:

Leading customer qualification strategies for subsea equipment across new developments, upgrades, and life-of-field applications
Engaging directly with operators, EPCs, and partners to understand field conditions, performance requirements, and acceptance criteria
Own customer requirement definitions (URS/CRS) and ensure traceability into product specifications and qualification plans
Acting as the primary product interface during technical clarifications, bid phases, and early project execution.
Technology Readiness mapping against API requirements and orders TAM
Defining qualification roadmaps aligned to industry standards (e.g. API, ISO, DNV) and customer-specific requirements
Working with engineering to scope qualification activities including analysis, testing, trials, and field validation
Ensuring qualification evidence is robust, auditable, and reusable across customers and regions
Balancing standardization vs. customization to maximize portfolio leverage while meeting customer needs
Governance of standardized positions with customers with the aim to progressively reduce the amount of documents and Es&Qs that have to be assessed on tenders and also that require repeated approval during project execution by having them in pre-approved and managed in centralized repositories.
Coordinating closely with engineering, manufacturing, supply chain, quality, and project teams to execute qualification plans
Partner with sales and commercial teams to support tenders, technical positioning, and customer risk reduction
Driving internal alignment on customer acceptance criteria, deviations, and risk mitigation strategies
Feeding customer qualification insights into product roadmaps and future development priorities
Identifying recurring customer requirements and opportunities to standardize qualification assets
Supporting continuous improvement of qualification processes, tools, and governance 

Fuel your passion

To be successful in this role, you should have:

Strong subsea engineering, product management, systems engineering, or technical project roles
Strong exposure to subsea equipment (e.g. trees, manifolds, controls, umbilicals, connectors, or similar)
Demonstrated experience with product or system qualification in regulated, safety-critical environments
Strong understanding of customer qualification, verification, and validation principles
Direct customer-facing experience in technical or commercial contexts

description:
Mechanic / Industrial Maintenance Technician

Would you like to work for a forward-thinking technology company?

Do you enjoy technical challenges?

Join our Maintenance Team

Partner with the best

The Mechanic / Industrial Maintenance Technician will provide maintain and repair equipment for Artificial Lift Services (ALS) at our facility in Claremore, OK.

Fuel your passion

As Mechanic / Industrial Maintenance Technician, you will be responsible for:

Ensuring operation of machinery and mechanical equipment by completing preventive maintenance requirements on engines, motors, pneumatic tools, conveyor systems, and production machines; following diagrams, sketches, operations manuals, manufacturer's instructions, and engineering specifications; troubleshooting malfunctions.

Locating sources of problems by observing mechanical devices in operation; listening for problems; using precision measuring and testing instruments.

Removing defective parts by dismantling devices; using hoists, cranes, and hand and power tools; examining form and texture of parts.

Determining changes in dimensional requirements of parts by inspecting used parts; using rules, calipers, micrometers, and other measuring instruments.

Adjusting functional parts of devices and control instruments by using hand tools, levels, plumb bobs, and straightedges.

Controlling downtime by informing production workers of routine preventive maintenance techniques; monitoring compliance.

Fabricating repair parts by using machine shop instrumentation and equipment.

Maintaining equipment, parts, and supplies inventories by checking stock to determine inventory level; anticipating needed equipment, parts, and supplies; placing and expediting orders; verifying receipt.

Conserving maintenance resources by using equipment and supplies as needed to accomplish job results.

Providing mechanical maintenance information by answering questions and requests.

Preparing mechanical maintenance reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends.

Maintaining technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing technical publications; establishing personal networks.

Maintaining continuity among work teams by documenting and communicating actions, irregularities, and continuing needs.

Maintaining safe and clean working environment by complying with procedures, rules, and regulations.

Contributing to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.

To be successful in this role you will have:

Have High School Diploma or GED.2+ years’ experience.

title: Well Engineer Drilling - Integrated Solutions/ Well Engineering
description:
Well Engineer Drilling - Integrated Solutions

Impulsando la excelencia operativa mediante ingeniería de pozos y ejecución segura, eficiente y alineada con estándares globales

Transformando el desempeño del pozo con diseño técnico especializado, integridad operativa y optimización continua en soluciones integradas

Asóciate con los mejores

Baker Hughes es una empresa global de tecnología energética que opera en más de 120 países. El equipo de Integrated Solutions impulsa resultados superiores mediante la integración de ingeniería, servicios, tecnología y ejecución en campo. Con un enfoque en estándares internacionales, cumplimiento regulatorio y excelencia operativa, el equipo proporciona soporte técnico integral para la construcción, completación, intervención y abandono de pozos, maximizando el valor para nuestros clientes.

Impulsa tu pasión

El Well Engineer Drilling - Integrated Solutions ejecuta todas las actividades de ingeniería de pozos dentro de un proyecto o Centro de Excelencia, siguiendo los lineamientos del Integrated Solutions Management System, las regulaciones locales e internacionales y los requisitos del cliente. Este rol proporciona soporte técnico desde la etapa conceptual y de licitación, hasta el inicio, ejecución y cierre del proyecto.

Durante la fase de licitación, además de las actividades de ingeniería, el ingeniero apoya a los equipos comerciales y de adquisiciones. En las etapas de planificación y ejecución, interactúa con múltiples partes interesadas para garantizar seguridad, integridad del pozo y eficiencia operativa. El ingeniero asegura que el diseño del pozo, el programa operativo y los procedimientos detallados estén correctamente preparados y entregados al equipo de ejecución. Es un contribuyente clave durante la ejecución del proyecto, proporcionando seguimiento, soporte técnico y acompañamiento operativo.

Como Well Engineer Drilling - Integrated Solutions, serás responsable de:

• Desarrollar y preparar el diseño básico del pozo, los requisitos técnicos y los planes operativos para cumplir los objetivos técnicos y financieros de Baker Hughes y del cliente.
• Asegurar que todas las actividades de ingeniería cumplan con las políticas y procedimientos de HSE, promoviendo la cultura de seguridad mediante prácticas de trabajo seguras.
• Participar en el proceso de preparación de ofertas (tenders) aportando la ingeniería de pozos requerida.
• Participar en presentaciones y reuniones con clientes (incluye posibles viajes a otras ubicaciones).
• Preparar el diseño del pozo, el plan del pozo y los procedimientos operativos para construcción, completación, intervención y/o abandono.
• Definir los servicios técnicos y los requerimientos de terceros necesarios para la ejecución del proyecto.
• Preparar estimaciones de tiempo y costo operativo.
• Elaborar, junto con equipos internos y externos, el registro de riesgos y los planes de contingencia.
• Preparar y participar en revisiones técnicas, peer reviews, peer assists y actividades de aseguramiento de calidad.
• Monitorear el progreso diario de los trabajos y el gasto operativo.
• Evaluar la aplicación de mejores prácticas y nuevas tecnologías en las operaciones de Integrated Solutions.
• Comunicarse eficazmente con los equipos de sitio y stakeholders del proyecto, recomendando acciones para asegurar una ejecución impecable.
• Monitorear KPIs técnicos y operativos, comparándolos con pozos de referencia y objetivos definidos.
• Participar en investigaciones de análisis de causa raíz (RCA).
• Preparar reportes técnicos del proyecto, incluyendo End of Well Report, After Action Reviews y lecciones aprendidas.
• Cumplir con los lineamientos de gestión de datos establecidos por Integrated Solutions.
• Mantenerse actualizado sobre avances tecnológicos y de ingeniería mediante participación en sociedades profesionales, redes, talleres, seminarios y cursos.

Para tener éxito en este rol deberás:

• Contar con título universitario en Ingeniería de Petróleos, Ingeniería Mecánica o Ingeniería Química; idealmente con maestría en Petróleo/Gas o Ingeniería de Pozos.
• Tener más de 5 años de experiencia relevante en construcción de pozos, completaciones, intervención y/o optimización, incluyendo áreas como brocas, diseño de BHA, simulaciones de ingeniería, operaciones en campo o preparación de programas/diseños.
• Poseer habilidades interpersonales para trabajar con equipos multiculturales y multidisciplinarios, influir efectivamente y generar credibilidad con líderes senior.
• Demostrar excelentes habilidades analíticas y de resolución de problemas, incluso con información incompleta.
• Contar con excelentes habilidades de comunicación oral y escrita en inglés, capaces de sintetizar temas complejos en mensajes claros.
• Manejar MS Office, Power BI u otras herramientas analíticas, así como software de ingeniería de pozos (hidráulica, torque y arrastre, diseño básico de casing).
• Tener conocimientos o exposición a perforación rotatoria convencional, pozos horizontales o multilaterales, perforación en pads y no convencionales.
• Contar con conocimiento en control de pozos y fundamentos de geomecánica.

Trabaja de la manera que mejor funcione para ti

Reconocemos que cada persona trabaja de manera diferente y que todos buscamos condiciones que nos permitan rendir al máximo. En este rol, se pueden ofrecer patrones de trabajo flexibles según las necesidades operativas.

Uno de nuestros valores fundamentales es la colaboración y, aunque existen opciones de trabajo flexible, creemos que existe un gran beneficio en que nuestros equipos estén co‑localizados en una de nuestras oficinas.

Trabajar con nosotros

Nuestra gente está en el corazón de lo que hacemos en Baker Hughes. Sabemos que somos mejores cuando todos están desarrollados, comprometidos y pueden aportar su auténtico yo al trabajo. Invertimos en el bienestar de nuestra fuerza laboral, capacitamos y recompensamos el talento, y desarrollamos líderes en todos los niveles para sacar lo mejor de cada uno.

Trabajar para ti

Nuestras innovaciones han transformado la energía durante más de un siglo. Para seguir avanzando, sabemos que debemos impulsar el cambio hoy. Priorizamos recompensar a quienes lo impulsan, con un paquete que refleja cuánto valoramos su contribución. Al unirte, puedes esperar:

• Políticas contemporáneas de equilibrio vida‑trabajo y actividades de bienestar
• Opciones integrales de atención médica privada
• Programas de seguro de vida y discapacidad
• Programas financieros personalizados
• Beneficios adicionales voluntarios o electivos

title: Customer Order Engineering - Mechanical
description:
Customer Order Engineering - Mechanical

Are you an experienced Customer Order Engineer looking for a new Role?

Do you enjoy being part of a successful team?

Baker Hughes is currently hiring a Customer Order Engineering - Mechanical to join the team. We are looking for an experienced industry expert with a background and experience in customer specifications in detail, understanding critical project requirements, and deriving all requirements for the design of various Mechanical Auxiliaries. Baker Hughes Cordant Process Optimization solution is based on a novel approach that combines process domain knowledge along with advanced machine learning techniques. In this role, you are expected to provide process and optimization domain expertise for extending existing product offerings in varied industrial processes.


Join our innovative Engineering Team!
You will be integrated in the multidisciplinary engineering team located in Bangalore & Hyderabad, working exclusively for Thermodyn business. Thermodyn is a French subsidiary of the worldwide company Baker Hughes, designing, producing, testing and installing centrifugal compressors and medium power steam turbines for the industrial and energy sector customers.

Innovation is part of our DNA. We provide steam turbines for propulsion of nuclear submarines of the French NAVY. We are worldwide leader of integrated compression with zero-emission, using state of the art technologies like high-speed induction motors and magnetic bearings.
The company exists since more than 100 years. We have a fleet of more than 1000 compressors and steam turbines, installed worldwide on which we partly provide maintenance, operational technical support and system upgrades.
Our goal is clear: we are taking energy forward.


Role Summary:
Baker Hughes has a new opportunity for Lead Auxiliary Mechanical Piping Engineer to join the team in Bengaluru, India.


Roles and Responsibilities
• Going through customer specifications in detail, understanding critical project requirements, and deriving all requirements for the design of various Mechanical Auxiliaries according to BH best practices
• Being responsible for the skid package design of Compressor & Steam turbine packages, including package piping & support design, locking assembly, et,c with due consideration to ergonomics, accessibility, and maintenance.
• Reviewing engineering drawings & 3D models. Also, Performing Structural analysis of baseplates using FEA tools [BDOT - BH Tool].
• Assigning & reviewing static and dynamic analysis when the same is performed with Ansys software by external suppliers, and creating drawings for the baseplate.
• Being responsible for the design of various external BOP skids that include Rundown oil tanks, and Seal gas treatment skids in collaboration with external OEM vendors
• Creating Piping line specifications using PUMA (BH Tool).
• Lead multiple complex projects and present to leadership on project status, risks and mitigations.
• Collaborating with external engineering suppliers in the creation of basic engineering drawings of various Mechanical Auxiliaries items, foundation drawings, and managing 3D models.
• Extending support to the Manufacturing Cell during machine assembly on the Shop floor and providing quick resolution to Non-conformity if generated.
• Extending support to FSE/ FPE during the installation & commissioning of the machine at the site
• Delivers products as part of a team. Works with cross functional teams.
 

Fuel your passion

To be successful in this role you will:
• Have a BE/BTech in Mechanical/Industrial Engineering
• Have 6+ years of experience in the Packaging of rotating equipment, auxiliary equipment design, piping & support design/ analysis, and structural analysis.
• Have knowledge of piping design for ASME B31.1 & 31.3, Lube oil System sizing to API 614 code requirement.
• Be Proficient in NX modules; modelling, drafting, routing & assembly.
• Have hands-on 3D modelling/detailing tools like UG NX, Autocad, and Analysis software like Ansys, Caesar, etc
• Be able to read & understand engineering documents (like Piping & Instrument diagram P & ID, technical data sheets, and O&M manuals) and site service requests.
• Knowledge in Materials Engineering and Turbomachinery.


Desired Characteristics
• Strong oral and written communication skills. Strong interpersonal and leadership skills. Ability to influence others and lead small teams. Lead initiatives of moderate scope and impact. Ability to coordinate several projects simultaneously. Effective problem identification and solution skills. Proven analytical and organizational ability.
• Experience in O&G industry preferred, not mandatory.


Work in a way that works for you


We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:
• Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive.


Working with us


Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.


The Good Stuff


Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:
• Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities
• Comprehensive private medical care options
• A safety net of life insurance and disability programs
• Tailored financial programs.

title: Engenheiro de Manutenção Mecânica
description:
Você é Engenheiro de Manutenção Mecânica e está em busca de uma nova oportunidade?

Você tem paixão por fornecer todos os tipos de soluções em engenharia mecânica?

Be part of a successful team!

Na Baker Hughes nosso propósito é claro. Levamos a energia adiante – tornando-a mais segura, mais limpa e mais eficiente para as pessoas e para o planeta. Nossa equipe de Flexible Pipe Systems oferece soluções de produção confiáveis ​​e robustas para a vida útil do campo. Desenvolvemos e fornecemos risers de tubos flexíveis, jumpers, flowlines e linhas de transferência de fluidos que ultrapassam os limites operacionais de suas contrapartes de aço carbono.

Faça parceria com os melhores

O Engenheiro de Manutenção Mecânica será responsável pela estratégia para garantir a máxima disponibilidade, confiabilidade e segurança de ativos (máquinas e equipamentos), minimizando paradas não planejadas e reduzindo custos. Ele planeja, desenvolve e supervisiona estratégias de manutenção preventiva, preditiva e corretiva, analisando falhas, liderando implementação de projetos e otimizando processos. Atuará com equipes multidisciplinares para garantir o sucesso das operações.

Como Engenheiro de Manutenção Mecânica, você será responsável por:

Planejar, coordenar e acompanhar atividades de manutenção preventiva, preditiva e corretiva em equipamentos e sistemas mecânicos.
Analisar falhas recorrentes em equipamentos, conduzindo análises de causa raiz (RCA) e propondo ações corretivas e melhorias permanentes.
Desenvolver, revisar e otimizar planos de manutenção, rotinas, procedimentos técnicos e instruções de trabalho.
Garantir a disponibilidade, confiabilidade e performance dos ativos mecânicos, alinhados aos indicadores de manutenção (MTBF, MTTR, backlog etc.).
Atuar na engenharia de manutenção, propondo melhorias de projeto, modificações de equipamentos e padronizações técnicas.
Apoiar o planejamento e controle da manutenção (PCM) na elaboração de cronogramas, recursos, materiais e paradas programadas.
Gerenciar contratos e acompanhar atividades de fornecedores e prestadores de serviço, assegurando qualidade, prazo e segurança.
Elaborar e analisar relatórios técnicos, indicadores de desempenho e apresentações gerenciais.
Assegurar o cumprimento de normas técnicas, requisitos legais, padrões de segurança e meio ambiente aplicáveis às atividades de manutenção.
Participar de comissionamento, start-up e aceitação técnica de novos equipamentos e projetos.
Coordenar e liderar projetos mecânicos, desde a fase de concepção até a execução e entrega final, assegurando o cumprimento de prazos, orçamento e qualidade.
Contribuir para a gestão de sobressalentes, especificação técnica de materiais e suporte ao processo de compras.
Atuar no controle de custos de manutenção, buscando otimização de recursos e redução de custos operacionais.
Treinar e orientar equipes de manutenção quanto a boas práticas, procedimentos e uso adequado dos equipamentos.
Definir e revisar estratégias de manutenção (RCM, FMEA, manutenção baseada em condição, run-to-failure).
Avaliar criticidade de ativos, classificando equipamentos conforme impacto em segurança, produção, meio ambiente e custo.
Desenvolver e acompanhar KPIs de manutenção, promovendo planos de ação para melhoria de desempenho.
Liderar ou participar de investigações de falhas críticas e eventos de alto impacto operacional.
Elaborar especificações técnicas para aquisição, reforma ou substituição de equipamentos mecânicos.
Contribuir para programas de excelência operacional e melhoria contínua (Lean, TPM, Six Sigma).
Apoiar auditorias internas e externas relacionadas à manutenção, confiabilidade e integridade de ativos.
Realizar acompanhamento de projetos CAPEX.
Avaliar riscos técnicos associados a mudanças operacionais, apoiando processos de MOC (Management of Change).
Desenvolver estudos técnicos para aumento de disponibilidade, redução de falhas e melhoria da segurança operacional.

Alimente sua paixão

Para ser bem-sucedido nesta função você precisa:

Formação superior completa em Engenharia Mecânica.
Conhecimento avançado em projetos mecânicos.
Capacidade de leitura e interpretação de desenhos técnicos.
Experiência na gestão de projetos e cronogramas,
Experiência como facilitador na condução de análises de falhas e na aplicação de técnicas como 5 Por quês, Apollo, Ishikawa, árvore de falhas, metodologia A3 etc.
Forte capacidade de resolução de problemas
Conhecimento e habilidade em softwares como: Excel, AutoCAD, Ansys, SolidWorks, IBM Maximo e Power BI.
Inglês avançado.

Além disso, é extremamente importante possuir essas competências comportamentais:

Proatividade e autonomia para resolver problemas e liderar iniciativas.
Atenção aos detalhes e foco na excelência dos resultados.
Capacidade de trabalhar sob pressão e cumprir prazos rigorosos.
Facilidade para adaptação a novas tecnologias e ambientes dinâmicos.
Habilidades de comunicação para liderar e integrar equipes multifuncionais.

Trabalhe de uma maneira que funcione para você

Reconhecemos que cada pessoa é diferente e que a maneira como as pessoas desejam trabalhar e oferecer o melhor é diferente para cada pessoa também. Nesta função, podemos oferecer o seguinte padrão de trabalho:

Disponibilidade para trabalhar presencialmente em horário administrativo.

Trabalhando conosco

Nosso pessoal está no centro do que fazemos na Baker Hughes. Sabemos que somos melhores quando todas as nossas pessoas são desenvolvidas, engajadas e capazes de trazer toda a sua autenticidade para o trabalho. Investimos na saúde e no bem-estar de nossa força de trabalho, treinamos e recompensamos talentos e desenvolvemos líderes em todos os níveis para trazer o melhor de cada um.

Trabalhando para você

Nossas invenções revolucionaram a energia por mais de um século. Mas para seguir em frente amanhã, sabemos que temos que ultrapassar os limites hoje. Priorizamos recompensar aqueles que adotam a mudança com um pacote que reflete o quanto valorizamos sua contribuição. Junte-se a nós, e você pode esperar:

Políticas contemporâneas de equilíbrio entre vida profissional e pessoal e atividades de bem-estar
Opções abrangentes de assistência médica privada
Rede de segurança de programas de seguro de vida e deficiência
Programas financeiros personalizados
Benefícios adicionais eleitos ou voluntários

Are you a Design Engineer looking for a new direction, willing to contribute to the global energy transition?

Join our Team!

Baker Hughes is the leading energy technology company, who delivers across the energy value chain through our market-leading business segments. Built on a century of experience and conducting business in over 120 countries. Our innovative technologies and services are taking energy forward! Making it safer, cleaner and more efficient for people and the planet.

Partner with the best

As Shaft Line Design Engineer, you will be responsible for the shaft line configuration conceptual design (mechanical drive and power generation applications) and the selection of the driver-driven machine connecting elements, such as: fixed and variable speed ratio gear boxes, turning gear systems, starting systems, clutches, couplings and coupling guards. You will be responsible of the train dynamic study such as torsional analysis, train lateral analysis, as well as the identification of system and component requirements that might derive from those analysis and finally the preparation of the alignment specs. In this role you will be involved in the requisition activities, interpretate customer technical specifications, having opportunity of connections with customers to better understand their needs and identify the best solutions to satisfy their requirements. You could be involved in support standardization in synergy with product strategies as offers supporting ITO team for what concern the shaft line components/discipline.
 

As a Design Engineer will typically work independently but within a team framework, to develop and support products within the Technology groups and to achieve objectives.

Work is still performed within defined parameters and skills are improved upon for making work decisions, applying concepts to issues of moderate complexity, and resolving issues through immediate action or short-term planning.

This level requires a greater knowledge and demonstration of competencies to use the tools, materials, products, and processes in the development and support of the technology.

Mechanical engineering requires an understanding of core disciplines including mechanics, structural dynamics, rotor dynamics, thermodynamics, fluid and aero dynamics, materials science and structural analysis.

Delivers engineering efforts related to the design of new products and services for customer projects.

Delivery of projects usually consists of a cross-disciplinary organization executing projects to support technology portfolio strategy, coordinating closely with Discipline, Research, and Testing teams as needed.

Providing leadership during the project review to ensure that all technical risk points and risk mitigations are properly incorporated in the development of the scope, cost and proposal.

Leading and coordinating with interfacing organizations such as Manufacturing, Sourcing, Services, and Regional hubs, effectively communicate technical and financial aspects of team activities vertically and horizontally in the organization.

Master's degree in Mechanical, Energy, Aerospace, Industrial Engineering

Pasantías Universitarias: Ingeniería y Tecnología – Oportunidades 2026

 

¿Te gustaría tener la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa energética global? 

 

¿Te gusta asumir proyectos desafiantes? 

 

Únete a nuestro innovador Programa de Pasantías 

 

La pasantía Baker Hughes está diseñada para permitir que los estudiantes que cursan una licenciatura obtengan experiencia laboral práctica como base de sus vidas profesionales. Nuestras pasantías te brindarán información de primera mano sobre los procesos, sistemas y prácticas que están alineados para garantizar que se satisfagan las necesidades del cliente a través de una ejecución impecable y la aplicación de tecnología de vanguardia. 

 

Ubicaciones:  

 

MX-Tabasco-Villahermosa-1st Floor 101-B, Torre IST, Calle Paseo la Choca 

MX-CMP-CIUDAD DEL CARMEN-CARRETERA FEDERAL 180 EN EL POLIGONO 

 

 

Asóciate con los mejores 

 

Participarás en capacitaciones enfocadas y reuniones de equipo, trabajarás en proyectos y presentarás tus resultados. Durante tu pasantía, contarás con el apoyo de un compañero y tu gerente que se asegurarán de que tengas una valiosa experiencia de aprendizaje. Puedes esperar recibir entrenamiento y tutoría que te permitirá completar tareas y proyectos para desarrollar tu aprendizaje y habilidades. 

También tendrás la oportunidad de familiarizarte con la salud, seguridad y el medio ambiente (HSE) y la cultura de Baker Hughes. Así como nuestro fuerte compromiso con la diversidad, la equidad y la inclusión.  

 

Como pasante, serás responsable de: 

 

Completar proyectos internos para ofrecer resultados a los clientes e identificar mejoras comerciales 

Ayudar a los ingenieros o tecnólogos con proyectos en curso mediante la realización de investigaciones, análisis de datos y la prestación de soporte técnico. 

Participar en el proceso de diseño, crear dibujos o prototipos, y contribuir al desarrollo de nuevos productos o tecnologías. 

Mantener registros precisos de experimentos, diseños e información relacionada con el proyecto, y preparar informes o documentación según sea necesario. 

Colaborar en tareas de desarrollo de software, codificación o programación con ingenieros. 

Trabajar como parte de un equipo y comunicarse de manera efectiva con colegas, ingenieros y supervisores para lograr los objetivos del proyecto, e identificar y abordar problemas técnicos o desafíos que surjan durante los proyectos y proponer soluciones. 

Aplicar las normas y procedimientos de Salud, Seguridad y Medio Ambiente (HS&E) en todas las situaciones para garantizar que se mantenga el cumplimiento. 

 

Alimenta tu pasión 

 

Para tener éxito en este rol, deberás: 

 

Estar actualmente inscrito/a en una licenciatura en Ingeniería Petrolera, con fecha de graduación a partir de Diciembre 2026. 

Contar con inglés avanzado (oral y escrito) y buenas habilidades de comunicación. 

Tener disponibilidad para reubicarse durante la duración de la pasantía (las ubicaciones pueden variar). 

Contar con autorización legal para trabajar en el país donde se realiza la pasantía, sin necesidad de patrocinio ni restricciones de tiempo. 

Tener conocimientos en Microsoft 365. 

 

Trabaje de una manera que funcione para usted 

 

Reconocemos que cada persona es diferente y que la forma en que las personas quieren trabajar y dar lo mejor de sí mismas es diferente para todos. En este rol, es posible que podamos ofrecer patrones de trabajo flexibles. Habla con nosotros sobre las opciones de trabajo que deseas cuando presentes tu solicitud. 

 

Trabajar con nosotros 

 

Trabajar en Baker Hughes significa estar a la vanguardia de la transición energética. Nuestra gente es diversa, ambiciosa y colaborativa. Tenemos la misión de redefinir el sector energético liberando el poder de la ingeniería, los datos y la ciencia.

title: Obráběč kovů - karuselář (m,ž)
description:
Obráběč kovů – karuselář 

Hledáte práci, kde vaše technická zručnost a přesnost přímo ovlivňují kvalitu výroby?

Chcete pracovat na velkých karuselech a podílet se na výrobě klíčových komponent?

Spolupracujte s těmi nejlepšími

Baker Hughes je přední globální energeticko‑technologická společnost, která poskytuje inovativní řešení zvyšující bezpečnost, čistotu a efektivitu energie napříč celým hodnotovým řetězcem. Společnost působí ve více než 120 zemích a kombinuje hluboké znalosti odvětví s pokročilým inženýrstvím a digitálními technologiemi na podporu výroby energie, její transformace a dekarbonizace. S více než stoletou tradicí spolupracuje Baker Hughes se zákazníky v ropném a plynárenském průmyslu, v průmyslových odvětvích i na rozvíjejících se energetických trzích, aby urychlila pokrok směrem k udržitelnější energetické budoucnosti.

Rozviňte svou vášeň

Jako obráběč kovů – karuselář budete hrát klíčovou roli v přesném obrábění velkých kovových dílů na moderních karuselových strojích. Budete zodpovědný za správné upnutí a ustavení obrobků, jejich přesné obrábění podle technické dokumentace a kontrolu kvality hotových dílů. Vaše práce bude zásadní pro plynulý chod výroby a dodržení vysokých standardů přesnosti. Součástí role je také kompletní obsluha karuselů různých velikostí, práce s výkresovou dokumentací a aktivní podpora výrobního týmu při řešení technických úkolů.

Jako obráběč kovů – karuselář budete:

Upínat a přesně ustavovat obrobky

Obrábět díly na karuselových strojích

Pracovat s technickou dokumentací a výkresy

Obsluhovat karusely o velikosti 5 m, 2,5 m a 1 m

Kontrolovat kvalitu provedené práce

Abyste byli v této roli úspěšní, budete potřebovat:
Vyučení v oboru obráběč kovů (nebo odpovídající praxi)
Znalost NC systému Sinumerik Siemens – výhodou
Ochotu pracovat ve třísměnném provozu
Schopnost číst technickou dokumentaci – nutností
Komunikativnost a schopnost pracovat v češtině

Pracujte způsobem, který vám vyhovuje

Uznáváme, že každý je jiný a že každý chce pracovat a podávat nejlepší výkon jiným způsobem. V této roli můžeme nabídnout následující flexibilní pracovní uspořádání:

Možnosti flexibilní práce proberte prosím s náborářem.

Spolupráce s námi

Naši lidé jsou srdcem všeho, co v Baker Hughes děláme. Víme, že jsme lepší, když se všichni naši zaměstnanci rozvíjejí, jsou angažovaní a mohou být sami sebou. Investujeme do jejich zdraví a pohody, školíme je, odměňujeme talent a rozvíjíme lídry na všech úrovních, abychom ze sebe navzájem dostali to nejlepší.

Co nabízíme vám

Naše vynálezy mění energetiku už více než století. Abychom mohli pokračovat i zítra, musíme posouvat hranice už dnes. Odměňujeme ty, kteří přijímají změny, balíčkem benefitů, který odráží, jak moc si jejich přínosu vážíme. Můžete očekávat:

Pracovní doba 7,5 hodiny denně

Příspěvek na doplňkové penzijní pojištění 15 600 Kč ročně

Zajímavé platové ohodnocení a čtvrtletní bonusy (dle splnění firemních a osobních cílů)

Směnný provoz s nadstandardními příplatky

Pravidelné každoroční navyšování mzdy

Firemní vzdělávání (povinná školení i rozvoj hrazený zaměstnavatelem)

Vlastní jídelna, výběr ze 6 jídel

Stravenkový paušál 115 Kč za odpracovanou směnu

5 týdnů dovolené

Flexi passy (volnočasové poukázky)

Výborná dostupnost MHD

Stabilní zaměstnání ve firmě s dlouhou tradicí

The Baker Hughes internal title for this role is: Machinist VI

Are you interested in Polymer and materials functions?

Join Our Successful Team!

 

Baker Hughes (BH) is the world’s first and only fullstream provider of integrated oilfield products, services and digital solutions. The Flexible Pipe System (FPS) Offshore business within BH is a leading industry supplier of unbonded flexible pipelines to API 17J with a 25+ year track record in the supply of flexible pipeline riser and flowline system globally to a range of international customers. The FPS business has 2 main manufacturing and engineering hubs in Newcastle Upon Tyne (United Kingdom) and Niteroi (Brazil) with engineering offices co-located on both sites.  

Partner with the best 

This role is within the Brazilian materials team located at Retic facility but is expected to form strong links with wider Technology and Supply chain organization across both of our manufacturing sites and our engineering office. 

As Senior Polymer Engineer, you will be responsible for: 

Supporting testing programmes with internal test facilities & external test houses including subsequent analysis and interpretation of test data for appropriate action and reporting. 

Generating material qualification documents, procurement specification and technical reports related to full polymeric product range including extruded materials and tapes. 

Support to polymer technology queries and clarifications as and when required from both internal/external customers 

Carrying out investigation, analysis and reporting of product and process failures in support of both internal/external customers 

Providing a materials consultancy service, as required, to internal & external customers 

Supporting the full lifecycle of project execution from participation in core business bid kick-off meetings and project handover meetings to facilitate knowledge transfer of industry requirements through to manufacturing technical support and final customer acceptance. 

Existing Vendor technical support, develop and maintain technical liaison with vendors as part of continuous improvement and respond to vendor polymer technology queries and clarifications as and when required 

Undertaking specific activities related to specialist technical areas including but not limited to chemical compatibility evaluations for polymer exposures and permeation assessments for polymers for a range of gas species. 

Fuel your passion  

To be successful in this role you will: 

Hold a BSc in Polymer Materials Science or a related Engineering degree with specialization in Materials or Polymer science through formal post graduate education (or college qualification) and formal training and experiential learning. 

Discrete experience of permeation of gases (H2S, CO2 etc) through polymers and associated elements of chemical thermodynamics (Fugacity and consumption) would be considered beneficial but not essential to this role. 

Worked at an engineering level, demonstrating an increased level of engineering practice and responsibility, development of others and showing leadership. 

Work in a way that works for you

44 hours per week

Managing RIF execution, investigations, and compliance actions.

Ensuring alignment with local, regional, and global P&C strategies.

Change Leadership

Ensuring minimal disruption and strong local adoption of change initiatives.

Work‑life balance programs and well-being initiatives

Chcete se podílet na výrobě generátorů?

Chcete pracovat v Plzni?

Spolupracujte s těmi nejlepšími

Baker Hughes je přední globální energeticko‑technologická společnost, která poskytuje inovativní řešení zvyšující bezpečnost, čistotu a efektivitu energie napříč celým hodnotovým řetězcem. Společnost působí ve více než 120 zemích a kombinuje hluboké znalosti odvětví s pokročilým inženýrstvím a digitálními technologiemi na podporu výroby energie, její transformace a dekarbonizace. S více než stoletou tradicí spolupracuje Baker Hughes se zákazníky v ropném a plynárenském průmyslu, v průmyslových odvětvích i na rozvíjejících se energetických trzích, aby urychlila pokrok směrem k udržitelnější energetické budoucnosti.

Rozviňte svou vášeň

Jako Elektromechanik budete mít na starosti provádění vysokonapěťových zkoušek elektrických komponentů podle stanovených postupů a norem, stejně jako obsluhu a údržbu zkušebních zařízení včetně měřicí techniky a ochranných systémů. Součástí práce je také diagnostika a vyhodnocování výsledků testů, pečlivé vedení záznamů a příprava protokolů. Důležitým úkolem bude zajištění bezpečnosti práce při manipulaci s vysokým napětím a dodržování interních předpisů. Nedílnou součástí pozice je i údržba a kalibrace zařízení.

Provádění vysokonapěťových zkoušek elektrických komponentů dle stanovených postupů a norem

Obsluha a údržba zkušebních zařízení včetně měřicí techniky a ochranných systémů

Diagnostika a vyhodnocování výsledků testů, vedení záznamů a příprava protokolů

Zajištění bezpečnosti práce při manipulaci s vysokým napětím a dodržování interních předpisů

Údržba a kalibrace zařízení, pravidelná kontrola funkčnosti a spolehlivosti přístrojů

Naši lidé jsou srdcem všeho, co v Baker Hughes děláme. Víme, že jsme lepší, když se všichni naši zaměstnanci rozvíjejí, jsou angažovaní a mohou být sami sebou. Investujeme do jejich zdraví a pohody, školíme je, odměňujeme talent a rozvíjíme lídry na všech úrovních, abychom ze sebe navzájem dostali to nejlepší.

Chcete pracovat v Plzni?

Spolupracujte s těmi nejlepšími

Baker Hughes je přední globální energeticko‑technologická společnost, která poskytuje inovativní řešení zvyšující bezpečnost, čistotu a efektivitu energie napříč celým hodnotovým řetězcem. Společnost působí ve více než 120 zemích a kombinuje hluboké znalosti odvětví s pokročilým inženýrstvím a digitálními technologiemi na podporu výroby energie, její transformace a dekarbonizace. S více než stoletou tradicí spolupracuje Baker Hughes se zákazníky v ropném a plynárenském průmyslu, v průmyslových odvětvích i na rozvíjejících se energetických trzích, aby urychlila pokrok směrem k udržitelnější energetické budoucnosti.

Rozviňte svou vášeň

Jako Nákupčí budete vyhledávat a kvalifikovat dodavatele pro globální projekty, včetně přípravy podkladů pro seniorní kolegy k vyjednávání a implementaci dodavatelských smluv. Součástí role je spolupráce na tvorbě nákupních strategií pro jednotlivé projekty a komodity a také administrativní podpora projektového řízení z pohledu nákupu v úzké kooperaci s Engineeringem, Výrobou a projektovým manažerem. Nedílnou částí práce je reporting a správa dat v informačním systému, zajišťující přesnou evidenci a podporu rozhodování.

Vyhledávání a kvalifikace nových dodavatelů pro nové projekty (napříč celým světem)

Zpracovávání podkladů pro seniorní kolegy pro vyjednávání a implementace smluv s dodavateli

Administrativní podpora řízení projektů z pohledu nákupu, úzká spolupráce s oddělením Engineeringu, Výrobou a projektovým manažerem

Reporting a evidence dat v informačním systému
