title: Técnico em Manutenção Mecânica I
description:
Gosta de instalação e manutenção mecânica industrial?

Você gostaria de ter a oportunidade de trabalhar em uma empresa global de energia?

Junte-se à nossa equipe

Nossa equipe de reparos oferece serviço de alta qualidade para manutenção de equipamentos de acordo com as especificações operacionais. Fornecemos soluções inovadoras em várias geografias. Fornecemos aos clientes as soluções de excelência necessárias para melhorar de forma confiável e eficiente suas operações.

Faça parceria com os melhores

Como Técnico Mecânico JR, você será responsável por executar as  atividades estratégicas da área de manutenção mecânica Industrial, Assegurando que os ativos atendam, de forma consistente, às expectativas da Manufatura para executar a função ou as funções pretendidas em um determinado período de tempo sob condições especificadas, minimizando riscos, custos e melhorar a capacidade produtiva. É responsável por executar com qualidade a priorização de atividades planejadas programadas da Manutenção Fábrica, de forma que as ações realizadas estejam alinhadas com os objetivos estratégicos da empresa.

Como Técnico Mecânico I, você será responsável por:

Realização de montagem mecânica, manutenção e revisão de equipamentos rotativos, visando a otimização dos recursos aplicados nas manutenções preventivas, preditivas e corretivas de manutenção;
Manutenção e reparos de equipamentos de produção, incluindo, mas não limitado a: redutores, equipamentos rotativos, bombas, motores elétricos, soldagem, etc.
Manutenção em unidades e equipamentos hidráulicos e pneumáticos ou qualquer outra máquina mecânica, conforme necessário.
Manutenção e reparação mecânica dos equipamentos das instalações das máquinas de produção manufatura.
Realização de Alinhamentos a laser de máquinas e equipamentos, interpretação de desenhos técnicos mecânicos.
Sólidos conhecimentos em instrumentos de medição mecânica e usinagem. Conhecimentos em lubrificação.
Conhecimentos em inspeções de campo.
Atuações direta em manutenções corretivas, preventiva e preditivas.
Garantir o cumprimento das políticas e procedimentos de HS&E Manter os registros do departamento conforme necessário e trabalhar em conjunto com o PCM e softwares operacionais de manutenção.
Atuação em projetos relacionados a melhorias e ao aumento da produção. Garantir e alimentar dados adequado e resultados esperados do software gerenciamento da Manutenção da companhia.
Fomentar e aplicar o uso de recursos adicionais que facilitem a gestão, acompanhamento/avanço e entregas das atividades da manutenção: dimensionamento de recursos, apoio e cronogramas;
Suportar a equipe de planejamento, programação e controle da manutenção dos ativos, equipamentos e peças de reposição, indicação e geração das necessidades de compras e recuperação de componentes, gerenciamento físico e contábil do estoque.
Realizar execução das paradas programadas conforme planejado, através de análise crítica de ordens de serviços.
Atender e disseminar aos requisitos de HSE (Segurança, Qualidade e Meio Ambiente), através do cumprimento das diretrizes estabelecidas pela empresa e pelas normas vigentes e demais programas de gestão.
Consolidar as políticas de manutenção e garantir que elas estejam alinhadas com as melhores práticas para garantir ganhos em confiabilidade e disponibilidade de equipamentos e instalações;
Transmitir informações e conhecimento, habilidade em identificar e solucionar problemas, conhecer e entender o produto, vivência e experiência na área de manutenção mecânica, em processos produtivos industriais,
Conhecimentos técnicos em componentes industriais,  conhecimentos de técnicas preventivas e preditivas, tolerâncias e ajustes mecânicos, metrologia, lubrificação, bons conhecimentos de informática e noções de software de gerenciamento de manutenção; Influenciar e estabelecer forte parceria com a equipe de Manutenção, Eng Proc, Produção, Qualidade e demais áreas de apoio para assegurar a execução dos pilares de TPM;

QUALIFICAÇÃO OBRIGATÓRIA:

Formação:

Técnico em Mecânica e CFT ativo.

Experiências Desejáveis:

Possuir experiência anterior em indústria nas funções de técnico manutenção mecânica adquiridos em segmentos industriais diversos;
Conhecimentos de lubrificação industrial, circuitos hidráulicos e soluções de problemas.
Conhecimentos de manutenção de equipamentos rotativos (motores, redutores, bombas, elementos de transmissão, etc): desmontagem, ajustes/correções e montagem;
Conhecimentos técnicos em componentes industriais,  conhecimentos de técnicas preventivas e preditivas, usinagem, materiais de construção mecânica e aplicações, tratamento térmico, técnicas de soldagem, tolerâncias, ajustes mecânicos de precisão e metrologia;
Conhecimentos operacionais software manutenção – Sistema Máximo

Trabalhe de uma forma que funcione para você

Reconhecemos que cada pessoa é diferente e que a maneira como as pessoas desejam trabalhar e oferecer o melhor é diferente para cada pessoa também. Nesta função, podemos oferecer o seguinte padrão de trabalho:

Disponibilidade para trabalhar em turnos 4x4 e disponibilidade de trabalho no horário noturno.
Local: Niterói, RJ.

Trabalhando conosco

Nosso pessoal está no centro do que fazemos na Baker Hughes. Sabemos que somos melhores quando todos os nossos funcionários são desenvolvidos, engajados e capazes de trazer todo o seu ser autêntico para o trabalho. Investimos na saúde e no bem-estar de nossa força de trabalho, treinamos e recompensamos talentos e desenvolvemos líderes em todos os níveis para trazer à tona o melhor de cada um.

Trabalhando para você

Nossas invenções revolucionaram a energia por mais de um século. Mas para seguir em frente amanhã, sabemos que temos que ultrapassar os limites hoje. Priorizamos recompensar aqueles que adotam a mudança com um pacote que reflete o quanto valorizamos suas contribuições. Junte-se a nós e você pode esperar: 

Políticas contemporâneas de equilíbrio trabalho-vida e atividades de bem-estar 
Opções abrangentes de cuidados médicos privados 
Rede de segurança de programas de seguro de vida e deficiência 
Benefícios adicionais eleitos ou voluntários 

Sobre nós 

Com operações em mais de 120 países, oferecemos as melhores soluções para nossos clientes e oportunidades mais ricas para nosso pessoal. Como um parceiro líder da indústria de energia, estamos comprometidos em alcançar emissões líquidas de carbono zero até 2050 e estamos sempre procurando as pessoas certas para nos ajudar a chegar lá. Pessoas que são tão apaixonadas quanto nós por tornar a energia mais segura, mais limpa e mais eficiente. 

Junte-se a nós 

Você está procurando uma oportunidade de fazer a diferença em uma empresa com alcance global e serviços e clientes interessantes? Junte-se a nós e cresça com uma equipe de pessoas que irão energizar e inspirar você! 

A Baker Hughes Company prioriza oportunidades iguais para todos os candidatos. Todas as nossas vagas são destinadas também a pessoas com deficiência. As decisões de contratação são tomadas independentemente de raça, cor, religião, origem nacional ou étnica, sexo, orientação sexual, identidade ou expressão de gênero, idade, deficiência, ou outras características protegidas por lei. 

Alerta de Privacidade 

Os dados pessoais coletados como parte deste processo serão usados para fins de verificação de conformidade com a legislação. Tais dados serão armazenados de forma segura e com acesso limitado, sendo retidos de acordo com as políticas de retenção de documentos da Baker Hughes. Os dados pessoais serão processados de acordo com o Aviso de Proteção de Dados da Baker Hughes, e com o “Nosso Jeito: o Código de Conduta da Baker Hughes”, disponível aqui. 

The Baker Hughes internal title for this role is: Mechanic I

title: Konstruktér (SŠ) pro návrhy přípravků pro výrobu (m, ž)
description:
Konstruktér (SŠ) pro návrhy přípravků pro výrobu (m, ž)

Chcete se podílet na výrobě generátorů?

Chcete pracovat v Plzni?

Spolupracujte s těmi nejlepšími

Baker Hughes je přední globální energeticko‑technologická společnost, která poskytuje inovativní řešení zvyšující bezpečnost, čistotu a efektivitu energie napříč celým hodnotovým řetězcem. Společnost působí ve více než 120 zemích a kombinuje hluboké znalosti odvětví s pokročilým inženýrstvím a digitálními technologiemi na podporu výroby energie, její transformace a dekarbonizace. S více než stoletou tradicí spolupracuje Baker Hughes se zákazníky v ropném a plynárenském průmyslu, v průmyslových odvětvích i na rozvíjejících se energetických trzích, aby urychlila pokrok směrem k udržitelnější energetické budoucnosti.

Rozviňte svou vášeň

Jako konstruktér pro přípravky se budete podílet na konstrukčním řešení a technickém návrhu přípravků pro výrobu generátorů v útvaru montáž.

Jako Konstruktér budete:

technická řešení a návrhy pro ustavení generátorů na zkušebně

technická řešení a návrhy pro zkoušení generátorů

Abyste byli v této roli úspěšní, budete potřebovat:

SŠ/VŠ vzdělání - strojírenství/elektro

technické/konstrukční myšlení

znalost 3D konstrukčních systémů

Pracujte způsobem, který vám vyhovuje

Uznáváme, že každý je jiný a že každý chce pracovat a podávat nejlepší výkon jiným způsobem. V této roli můžeme nabídnout následující flexibilní pracovní uspořádání:

Možnosti flexibilní práce proberte prosím s náborářem.

Spolupráce s námi

Naši lidé jsou srdcem všeho, co v Baker Hughes děláme. Víme, že jsme lepší, když se všichni naši zaměstnanci rozvíjejí, jsou angažovaní a mohou být sami sebou. Investujeme do jejich zdraví a pohody, školíme je, odměňujeme talent a rozvíjíme lídry na všech úrovních, abychom ze sebe navzájem dostali to nejlepší.

Co nabízíme vám

Naše vynálezy mění energetiku už více než století. Abychom mohli pokračovat i zítra, musíme posouvat hranice už dnes. Odměňujeme ty, kteří přijímají změny, balíčkem benefitů, který odráží, jak moc si jejich přínosu vážíme.

Můžete očekávat:

Pracovní doba 7,5 hodiny denně

Příspěvek na doplňkové penzijní pojištění 15 600 Kč ročně

Zajímavé platové ohodnocení a čtvrtletní bonusy (dle splnění firemních a osobních cílů)

Pravidelné každoroční navyšování mzdy

Firemní vzdělávání (povinná školení i rozvoj hrazený zaměstnavatelem)

Vlastní jídelna, výběr z několika jídel

Stravenkový paušál 115 Kč za odpracovanou směnu

5 týdnů dovolené

Flexi passy (volnočasové poukázky)

Výborná dostupnost MHD

Stabilní zaměstnání ve firmě s dlouhou tradicí

title: Application Engineer
description:
Do you enjoy working with cutting-edge technology? 

Would you like to help shape the future of our global energy? 
  

Join our Team!                      

Our Industrial & Energy Technology (IET) team provides industry-leading products and services that optimize the extraction, production and processing of energy. We help a diverse range of customers across the value chain to reduce operating costs and improve productivity. Our team is part of the Quality Assurance (QA) of the manufacturing for Florence and Massa and is responsible of the KPI monitoring and definition of the continuous improvement roadmap.

Partner with the best 

The Application Engineer is based in Florence and will:

Analyze client needs: definition and optimization of the products; scope (description); schedule; industrial scheme; cost, considering contract and internal policies and procedures.
Calculate plant, system and equipment performance and efficiency.
Provide documentation of technical specifications & costing elements for further contract execution phases.
Develop new solutions under guidance and/or in a team setting or based upon precedents in the organization.
Work together with business leadership. Specifying needs, communicating about project approach and presenting outcomes of research done.
Deliver products as part of a team. Works on cross functional teams. Alternatively: Leads analytical and design activities using proven technologies and vested approaches and methods.
Hand over the technical contract to execution team in case of award.
Prepare, within the required timeline, the most attractive technical proposal at first submission (i.e. including but not limited to the selection of rotating equipment and its auxiliary systems) using ITO tools and following ITO policies and procedures, implementing, where appropriate, innovative technology (NPD), while interfacing with the commercial team.
Apply product and quality policies, addressing and mitigating any risks as per Baker Hughes procedures.
Lead the technical negotiation, coordinating with supporting functions and attending meetings/presentations with customer.
Lead the definition of the project technical strategy, influencing customers towards Baker Hughes solutions by properly accounting for competitors’ technical strengths and weaknesses versus Baker Hughes offering/capabilities.

Fuel your passion 

To be successful in this role you will: 

Possess a degree in Electrical Engineering or Energy Engineering
Have a preferred experience with large machines such as generators with oil&gas application.
Have strong oral and written communication skills.
Have strong interpersonal and leadership skills.
Possess the ability to influence others and lead small teams.
Be able to lead initiatives of moderate scope and impact.
Can coordinate several projects simultaneously.
Have effective problem identification and solution skills.
Possess proven analytical and organizational ability.
Be Fluent in English (written and spoken) with good communication and presentation skills.
Be willing to work on stretched deadlines with flexible time management and available to travel on short notice.
Possess a deep understanding of relevant markets and customer economic value that aid winning bid strategies.

Work in a way that works for you 

We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns: 

Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive 

 
Working with us 

Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other. 
  

Working for you 

Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input.  Join us, and you can expect: 

Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities 
Comprehensive private medical care options 
Safety net of life insurance and disability programs 
Tailored financial programs 
Additional elected or voluntary benefits

Would you enjoy being part of a team that puts quality first?

Would you like to work with the latest products in the energy industry?

Join our cutting-edge manufacturing team

Our Industrial Energy Technology team provides industry-leading products and services that optimize the extraction, production, and processing of energy. We help a diverse range of customers across the value chain to reduce operating costs and improve productivity. We collaborate with teams to solve technical challenges and design future innovations.

Talamona manufacturing plant is the center of excellence for high tech turbomachinery components, and takes advantage of top notch technology in the industry such as additive manufacturing, advanced coatings, precision machining, robotics and automation.

Partner with the best

As a Manufacturing Engineer at Baker Hughes you will play a crucial role in optimizing our manufacturing processes, ensuring efficiency, and maintaining the highest standards of quality. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and improve manufacturing systems and processes.

Train and support production staff in the implementation of new processes and technologies.

Bachelor's degree in Manufacturing Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or Diploma with proven experience in manufacturing engineering, preferably in a high-volume production environment.

Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication and teamwork abilities.

title: Saldatore di Officina
description:
Sei appassionato di produzione? Ti piace far parte di un team di successo?

Entra a far parte del nostro gruppo!

La nostra divisione Industrial & Energy Technology (IET) fornisce prodotti e servizi che ottimizzano la produzione e il trattamento dell'energia. Aiutiamo una vasta gamma di clienti lungo la catena del valore a ridurre i costi operativi e migliorare la produttività. Il nostro team guarda allo sviluppo e alla creazione del futuro dei prodotti tecnologici energetici.

Collabora con noi

Il/La candidato/a si occuperà della saldatura e controllo dei componenti delle diverse tipologie dei prodotti Baker Hughes, seguendo le specifiche tecniche applicabili, il disegno tecnico di prodotto ed il ciclo di lavorazione. Lo svolgimento delle attività dovrà essere effettuato nel rispetto delle norme di sicurezza e qualità definite dall’azienda per le aree di competenza.

Per questa posizione si offre un contratto iniziale a tempo determinato di 1 anno.

In qualità di saldatore, sarai responsabile di:

Durante le attività di saldatura l’operatore dovrà compilare le check list relative alle attività di saldatura, identificazione materiali ed esecuzione controllo preliminare stato dei particolari in accordo alle specifiche applicabili.
Durante le attività l’operatore sarà responsabile del posto di lavoro e del rispetto delle regole di gestione della linea di produzione (es housekeeping);
L’operatore sarà chiamato a suggerire azioni di miglioramento delle attività da lui/lei svolte secondo lo spirito del programma aziendale di miglioramento continuo;
Parteciperà settimanalmente alle discussioni su temi di sicurezza e qualità all’interno della squadra di appartenenza (Safety & Quality Talk).

Alimenta la tua passione

Per avere successo in questo ruolo dovrai:

Avere un diploma di maturità tecnica (preferibilmente Perito Meccanico)
Avere esperienza referenziata su saldatura (processo GTAW mandatorio),
Avere esperienza referenziata su saldatura di superleghe a base di nichel.
Dimostrare conoscenza dei prodotti Baker Hughes
Essere disponibile a lavorare su turni (anche nel fine settimana, se necessario)
Dimostrare capacità di lettura e interpretazione di disegni/specifiche tecniche
Avere competenze informatiche (utilizzo di Excel, Word, e-mail, ecc.)
Dimostrare attitudine al lavoro in team e flessibilità
Avere un permesso di Lavoro EU
Essere disponibilità ad effettuare trasferte
Dimostrare forte attenzione ai dettagli.

Lavora in un modo che funziona per te

Riconosciamo che ognuno è diverso e che il modo in cui le persone vogliono lavorare e offrire il meglio è diverso anche per tutti. In questo ruolo, possiamo offrire i seguenti schemi di lavoro flessibili:

Orario di lavoro flessibile

Lavorare con noi

I nostri collaboratori sono al centro di ciò che facciamo in Baker Hughes. Investiamo nella salute e nel benessere della nostra forza lavoro, formiamo e premiamo i talenti e sviluppiamo leader a tutti i livelli per tirare fuori il meglio l'uno dall'altro.

Lavorare per te

Le nostre invenzioni hanno rivoluzionato l'energia per oltre un secolo. Ma per andare avanti domani, sappiamo che dobbiamo spingere i confini oggi. Diamo priorità a premiare coloro che abbracciano il cambiamento con un pacchetto che rifletta quanto apprezziamo il loro contributo. Unisciti a noi e puoi aspettarti:

Politiche contemporanee di equilibrio tra lavoro e vita privata e attività di benessere
Opzioni complete di assistenza medica privata
Rete di sicurezza delle assicurazioni sulla vita e dei programmi di disabilità 
Programmi finanziari su misura
Benefici aggiuntivi eletti o volontari

Su di noi

Con operazioni in oltre 120 paesi, forniamo soluzioni migliori per i nostri clienti e opportunità più ricche per i nostri dipendenti. In qualità di partner leader nel settore energetico, ci impegniamo a raggiungere zero emissioni nette di carbonio entro il 2050 e siamo sempre alla ricerca delle persone giuste che ci aiutino ad arrivarci. Persone appassionate quanto noi di rendere l'energia più sicura, pulita ed efficiente.

Unisciti a noi

Stai cercando un'opportunità per fare davvero la differenza in un'azienda con una portata globale e servizi e clienti entusiasmanti? Unisciti a noi e cresci con un team di persone che ti stimoleranno e ti ispireranno!

Quality Engineer

Are you looking for a role where your analytical skills and engineering mindset directly influence product quality and compliance?

Do you want to work in a team where your decisions help prevent defects, improve processes, and strengthen supplier performance?

Partner with the best

Baker Hughes stands as a leading global energy technology company, delivering innovative solutions that make energy safer, cleaner, and more efficient across the entire value chain. Fuel your passion

As a Quality Engineer, you will ensure product and process compliance through data‑driven analysis, collaboration, and continuous improvement. You will analyze non‑conformance reports (NCR), lead root cause analyses (RCA), coordinate engineering teams to improve on‑time delivery (OTD), support supplier qualification, and maintain quality documentation. You will also participate in internal and external audits and contribute to ongoing improvement initiatives.

As a Quality Engineer, you will be responsible for:

Analyzing quality data, including non‑conformance reports (NCR)

Leading root cause analyses (RCA), identifying trends, and driving corrective actions

Coordinating engineering teams to improve on‑time delivery (OTD) and RCA performance

Supporting supplier qualification processes in cooperation with the supplier quality team

Ensuring compliance with industry standards and internal quality procedures

Participating in internal and external audits and supporting continuous improvement initiatives

Maintaining and updating quality documentation and reporting systems (CSMS)

Collaborating across departments to strengthen quality culture and process discipline

To be successful in this role, you will:

Bring experience with quality analysis, NCR/RCA processes, or engineering quality systems

Understand industry standards and internal quality procedures

Demonstrate strong analytical and problem‑solving skills

title: Dělník v cívkárně (m/ž)
description:
Dělník v cívkárně (m/ž)

Chcete se podílet na výrobě generátorů?

Chcete pracovat v Plzni?

Spolupracujte s těmi nejlepšími

Baker Hughes je přední globální energeticko‑technologická společnost, která poskytuje inovativní řešení zvyšující bezpečnost, čistotu a efektivitu energie napříč celým hodnotovým řetězcem. Společnost působí ve více než 120 zemích a kombinuje hluboké znalosti odvětví s pokročilým inženýrstvím a digitálními technologiemi na podporu výroby energie, její transformace a dekarbonizace. S více než stoletou tradicí spolupracuje Baker Hughes se zákazníky v ropném a plynárenském průmyslu, v průmyslových odvětvích i na rozvíjejících se energetických trzích, aby urychlila pokrok směrem k udržitelnější energetické budoucnosti.

Rozviňte svou vášeň

Práce zahrnuje výrobu cívek pro rotory generátorů a výrobu statorových tyčí generátorů, včetně obsluhy příslušných zařízení a kontroly kvality hotových výrobků.

Jako dělník v cívkárně budete:

výroba cívek pro rotory generátorů

výroba statorových tyčí generátorů

Abyste byli v této roli úspěšní, budete potřebovat:

SOU nejlépe technického směru výhodou

ochota pracovat na 3 směny

schopnost komunikace v češtině

praxe v oboru výhodou

Pracujte způsobem, který vám vyhovuje

Uznáváme, že každý je jiný a že každý chce pracovat a podávat nejlepší výkon jiným způsobem. V této roli můžeme nabídnout následující flexibilní pracovní uspořádání:

Možnosti flexibilní práce proberte prosím s náborářem.

Spolupráce s námi

Naši lidé jsou srdcem všeho, co v Baker Hughes děláme. Víme, že jsme lepší, když se všichni naši zaměstnanci rozvíjejí, jsou angažovaní a mohou být sami sebou. Investujeme do jejich zdraví a pohody, školíme je, odměňujeme talent a rozvíjíme lídry na všech úrovních, abychom ze sebe navzájem dostali to nejlepší.

Co nabízíme vám

Naše vynálezy mění energetiku už více než století. Abychom mohli pokračovat i zítra, musíme posouvat hranice už dnes. Odměňujeme ty, kteří přijímají změny, balíčkem benefitů, který odráží, jak moc si jejich přínosu vážíme.

Můžete očekávat:

Pracovní doba 7,5 hodiny denně

Příspěvek na doplňkové penzijní pojištění 15 600 Kč ročně

Zajímavé platové ohodnocení a čtvrtletní bonusy (dle splnění firemních a osobních cílů)

Směnný provoz s nadstandardními příplatky

Pravidelné každoroční navyšování mzdy

Firemní vzdělávání (povinná školení i rozvoj hrazený zaměstnavatelem)

Vlastní jídelna, výběr z několika jídel

Stravenkový paušál 115 Kč za odpracovanou směnu

5 týdnů dovolené

Flexi passy (volnočasové poukázky)

Výborná dostupnost MHD

Stabilní zaměstnání ve firmě s dlouhou tradicí

title: Sr. Staff Materials Manager - Materials Planning and Execution
description:
Join our Team!

Responsible for planning and scheduling the materials required for the product line to execute the business.  Works to translate the sales demand into physical orders and ensures they are delivered to meet the customer requirements.  Also, manages the planning and delivery team including employee training, development and career progression.

As a Sr. Staff Materials Manager - Materials Planning and Execution, you will be responsible for:


• Establishing the planning and delivery processes.
• Ensuring planning and delivering processes are being implemented correctly and aligned to the Center of Excellence governance.
• Working with the sales and operations team to convert the demand plan into physical orders.
• Accountable for prioritizing the orders to meet the business goals.
• Responsible for executing the product line order strategies (allocations) relative to regions and manufacturing plants.
• Providing overall planning and delivery guidance for orders.
• Responsible for routing orders to the various plants.
• Managing and processing order exceptions.
• Managing communication between the Product Line/ Sales/Service Delivery with respect to order dates.
• Planning deliveries such that inventory costs are minimized while maintaining customer commitments.
• Working with the region Sales and Service Delivery to prioritize deliver dates as needed (push outs, pull ins).
• Responsible to ensure orders are appropriately maintained in SAP (aged orders, etc).
• Managing the materials planning and delivery team including employee training, development and career progression.

Fuel your passion

To be successful in this role you will:

• Bachelor's Degree in Supply Chain Management or related field or equivalent experience (7+ years’ experience).
• Experience in order management, inventory optimization and management, asset utilization and management.
• Deep knowledge of SAP and MRP functionality.
• Ability to work with and influence stakeholders.
• Strategic thinking with tactical execution with a sense of urgency.
• Experience managing and developing teams.

Desired Characteristics: Not required but additional preferred elements:
• Certifications; APICS Certification.
• People leader experience (direct, matrix or through influence) with demonstrated Leader of Choice capabilities (Drive Culture, Inspire People, Achieve Results, Growth Mindset).

Work in a way that works for you

We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too.

Location: Niteroi - Rio de Janeiro. (On site)

Working Hours: 7h - 16h
 

Working with us

Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.
 

Working for you

Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:


Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities.

Comprehensive private medical care options.

Safety net of life insurance and disability programs.

Tailored financial programs.

Additional elected or voluntary benefits.

description:
Regional Customs Manager – North America (U.S. & Canada)

Role Summary

Lead the North America customs and import program for Baker Hughes, Industrial Energy Technology (IET). Own day-to-day operations execution, governance, broker performance, and post-entry accuracy. Implement and sustain CBP and Canada’s Customs programs. Manage and coach the import team and upskill stakeholders to ensure compliant, efficient cross-border flows.

Governance & Compliance
Own compliance with U.S. (CBP) and Canada (CBSA) laws and policies across classification, valuation, origin, admissibility, and partner government agency (PGA) requirements.
Establish and maintain internal controls that meet “reasonable care” standards, including procedures, work instructions, and periodic testing.
Lead recordkeeping controls: U.S. (5 years) and Canada (6 years), with complete audit trails and secure retrieval.
Run post-entry processes end to end: Post Summary Corrections (PSC), Reconciliation, duty refunds, prior disclosures, protests, and drawback coordination as needed.
Lead and manage internal audits, and CBP trade regulatory audits and verifications.
Programs & Certifications
Implement and sustain CBP CTPAT Security; partner with stakeholders on remediation and continuous improvement.
Build readiness and governance for CTPAT Trade Compliance (Trusted Trader modernization), including internal control design, risk assessment, and self-testing.
Lead Canada Trusted Trader programs (PIP/CSA): meet Minimum Security Requirements, prepare for validations, and manage action plans.
Operationalize Canada’s CARM requirements (Commercial Accounting Declarations, RPP, harmonized billing) with the import team and brokers.
Broker Operations & Performance
Customs broker management: SOPs, power of attorney, billing accuracy, performance scorecards, business reviews.
Ensure brokers meet regulatory requirements and changes, ACE data quality, and KPI targets.
Drive root cause analysis on entry errors and implement corrective and preventive actions (CAPA).
Tariff Strategy & Trade Programs
Cross-functional collaboration with BU’s engineering, supply chain, classification and trade-compliance for regulatory compliance.
Evaluating and executing duty-savings opportunities: FTA’s, Drawback, Tariff-rate quotas, and other strategic areas.
Monitoring Section 301/232/IEEPA trade remedies and other tariff actions; advise leaders on impacts and mitigations.
Providing tariff impact analysis, scenario modeling, and recommendations for strategic trade decisions.
Oversee quota planning and critical shipments; ensure timely and correct filings (ACE, portal, CAD/CARM).
Leadership & Stakeholder Engagement
Managing the NAM import team: set priorities, coach, mentor, and build career paths.
Providing clear training for procurement, logistics, finance, and business teams on customs basics and Incoterms.
Influencing to drive process adherence and systems adoption across product companies and functions.
Qualifications
Must have a Bachelor’s degree in International Trade, Supply Chain, Business, or related field.
Have 10+ years in U.S./Canada customs or trade compliance, including leadership of broker operations and post-entry.
Have U.S. Licensed Customs Broker strongly preferred; experience with Canadian customs (PIP/CSA, CARM) is a plus.
 Have working knowledge of export controls and sanctions interfaces (screenings/escalations).
Have deep knowledge of HTS classification, customs valuation, rules of origin, and partner government agency requirements.
Have hands-on experience with PSC, Reconciliation, audits/verifications, and internal control frameworks.
Have working knowledge of ACE (reports/portal) and CBSA CARM; proficiency with ERP (SAP/Oracle) and analytics dashboards.
Key Performance Indicators
First-pass entry accuracy and on-time clearance.
PSC/Reconciliation/protest cycle time and accuracy.
Audit/verification outcomes and issue-free rates.
Broker accuracy, timeliness, and cost-to-serve.
FTA claim accuracy and duty savings delivered.
Training coverage and policy/process adherence.
Work Setup
Location: Houston, TX (hybrid).
Travel: up to 5% across U.S. and Canada.
Relocation: not available

You will be eligible to participate in Company-sponsored benefit programs, including health & welfare programs and the Thrift Plan (401k). You will have a choice of coverage options that best suit your needs. Coverage options and contribution amounts are related to your benefit elections, base salary level, and specific requirements of each of these plans. 

This position is eligible for our comprehensive and competitive benefits package, which can be found here, and is further eligible for additional forms of compensation such as bonuses subject to the terms of the applicable benefit plans or policies.

Would you like the opportunity to work in a global energy company?

Do you enjoy taking on challenging projects?

Join our innovating Internship Program

The Baker Hughes Internship is designed to enable students either pursuing a Bachelors’ or Masters’ degree or recently graduated to gain hands-on work experience as the foundation of their professional lives. Our internships will give you first-hand insights into the processes, systems, and practices that are aligned to ensure customer needs are met through flawless execution and the application of leading-edge technology.

Partner with the best

title: Control Field Service Engineer
description:
Are you a Field Service Engineer looking for an interesting opportunity?

Do you enjoy installation and maintenance?

Join our Field Service team
 

Our Industry & Energy Technology (IET) team provides industry-leading products and services that optimize the extraction, production, and processing of energy. We help a diverse range of customers across the value chain to reduce operating costs and improve productivity. Our team plays an integral role by helping the business plan for the future.

As a diverse and inclusive workplace, Baker Hughes IET values the unique perspectives and backgrounds of its employees. In this role, you will have the opportunity to bring your individual experiences and insights, contributing to a rich tapestry of ideas and fostering a culture of inclusivity. Your diverse perspective will enhance the overall effectiveness and success of the projects and initiatives you lead, making a positive impact on Baker Hughes IET and its stakeholders.
 

Partner with the best

As a Control Field Service Engineer, you will play a vital role onsite with our customers. Leading the installation and maintenance activities, you will work with customers to troubleshoot issues and ensure safe and compliant installations. You will be the onsite expert, continually developing your knowledge and skills to deliver innovative solutions for customers.

As a Control Field Service Engineer, you will be responsible for:

Providing on-site technical direction on control systems installation, including loop checks, system tests during start-up, commissioning, troubleshooting and maintenance on customer owned sites in remote oil-field, power generation and industrial facilities (Power generation includes customer owned utilities, marine drives, petrochemical, paper, steel, automotive and transportation industries).

Preparing job-planning documents that define the control system scope of the installation, upgrade and maintenance projects.

Supervising the positioning and wiring of control panels such as Unit Control Panel (UCP), auxiliary panels of any type, Direct Current Panel (DCP), battery charger and battery cells, Generator Control & Protection Panel (GCPP), Motor Control Center (MCC), etc., particularly electrical hook up, pneumatic hook up, primary hook up and field wiring done by client or sub-contractor

Overseeing, troubleshooting and start-up of control panels and control sequencing for rotating, driven equipment and auxiliary systems

Preparing and updating technical documentation, plans, daily and weekly briefing reports for customers and internal cross-functional teams

Ensuring internal training, compliance and quality documentation is updated, followed and completed according to company standards


Fuel your passion

To be successful in this role you will:

Have an Engineering degree or a high school diploma and show good experience in a control systems role gained in an energy or oil and gas environment (or similar)

Demonstrate a good working knowledge of control systems for rotating equipment installation and maintenance with experience of DLN/DLE mapping and knowledge on rotating equipment including installation and maintenance

Strong awareness of Gas Turbines, Centrifugal Compressors, Reciprocating Compressors or Steam Turbines and their auxiliaries and have a customer service-orientation mindset, experienced leading customers through tough decisions

Health, Safety and Environmental mindset and compliance.

Experience on DLE (Dry Low Emission) and DLN (Dry Low NOx) systems mapping.

Knowledge of GE Speedtronic turbine control panels.

Knowledge of PLC control panels.

Have excellent command and understanding of verbal and written English.

Have an EU passport/ European Work permit and have excellent verbal and written English and Italian language

Be ready to travel significantly (up to 80%) without geographical restriction, including offshore facilities



Work in a way that works for you

We recognise that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:

This role is working with our customer on-site in locations across the world. When onsite, you will have the flexibility to work in line with customer working patterns.

Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.
 

Working for you

Our inventions have revolutionised energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritise rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input.  Join us, and you can expect:
 

Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities

Comprehensive private medical care options

Safety net of life insurance and disability programs

Tailored financial programs

title: Mechanical Product Design Engineer
description:
Mechanical Product Design Engineer

Would you enjoy designing innovative energy products?

Are you excited by the prospect of working for industry leader in Energy Technology?

Join our cutting-edge Engineering team

Our Turbomachinery & Process Solutions business provides industry-leading products and services that optimize the extraction, production and processing of energy. As a team with integrity, we create value with impactful decisions by effectively connecting ideas and people. We champion an entrepreneurial culture to unlock full our potential by bringing energy to the world.

Partner with the best

As a Mechanical Product Design Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, simulating and analyzing components related to Centrifugal Compressor, Turbo Expanders and allied machines in the Energy Sector.

As an Engineer, Mechanical, Product Design and Engineering, you will be responsible for:

Conducting structural and finite element analysis (FEA) on mechanical systems and components.

Using tools like Ansys, Abaqus, or similar software to simulate stresses, deformations, and failure mechanisms.

Perform static, dynamic, thermal, and fatigue analysis to ensure product durability and reliability.

Interpret and validate simulation results through hand calculations and experimental testing.

Optimize designs based on analysis findings and collaborate with design teams to enhance structural integrity.

Generate technical reports and present findings to internal teams and stakeholders.

Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and advancements in FEA methodologies.

  Executing the design, analysis, or evaluation of assigned projects using sound engineering principles and adhering to business standards, practices, procedures, and product / program requirements.

Designing of Centrifugal compressors from Mechanical and Thermodynamic design requirements.

Having Customer Interactions and offering technical support

Fuel your passion

To be successful in this role, you will need:

Bachelor’s or master’s degree in mechanical engineering,

1-5 years of experience in structural analysis and finite element simulations

Proficiency in FEA software such as Ansys, Abaqus, or similar tools

Strong understanding of mechanics of materials, structural dynamics, and failure analysis

Strong understanding of Thermo-Mechanical phenomena and understanding of Heat Transfer concepts

Experience with linear and nonlinear analysis, fatigue, and thermal simulations is a plus

Ability to interpret engineering drawings and material specifications

Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills

Experience with CAD software (e.g., SolidWorks, CATIA, or Creo) is a plus

Preferred Qualifications include:

Experience in aerospace, automotive, energy, or related industries.

Machine Drawing fundamentals, such as GD&T

Knowledge of scripting languages like Python or MATLAB for automation and post-processing.

Familiarity with industry standards such as ASME, ASTM, or ISO.

Have good interpersonal, communication and leadership skills

Be a self-driven individual with proven problem-solving capability.

title: Systems Services Engineer
description:
Systems Services Engineer

Are you a Systems Engineer interested to work in oil and gas sector ? 

Are you seeking a challenging opportunity for your career growth ? 

Partner with the best

Baker Hughes stands as a leading global energy‑technology company, delivering innovative solutions that make energy safer, cleaner, and more efficient across the entire value chain. Operating in more than 120 countries, the company blends deep industrial expertise with advanced engineering and digital technologies to support energy production, transformation, and decarbonization. With over a century of heritage, Baker Hughes partners with customers in oil and gas, industrial sectors, and emerging energy markets to accelerate progress toward a more sustainable energy future.

Fuel your passion

As a System Services Engineer, you will provide specialized technical support across development, installation, commissioning, maintenance, troubleshooting, and lifecycle services for Baker Hughes subsea oil and gas controls technologies. The role acts as the primary technical interface for customers, ensuring safe, reliable, and high‑quality operation of control systems, and associated hydro-mechanical/electrical auxiliary systems.

As a System Services Engineer, you be responsible for:

System Installation & Commissioning:

Support installation, commissioning, and configuration of BH control systems, software, and associated equipment for subsea oil and gas control systems.
Execute startup of control panels, calibration, sequencing, and functional acceptance system testing.

Maintenance & Technical Support

Support conducting preventive and corrective maintenance on subsea oil and gas control systems
Troubleshoots complex technical issues involving instrumentation, electrical systems, software controls, or hydro-mechanical interactions.
Performs inspections and diagnostic tasks such as system tuning, and equipment testing.

Customer & Project Interaction

Serves as the primary onsite or offshore technical contact, providing engineering guidance and ensuring alignment with customer expectations.
Prepare detailed service notes, technical reports, and documentation of field activities.
Support site teams, subcontractors, and customer personnel, ensuring compliance with operational and HSE requirements.

Operational Excellence & Safety

Follow all Baker Hughes and customer HSE standards, ensuring safe execution of field tasks and risk assessments.
Provide recommendations to improve system reliability, efficiency, and lifecycle performance.

To be successful in this role, you will:

Have a Degree in Systems engineering, Electrical Engineering, Hydro-Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics, Control Systems, Computer Engineering, or a related technical field.
Experience in maintenance, troubleshooting, or commissioning of industrial control systems is strongly preferred.
Proven capability in troubleshooting software control systems, sequencing logic, and industrial automation
Understanding of subsea oil and gas equipment such subsea controls modules, subsea electrical modules, electrical and hydraulics harness
Ability to create, update and interpret technical drawings, specifications, test procedures and system schematics.
Strong communication and customer‑facing skills for onsite support activities.
Ability to work independently and within multi‑disciplinary teams in challenging environments.
Ability to travel to onshore testing/suppliers/customers sites may be required and offshore sites as an option if interested.

description:
New Product Quality Engineer

Are you passionate about being part of a successful team?

Do you like working in collaborative teams and solving critical issues? 

Partner with the best

The New Product Quality Engineer will serve as a Quality representative who can directly impact product performance by ensuring the safety, quality, post market performance and reliability.  The candidate will interface with cross-functional teams to complete sustaining projects, design control deliverables, and activities to ensure our products continue to meet state-of-the-art performance bringing exceptional value to customers.

This person will lead various New Product Development and sustaining activities as well as play a role in product risk management, change control, and design controls.

Thie ideal candidate should excel in an environment that embraces teamwork, change, risk-based decision-making and flexibility. Be ready to make a significant contribution to a dynamic, fun, multi-disciplinary team, where a self-motivated engineer with excellent written and verbal communication skills stands ready to succeed.

As a Quality Engineer, you will be responsible for:

Acting as an effective leader or cross-functional team member in supporting quality disciplines, decisions, and practices.

Supporting New Product Development projects risk management deliverables.

Evaluating end user needs, standards requirements, and risk evaluations to generate design requirements and engineering targets which include design for manufacturing, assembly, and automation.

Performing process development studies in collaboration with manufacturing teams and bringing an open mind to design solutions which enable manufacturability internally and at external suppliers.

Testing and analyzing engineering prototypes using statistical analysis in Minitab and applying to the design effort (Multivar chart, t-tests, confidence/reliability analysis, Gauge R&R) to iterate concepts toward extremely innovative yet robust solutions.

Applying sound, systematic problem-solving methodologies in identifying, prioritizing, communicating, and resolving quality issues as related to the position responsibilities.

Working effectively with and influencing cross-functional teams during the Design Change process to ensure proposed changes to products are systemically / thoroughly analyzed, assessed, controlled and implemented appropriately.

Supporting planning, updating and maintenance of product Risk Management documentation (Hazard Analysis, Design FMEA, Task Analysis and Fault Tree Analysis, etc.).

Interfacing with the core team and supporting manufacturing operation efforts / changes to ensure they meet or exceed internal and external requirements.

Interfacing with the cross-functional team to ensure suppliers are capable of manufacturing components (drawings reviews, capability analysis, design reviews, engineering builds).

Facilitating post-market activities to ensure our products comply with customer expectations, product performance standards, and quality system requirements through a risk-based assessment of post-market data.

Supporting or conducting Process Verification / Validation activities is preferred.

Reading blueprints/literacy including GD&T is preferred.

Familiarizing with inspection methods and techniques is an asset.

Using Microsoft Office Suite, and Minitab Statistical Analysis software (or equivalent) competently.

Supporting 3rd party audits, including follow-up on actions.

Ensuring compliance of QMS through authoring and updating Standard Operating Procedures (SOP).

Fuel your passion

To be successful in this role you will have:

Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college (or a high school diploma / GED with at least 4 years of experience in Quality).

Minimum of 3 additional years of experience in Business Process Management.

Ability to influence others and lead small teams.

Lead initiatives of moderate scope and impact.

Ability to coordinate several projects simultaneously.

Effective problem identification and solution skills.

Proven analytical and organizational ability.

Full-time, on-site role; M-F, 7AM – 4PM

description:
Electrical Supplier quality Engineer 

Join our Team!

Our Industrial & Energy Technology Business Segment provides industry-leading products and services that optimize the production and processing of energy. We help a diverse range of customers across the value chain to reduce operating costs and improve productivity. Working on large scale projects with cutting-edge technology, we constantly improve and innovate.

Partner with the best

Electrical SQE is responsible to manage any technical/quality aspect related to Suppliers. The main objective is to expand and develop the supply base in line with business needs, continuously improving the quality level of the supplier base, reducing both escaping defects and associated Cost of Quality. All activities are connected with Suppliers and the various internal functions, i.e. Procurement, Engineering and Manufacturing.

Fuel your passion

As Supplier Quality Engineer, you will be responsible for:

Qualify Suppliers
Carrying out periodic audits to verify compliance with qualification requirements
Performing QMS audits and support suppliers’ on boarding
Executing Root Cause Analysis (RCA) and define Corrective Actions (CA) in case of escaping defects to avoid reoccurrence
Stimulating a Quality driven and Continuous Improvement mentality in supplier’s organization, with mutually trustful and proficient relationships
Managing effective communication with internal Baker Hughes stakeholders (e.g. Engineering, Procurement Buyers, Procurement Fulfillment Managers, Project Managers, Project Quality Managers, Project Engineers, etc.)
Managing on the job inspections according to the Quality Control Plans 
Managing Supplier Deviation Requests (SDR)
Managing Supplier’s related Non-Conformity Records (NCR-CCM)

Degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent work experience
Work experience and/or technical knowledge in manufacturing of electrical systems (motors, panels, etc..).

Structured data driven mindset
Intellectual rigor-accuracy
Effective problem-solving abilities
Attitude to set aggressive targets and challenge status quo
Communication skills both internally with different functions and externally with suppliers
Fluency in English and Italian

description:
Change Management Leader
 

Do you want an opportunity to create change at a leading technology organization?
 

Are you a leader looking for a new opportunity?
 

Join the Baker Hughes Digital Technology team today!
 

The DT Change Management Leader will lead the change management strategy and execution for a large-scale, enterprise-wide AI value delivery program. In this role, you will work closely with business stakeholders to effectively understand and determine the impact of the change, and implement activities to inform, prepare and equip stakeholders to adopt mindset, behavior, process, and technology changes.
 

Partner with the best
 

The Change Manager will be responsible for ensuring successful adoption of new ways of working, minimizing resistance, and driving sustainable behavioral change to achieve program objectives.
 

As a Change Management Leader, you will be responsible for:
 

Develop and Own Change Strategy:

Designing and implementing a comprehensive change management strategy aligned with program goals, addressing high complexity and risk factors.

Stakeholder Engagement & Influence:

Identifying, analyzing, and managing stakeholders across all levels of the organization.

Impact & Readiness Assessments: ​

Conducting detailed change impact analyses and organizational readiness assessments to inform change management planning and risk mitigation.

Communication & Engagement Plans: ​

Creating and executing targeted communication and engagement strategies that clearly articulate the vision, benefits, and impacts of the change.

Training & Enablement: ​

Partnering with Learning & Development teams to design and deliver training programs that equip employees with the skills and knowledge needed for successful adoption.

Risk Management: ​

Identifying potential risks to adoption and develop proactive mitigation strategies to minimize disruption and resistance.

Measurement & Reporting: ​

Defining success metrics, monitor adoption progress, and report outcomes to leadership. Adjust strategies based on feedback and performance data.

Leadership Coaching: ​

Supporting senior leaders and change champions in their role as advocates for change, providing tools and guidance to lead effectively.


Fuel your passion
 

To be successful in this role you will:
 

Have a bachelor’s degree in Business, Organizational Development, or related field (Master’s preferred).

Have 8+ years in program management, with a proven track record driving successful end to end change management in projects.

Have Prosci, CCMP, or equivalent change management certification (preferred).

Have exceptional stakeholder management and influencing skills.

Have strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.

Have excellent communication and facilitation skills.

Have ability to thrive in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment.

Have strong business sense and ability to align change management approach to business needs.

title: Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
Quality Assurance Engineer

Do you enjoy innovative products and engineering challenges? 

Do you want to be part of a company that solves the problems of today, while working towards solutions for tomorrow? 

Would you like the opportunity to be part of a business that is proud of its culture and values creativity and problem solving?

Baker Hughes is looking for a QA Engineer to work on one of several exciting projects that will have a positive impact to Baker Hughes on the Bently product lines. This position will be responsible for testing a component, feature and or feature set through a variety of testing methodologies. Works independently and contributes to the immediate team and to other teams across the business. S/he contributes to quality engineering discussions and designs.

Be part of a team that makes a difference to our business

As a Quality Assurance Engineer, you will:

Own small to medium-sized quality engineering tasks

Develop and execute maintainable automation tests for acceptance, functional, and regression test cases

Work on an agile team and be responsible for individual as well as team outcomes

Review requirements and work with feature owners to develop world-class test plans

Integrate project testing with continuous-integration process

Work with fellow team members to diagnose bugs and formulate solutions

Document bugs and reproduction steps and gathers required information and log

Participate in exploratory testing, bug bash, and feature testing

Develop and execute clearly written end-to-end test cases based on domain knowledge and with input from feature owners.

Develop and execute performance and reliability test cases

Set up and configure hardware and software for testing

Leadership:

Ability to take ownership of small and medium sized tasks

Ensures understanding of issues and presents clear rationale.

Uses clear and transparent communication to convey important information

Voices opinions and presents clear rationale.

Uses data or factual evidence to influence decisions

Recognizes collaborative behavior and participates in collaborative activities

Demonstrates awareness about competitors and industry trends

Completes assigned tasks on time and with high quality. Takes independent responsibility for assigned deliverables

Personal Attributes:

Understands how to prioritize work based on business needs

Has the ability to break down problems and estimate time for development tasks

Seeks to understand problems thoroughly before implementing solutions. Asks questions to clarify requirements when ambiguities are present

Adapts to new environments and changing requirements. Pivots quickly as needed. When coached, responds to need & seeks info from other sources

Helps team members

Strong oral and written communication skills

Strong interpersonal skills

Pushes self for results; pushes others for results through team spirit

Fuel your passion

To be successful in this role you will:

Have minimum of Bachelor’s Degree in “STEM” Majors (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math)

Desired

Any of the following are beneficial to the position:

Creativity and problem-solving mindset

Ability to think about the solution as a whole

Have experience coding (such as C#, Java, C++)

Have experience in test automation

Have experience in managing, maintaining, and executing test plans

Have experience in testing web services (SOAP/REST, Throughput, Performance under Load, etc.)

Have experience in testing windows application, hardware products, including software and firmware

Have experience with issue-tracking and agile project management systems such as TFS, Jira, Confluence, or Rally

Have experience working in Linux/Unix and Windows environments.

Have experience working with virtual machines (VMs) as part of a test/integration infrastructure

Have experience in working with development IDEs such as Visual Studio

Have ability to think through user scenarios

Basic understanding of rotating equipment or industrial processes

Work in a way that works for you

We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:

Working flexible hours – deliver high performance outcomes while working when you are most productive and accommodating personal schedule needs.

Working with us

Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.

Working for you

Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:

Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities

Comprehensive private medical care options

Safety net of life insurance and disability programs

Tailored financial programs

Additional elected or voluntary benefits

title: Project Management Specialist - Project Planning
location:
locations
IN-MH-Pune-Cummins India Office Campus, 8th floor Survey No. 21, Balewadi
description:
Key Responsibilities:

Schedule Development & Management:

Maintain, and update detailed project schedules using Primavera P6 covering all phases: engineering, procurement, manufacturing, and delivery. Analyse variances, and escalate potential delays or deviations.

Engineering Resource Tracking:

Work with engineering managers and global teams to allocate resources and monitor engineering hours. Adjust schedules based on actual progress and revised forecasts. Ensure resource loading in schedules is accurate and realistic.

MRP Alignment & Material Flow:

Coordinate closely with the Product Delivery Planner to review MRP data with real-time scheduling needs. Ensure timely release and sequencing of materials per the project schedule and lead times. Serve as a key interface with the Product Delivery Planner, ensuring seamless integration between long-term planning and short-term execution. Attend joint planning-scheduling meetings to align on timelines, priorities, and risks. Support the planner in identifying feasibility gaps, resource bottlenecks, and schedule impacts of planning changes.

Stakeholder Engagement:

Collaborate with global project teams to gather inputs and provide updates on schedule status. Communicate clearly across time zones, maintaining regular cadence of updates and reports. Support internal and external project reviews with relevant scheduling data and dashboards.

Reporting & Documentation:

Generate reports from Primavera P6 and MRP systems for progress reviews and risk assessments. Maintain audit-ready documentation of all schedule changes.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Project Management, Supply Chain, or a related discipline. 3–5 years of experience in scheduling or project coordination, ideally in project industry or oil & gas sectors. Proficient in Primavera P6 and familiar with MRP systems (e.g. Oracle, SAP). Strong analytical and communication skills; able to interpret technical schedules and explain to non-technical audiences. Experience coordinating across global teams and time zones.

Preferred:

Exposure to subsea equipment or offshore oil & gas projects is a plus, not mandatory. Previous collaboration with planners or project controls teams.

The Baker Hughes internal title for this role is: Project Management Experienced Professional - Project Planning

Are you passionate about driving sourcing excellence and optimizing material flow for manufacturing operations?

Do you thrive in a fast‑paced environment where supply chain performance directly impacts production success?

Partner with the best

Baker Hughes is a global energy technology company serving the oil and gas sector across more than 120 countries. The Commercial & Sales organization drives growth by building strong customer partnerships, commercializing hydrocarbons, and delivering integrated equipment and service solutions. With a focus on digital transformation and energy transition, the team leverages data‑driven insights to optimize sales performance and maximize customer value.

Fuel your passion

The Lead Sourcing Specialist – Buying/Procurement is supporting the industrial valve manufacturing site by managing master planning, purchasing activities, and material processes to ensure seamless production execution. The role is driving supplier performance, material alignment, and inventory optimization while ensuring compliance with nuclear, HSE, and organizational standards. By strengthening sourcing operations and improving visibility across the supply chain, the specialist is enabling on‑time delivery and operational excellence.

As a Lead Sourcing Specialist – Buying/Procurement, you will be responsible for:

Managing master planning, material processes, and systems for the industrial valve site in Houston, Texas

Preparing and updating production schedules based on purchasing needs and operational requirements

Driving process improvements to enhance visibility of material availability across product lines

Ensuring material alignment with production plans and KPIs through coordination with materials teams and suppliers

Optimizing inventory levels and improving processes related to inbound shipments from external suppliers

Exchanging data and information regarding product, process, and procedural improvements with cross‑functional teams

Handling standardized manufacturing processes and implementing updated procedures from other functions

Obtaining nuclear purchasing certifications and managing external operations in accordance with nuclear guidelines

Driving improvements in manufacturing on‑time delivery through effective material alignment

Tracking and maintaining visibility of short‑cycle purchase orders

Placing, reviewing, and managing purchasing activities for materials from internal and external suppliers

Managing supplier performance, metrics, and accountability

Working with the quality team to resolve nonconformance and return‑to‑vendor discrepancies

Attending daily warehouse and virtual meetings with cross‑functional and global teams

Completing and maintaining all HSE and compliance training in accordance with Baker Hughes policies

Completing all electronic and in‑person learning requirements as per company guidelines

Managing the external supplier network from purchase order placement to invoice reconciliation

To be successful in this role you will:

Have a bachelor’s degree (or a high school diploma/GED with at least 4 years of manufacturing experience)

Have a minimum of 3 years of experience in Materials Planning & Execution and/or sourcing and procurement

Have strong oral and written communication skills

Have strong interpersonal and leadership capabilities

Have an ability to influence others and lead small teams

Have experience leading initiatives of moderate scope and impact

Have an ability to coordinate multiple projects simultaneously

Have strong problem‑identification and solution‑development skills

Have proven analytical and organizational abilities

Work in a way that works for you

Working with us

Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all our people are developed, engaged, and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well‑being of our workforce, train and reward talent, and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.

Working for you

Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. To continue moving forward, we reward those who embrace innovation and change. You can expect:

Contemporary work‑life balance policies and well‑being activities

Comprehensive private medical care options

Life insurance and disability programs

Tailored financial programs

Additional elected or voluntary benefits

You will be eligible to participate in Company-sponsored benefit programs, including health & welfare programs and the Thrift Plan (401k). Coverage options and contribution amounts are related to your benefit elections, base salary level, and specific requirements of each of these plans.

Ensure timely incident management to enable fast customer issue resolution and cash collection
Advise on product improvement opportunities for repetitive component/product failures 
Responsible for providing sales support and product application recommendations
Product line specific responsibilities as applicable
Handles special projects as required

¿Te gustaría tener la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa energética global? 

 

¿Te gusta asumir proyectos desafiantes? 

 

Únete a nuestro innovador Programa de Pasantías 

 

La pasantía Baker Hughes está diseñada para permitir que los estudiantes que cursan una licenciatura o maestría obtengan experiencia laboral práctica como base de sus vidas profesionales. Nuestras pasantías te brindarán información de primera mano sobre los procesos, sistemas y prácticas que están alineados para garantizar que se satisfagan las necesidades del cliente a través de una ejecución impecable y la aplicación de tecnología de vanguardia. 

 

Ubicación: 

MX-DF-MEXICO CITY-AVENIDA ANTONIO DOVALI JAIME 70 

 

Asóciate con los mejores 

 

Participarás en capacitaciones enfocadas y reuniones de equipo, trabajarás en proyectos y presentarás tus resultados. Durante tu pasantía, contarás con el apoyo de un compañero y tu gerente que se asegurarán de que tengas una valiosa experiencia de aprendizaje. Puedes esperar recibir entrenamiento y tutoría que te permitirá completar tareas y proyectos para desarrollar tu aprendizaje y habilidades. 

También tendrás la oportunidad de familiarizarte con la salud, la seguridad y el medio ambiente (HS&E) y la cultura de Baker Hughes. así como nuestro fuerte compromiso con la diversidad, la equidad y la inclusión.  

 

Como pasante, serás responsable de: 

 

Ayudar en el desarrollo de planes de proyectos, cronogramas e hitos en colaboración con gerentes y equipos de proyectos. 

Mantener la documentación del proyecto, incluidos los estatutos del proyecto, los cronogramas, los presupuestos y los informes de progreso. 

Identificar los riesgos potenciales del proyecto y ayudar en el desarrollo de estrategias de mitigación de riesgos. 

Preparar informes periódicos sobre el estado del proyecto para los directores de proyecto y las partes interesadas, destacando el progreso, los problemas y los próximos hitos. 

Aplicar las normas y procedimientos de Salud, Seguridad y Medio Ambiente (HS&E) en todas las situaciones para garantizar que se mantenga el cumplimiento. 

 

Alimenta tu pasión 

 

Para tener éxito en este rol, deberás: 

 

Estar actualmente inscrito en un grado de licenciatura en Ingeniería Petrolera, Química, Industrial, Mecánica, Electrónica o carreras afines a la industria Oil & Gas, con fecha de graduación a partir de diciembre de 2026. 

Hablar inglés oral y escrito con fluidez y tener habilidades de comunicación efectivas 

Ser capaz de reubicarte durante la duración de tu pasantía (las ubicaciones varían) 

Tener derecho legal a trabajar dentro del país en el que se está solicitando matrimonio sin patrocinio ni restricciones de tiempo  

 

Trabaja de una manera que funcione para ti 

 

Reconocemos que cada persona es diferente y que la forma en que las personas quieren trabajar y dar lo mejor de sí mismas es diferente para todos. En este rol, es posible que podamos ofrecer patrones de trabajo flexibles. Habla con nosotros sobre las opciones de trabajo que deseas cuando presentes tu solicitud. 

 

Trabajar con nosotros 

 

Trabajar en Baker Hughes significa estar a la vanguardia de la transición energética. Nuestra gente es diversa, ambiciosa y colaborativa. Tenemos la misión de redefinir el sector energético liberando el poder de la ingeniería, los datos y la ciencia.

description:
Lead Finance Specialist – FP&A Operations (NAM)

Driving Financial Excellence Through Data‑Driven Insights and Operational FP&A Leadership

Partner with the best

Our Finance organization plays a critical role in enabling business performance through accurate reporting, insightful analysis, and strong financial discipline. The FP&A Operations team partners closely with regional and cross‑functional stakeholders across North America to support decision‑making, optimize costs, and ensure compliance with internal controls and financial standards.

Fuel your passion

The Lead Finance Specialist – FP&A Operations (NAM) supports the effective operation of the finance function by delivering advanced financial reporting, planning, and governance support across regional FP&A activities. This role provides leadership in budgeting, forecasting, and performance management processes, ensuring consistency, accuracy, and continuous improvement in alignment with organizational standards and finance governance requirements.

As a Lead Finance Specialist – FP&A Operations (NAM), you will be responsible for:

Leading the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports for regional and senior management.

Driving budgeting and forecasting processes, including detailed variance analysis and performance tracking.

Analyzing financial performance against budget, forecast, and prior periods to identify trends, risks, and opportunities.

Maintaining and enhancing financial models, dashboards, and reporting tools to support FP&A operations.

Coordinating the collection, validation, and consolidation of financial and operational data from multiple sources.

Partnering with cross‑functional and regional teams to understand cost drivers, operational metrics, and business trends.

Supporting preparation of management presentations and providing ad‑hoc financial analysis.

Ensuring data accuracy, integrity, and compliance with internal controls, SOX requirements, and finance governance standards.

To be successful in this role you will:

Have strong proficiency in Excel, including advanced formulas and pivot tables; Power BI or similar analytics tools are a strong advantage.

Have a solid understanding of financial statements, including P&L, balance sheet, and cash flow.

Have experience with ERP and FP&A planning systems such as SAP, Anaplan, or similar platforms.

Have strong analytical, problem‑solving, and critical‑thinking skills with high attention to detail and data accuracy.

Have the ability to manage multiple priorities in a structured, deadline‑driven environment.

Have strong written and verbal communication skills, with experience presenting financial information to leadership.

Have a curious mindset with a willingness to challenge assumptions and continuously improve processes.

Be a proactive, team‑oriented professional capable of working independently and influencing cross‑functional stakeholders.

Working with us

Our people are at the heart of what we do. We believe we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged, and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in capability building, wellbeing, and collaboration to enable high performance across our teams.

description:
Machinist V


Shaping High‑Performance Turbine Parts Through Expert CNC/Manual Machining and Tight‑Tolerance Craftsmanship

Driving OEM‑Grade Accuracy with Advanced CNC/Manual Machining Mastery

Partner with the best
 

Baker Hughes is a global energy technology company serving the oil and gas sector across more than 120 countries. The Commercial & Sales organization drives growth by building strong customer partnerships, commercializing hydrocarbons, and delivering integrated equipment and service solutions. With a focus on digital transformation and energy transition, the team leverages data-driven insights to optimize sales performance and maximize customer value.

Partner with the best.

Fuel your passion

This Machinist supports Aero shop and Machine shop in running large CNC/Manual lathes, CNC/Manual VTL’s, and CNC/Manual Mills, holding tight tolerances meeting OEM requirements and specifications. Read and interprets blueprints, sketches, drawings, manuals, specifications, or sample parts to determine dimensions and tolerances of finished work pieces, sequence of operations and setup requirements for the Gas turbine, Steam turbine, and Aero components.

As a Mechinist V, you will be responsible for:

Supporting safety culture and driving a safe to start mindset

Aligning gas components, and parts within tight tolerances for machining, grinding, and runout corrections.

Programming CNC lathes, VTL’s, and milling machines

Reading and interpreting documents such as OEM drawings, REI’s, Work Instructions, and Digital Routers.

Working knowledge of geometric dimensioning and tolerancing (GD & T). Ability to apply basic concepts of algebra and geometry.

Calculating and set controls to regulate machining factors such as speed, feed, coolant flow, depth and angle of cut, or enter commands to retrieve, input, or edit computerized machine control media.

Starting and observing machine operation to detect malfunctions or out-of-tolerance
machining and adjusts machine controls as required.

Selecting, aligning, and secure holding fixtures, cutting tools, attachments, accessories, and materials on machines such as mills, lathes, and grinders.

To be successful in this role you will:

Have a High School Diploma or Equivalent.

Have a 10+ years related experience or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Demonstrate advanced / expert skill level (indicate part, turn OD's, turn ID’s, Grinding and Burnishing on; CNC mill, CNC lathe, and NC (figure feed rates), Manual mill, Manual lathe and Manual VTL

Have a Supporting Aero and Machine shop based on customer needs. Cases, Gas components, Aero components, and Value rack repairs.

Have an ability to operate Manual machines as well as CNC machines

Have an Experience in Gas turbine repair (HSPT, GE10's, Fr3, Fr5, Fr6, and F7) Rotors and component machining is a big plus.
