title: Manufacturing Process Engineer — Flexible Pipe Manufacturing
description:
Would you thrive in a role where hands-on problem solving and continuous improvement drive safer, more productive operations?

Do you enjoy learning in a technical environment and partnering across disciplines to deliver impact on the shop floor?

Join our Flexible Pipe Manufacturing & Operations team!

We design systems and manufacture flexible pipes that enable oil and gas production. Innovating in the energy industry, our subsea and surface capabilities are industry leading. We are a collaborative team delivering essential services to the business—supporting production, installation, and delivery of our flexible pipe portfolio.

Partner with the best

In this role, you will enable and optimize production activities by implementing improvement projects that reduce cost of poor quality, and increase safety, quality, and productivity. You will provide technical support to production, assess feasibility of projects, and collaborate with Planning, Engineering, Maintenance, Quality, HSE, and Operations.

As a Manufacturing Process Engineer, you will be responsible for:
Performing production project feasibility analyses per internal procedures; specify and request the purchase of equipment, tooling and fixtures needed to execute activities; deliver (when applicable) technical training to the operations team based on internal procedures and work instructions.
Implementing improvement projects focused on activity optimization—reducing accident risks, increasing product and process quality, and improving operational productivity; generate indicators (Quality, HSE, Cost, and Design) to manage projects and report in leadership meetings.
Joining quality investigations related to cost of poor quality increases and implement improvements in partnership with Quality and other related areas; join HSE incident investigations, implementing engineering barriers to avoid recurrence and improve operating conditions.
Establishing periodically review performance indices and standard rates for each work center, as required.
Networking and benchmarking with manufacturing engineering teams at other Baker Hughes plants, sharing best practices to optimize production processes.
Scanning the market for new technologies and methods to optimize manufacturing processes.
Supporting nonconformity analyses, performing root cause analysis in parallel with production.
Providing technical support to the production team on the shop floor as needed on matters impacting Productivity, Efficiency, Safety, and Quality.
Liaise with equipment/tooling suppliers and raw material suppliers (through Technology or Sourcing) to clarify topics about machine performance, technical issues, or operational matters.
Ensuring that Health, Safety, and Environmental values expressed in company policies are practiced by employees, suppliers, and contractors through identification, monitoring, and control of environmental impacts and occupational risks—based on attitude, leadership, training, and commitment.
Working in compliance with company policies and procedures related to Quality and operations. Report any nonconformity, concern, or risk to product, process, or service. Commit to Quality objectives and seek continuous improvement of products/processes/services.
Pursuing new technologies and methods for optimizing manufacturing tooling, improving items and components via reverse engineering concepts.
Supporting solutions for after-sales or warranty project needs.
Occasionally accompany offshore or offsite operations.

Fuel your passion

To be successful in this role you will have:

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering.
Desirable: MBA in Process or Project Management, or Industrial Engineering.
Mandatory: SolidWorks, AutoCAD, and advanced Excel.
Advanced/fluent English. (Differential: study abroad/international experience.)
Required: Proven experience in engineering and/or manufacturing processes.
Desirable: Root Cause Analysis (RCA), TPM, Lean Manufacturing; programming skills applicable to tools such as VBA, PowerApps, Power BI, and GoFormz; leadership training.
Desirable: Experience with flexible pipe manufacturing processes.

description:
Would you like the opportunity to work in a global energy company?

Do you enjoy taking on challenging projects?

Join our innovating Internship Program

The Baker Hughes Internship is designed to enable students either pursuing a Bachelors’ or Masters’ degree or recently graduated to gain hands-on work experience as the foundation of their professional lives. Our internships will give you first-hand insights into the processes, systems, and practices that are aligned to ensure customer needs are met through flawless execution and the application of leading-edge technology.

Partner with the best

You’ll participate in focused training, and team meetings, work on projects, and present your results. During your internship, you will be supported by a buddy and your manager who will ensure you have a valuable learning experience. You can expect to receive coaching and mentoring to enable you to complete assignments and projects to develop your learning and skillset.

You will also have the opportunity to become familiar with the Health, Safety, and Environment (HS&E) and culture of Baker Hughes. as well as our strong commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion.

As an Intern, you will be responsible for:

Completing internal projects to deliver customer outcomes and identify business improvements.
Learning internal software to assist with the completion of projects and tasks
Collaborating with cross-functional teams and interns to interact and network with global business leaders.

project schedules using tools like Primavera P6 or MS Project. Support schedule updates, progress tracking, and forecasting.

Fuel your passion

To be successful in this role you will:

Be currently enrolled or recently graduated in a Bachelors’ or Masters’ level degree in other STEM-related, Business, Economics, Supply Chain (HSE, Quality, Manufacturing), Petroleum Engineering, and Finance.
Have maintained a GPA grade greater than or equal to 3.0 out of 4.0 or the equivalent in your country

Be fluent in oral and written English and have effective communication skills

We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone. In this role, we may be able to offer flexible working patterns. Talk to us about your desired working options when you apply.

Working with us

Working at Baker Hughes means being at the forefront of the energy transition. Our people are diverse, ambitious, and collaborative. We're on a mission to redefine the energy sector by unlocking the power of engineering, data, and science.

title: Senior Engineer, Customer Order Engineering - Automation & Control
description:
Senior Engineer - Controls Engineering 

Are you a highly motivated, creative individual and passionate about working with mechanical components or equipment?

Would you like to be a part of our team?

Join our team!

Baker Hughes is the leading energy technology company, who delivers across the energy value chain through our market-leading business segments. Built on a century of experience and conducting business in over 120 countries. Our innovative technologies and services are taking energy forward! Making it safer, cleaner and more efficient for people and the planet.

Partner with the best

As a Senior Engineer - Controls Engineering, you will apply engineering concepts on projects, perform basic/detailed engineering of control panels for Gas / Steam Turbine driven generators/compressors, Motor driven compressors and execute projects effectively through cross-functional collaboration taking along all local/global take holders together. Responsible to drive engineering activities as per required project schedules & interact/communicating with customers as & when needed

As a Senior Engineer - Controls Engineering, you will be responsible for:

Applying engineering concepts on multiple Gas-Steam Turbine / motor-driven projects associated with control products & engineering drawings throughout the project lifecycle with a cost optimization mindset and support engineering functions.
Identify risks and make mitigation plans.
Should be able to work with and within cross-functional and cross-discipline teams.
Designing Unit control panel in accordance with customer specifications agreed deviations, country regulations & internal design guidelines, support others with both business and technical mentoring/coaching.
Selecting BOM (Bill of Material) for PLC & other components of the control panel complying with project needs.
Producing purchase specifications for control panel & associated components, engaging with Material and engineering suppliers for technical alignments & ensuring delivery plan consistency as per project schedule.
Preparing basic engineering drawings such as Control Panel Layout (dimensional) drawing / Network Architecture drawing and power Supply Scheme.
Developing detailed engineering drawings such as I/O List, Functional Description, Cause and effect, Functional Specifications and logic diagrams as per project P&ID, field wiring diagrams and Instrument data sheets.
Ensuring control panel-related drawings such as Control Panel Wiring diagrams and control Panel Construction Drawings are made, reviewed and delivered to customers as per project needs. Also ensuring cable schedule and interconnecting Wiring diagram in line with panel drawings.
Preparing control valve & flow element data sheets as per project piping, process & customer specifications and then supporting SOURCING for technical alignment and PO placement.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams such as SOURCING / QUALITY / PROJECT MANAGEMENT / OTHER ENGINEERING FUNCTIONS locally & globally ensuring smooth project execution and successful project closure.
Conducting regular project reviews to evaluate risks associated with the project and come up with a mitigation plan respecting quality & timely delivery of the panel.
Participating in project calls or in-person support for KOM (Kick Off Meeting), Design Reviews & drawings finalization and HAZOP / SIL ASSESSMENT meeting.
Supporting software validation & FAT (Factory Acceptance Test) with customers at panel manufacturer workshop & ensuring customer satisfaction on technical capability & responsiveness.
Providing regular inputs to the Product Standardization team for quality & process improvement.
Driving engineering suppliers to deliver work with quality and on time.

Fuel your passion!

To be successful in this role you will:

Have a BE/B.Tech OR ME/MTech in “Instrumentation & Controls” OR “Electronics & Instrumentation” OR “Electrical, Electronics & Instrumentation” OR “equivalent” from an accredited college or institution.
Have at least 8 years of work experience in Control Systems Design and operation and maintenance in the Power / Oil and gas industry.
Have experience in control panel design, and exposure to PLC/DCS & turbomachinery equipment such as Gas turbine / Steam Turbine / Compressors & generators.
Have International / Domestic travel for KOM (Kick Off Meetings) / Design Reviews / HAZOP / FAT as required.
Be a good team player and display good communication skills with fluency in English

description:
Systems Engineering Manager 

Are you a passionate Systems Engineering Manager interested to work in oil and gas sector ? 

Are you seeking a challenging opportunity for your career growth ? 

Baker Hughes stands as a leading global energy‑technology company, delivering innovative solutions that make energy safer, cleaner, and more efficient across the entire value chain. Operating in more than 120 countries, the company blends deep industrial expertise with advanced engineering and digital technologies to support energy production, transformation, and decarbonization. With over a century of heritage, Baker Hughes partners with customers in oil and gas, industrial sectors, and emerging energy markets to accelerate progress toward a more sustainable energy future.

Partner with the best

The Project System Engineering Manager has Technical engineering responsibility for the Execution Phase of an Engineering/Procurement/Construction Subsea Project.  Reporting to the Project Engineering Manager, and functionally to the Global Systems Delivery Manager, this is a senior level role working in a high-profile function of Baker Hughes.

As a Systems Engineering Manager , you will be responsible for:

  Leadership & delivery of all engineering and technical aspects of an EPC project, including requirements, scope, specifications, design and successful delivery

Lead and support all Systems Engineering disciplines, which includes Systems Engineers, Testing Engineers and specialist disciplines

Responsibility for system definition, field layout requirements flow-down

Oversee the cross-functional project team to set timelines, create solutions and support the implementation of the project, which includes the Systems Engineering at the product level.

Building efficient relationships with internal and external customers to provide a high-level of service delivery

Chair system level design reviews

Approval of all system documentation

Manages the EPC Systems Engineering budget and schedule.

Development and implementation of the System Engineering Management Plan

Ensures all System Interfaces are professionally managed

Manages system verification and validation including System Integration Testing and Technical Assurance

Identity opportunity for variation orders from technical aspects and drive to approval with PEM.

Oversight of system testing to ensure system design meets customer requirements

Owns Project Technical Risk Management

Ensures diligent control of the Technical Change process.

Provides regular reporting of Project Engineering status to the Project team, to the client, and to other stakeholders

Delivers professional handover of all engineering aspects to the Services Organization.

Takes assignments as required leading technical aspects of commercial pursuits, applying skills & expertise to ensure competitive subsea systems

Fuel your passion

To be successful in this role, you should have

Masters or bachelor’s degree in engineering or science-based discipline

Previous experience in positions such as project engineering, system engineering or project engineering management at product or systems (Subsea)

title: Global Nuclear Supplier Quality Lead (F/H)
description:
Vous êtes à la recherche d'une opportunité intéressante et inspirante ?

Vous avez envie de faire partie d’une équipe performante ?

Rejoignez nos équipes 

Chez Baker Hughes, nous transformons l'avenir de l'énergie. Présents dans plus de 120 pays, nous développons et déployons des technologies et des services de pointe pour faire progresser l'énergie. Depuis plus d'un siècle, nos inventions révolutionnent l'énergie. Aujourd'hui, nous apportons notre expertise pour rendre le pétrole et le gaz plus sûrs, plus propres et plus efficaces.

Faites équipe avec les meilleurs

En tant que  Global Nuclear Supplier Quality Lead (F/H), vous constituerez et piloterez une équipe dédiée de Supplier Quality Engineers (SQE). Vous veillerez à ce que l’ensemble de nos fournisseurs du nucléaire, dans le monde, bénéficie d’un accompagnement terrain par des leaders et des ingénieurs maîtrisant parfaitement les exigences réglementaires.

A ce titre, vous serez chargé(e) de :

Diriger et inspirer une équipe de Supplier Quality Engineers (SQE), en favorisant une culture d’appropriation et de collaboration, et en assurant le coaching et le mentorat de l’équipe, notamment sur les enjeux liés au nucléaire.
Agir en tant que principale autorité qualité nucléaire de Baker Hughes vis‑à‑vis des fournisseurs externes, en coopération étroite avec l’ensemble des parties prenantes internes et externes.
Définir, déployer et piloter le modèle opérationnel, les outils et la gouvernance SQE nucléaire, en France et au niveau mondial.
Gérer la performance qualité des fournisseurs via des évaluations de capacités et de procédés, des audits, des plans de qualification, un suivi continu et un accompagnement/escalade en cas de problèmes.
Piloter les analyses de causes racines ainsi que les actions correctives et préventives, en garantissant une conformité totale avec les standards de qualité industrielle.
Collaborer étroitement avec les équipes Achats, Ingénierie, Production et Qualité Produit pour assurer une exécution irréprochable sur l’ensemble de la chaîne d’approvisionnement.
Contribuer activement aux business reviews fournisseurs, en influençant les décisions ayant un impact sur l’exécution, la conformité et la satisfaction client.
Promouvoir le déploiement des processus, outils et formations qualité auprès des fournisseurs et des équipes internes.

​​

Alimentez votre passion

Pour réussir dans ce rôle, vous devrez :

Être titulaire d’un master en ingénierie mécanique ou disposer de connaissances et d’une expérience équivalentes.
Démontrer une solide expérience en qualité fournisseurs nucléaire / assurance qualité / qualité projet, avec une exposition directe aux fournisseurs.
Maîtriser l’application des référentiels RCC-M/EDF, ISO 19443, ASME III, ESPN/PED ou IAEA, avec une forte capacité d’interprétation des plans et spécifications.
Maîtriser les outils qualité.
Avoir une parfaite maîtrise professionnelle du français et de l’anglais.
Être disposé(e) à voyager (jusqu’à 30 %) en France et à l’international.
Avoir une expérience confirmée en management, idéalement dans un rôle régional ou global.

Travaillez de la manière qui vous convient

Nous sommes conscients que tout le monde est différent et que la manière dont chacun souhaite travailler et donner le meilleur d'lui-même est également différente pour chacun. Dans le cadre de ce rôle, nous pouvons proposer les modèles de travail flexibles suivants :

Horaires de travail flexibles : adaptez les heures de travail de la journée pour vous aider à tout intégrer et à travailler au moment où vous êtes le plus productif

Travailler avec nous

Nos employés sont au cœur de ce que nous faisons chez Baker Hughes. Nous savons que nous sommes meilleurs lorsque tous nos employés sont développés, engagés et capables de faire preuve d'authenticité au travail. Nous investissons dans la santé et le bien-être de notre personnel, formons et récompensons les talents et formons des leaders à tous les niveaux afin de faire ressortir le meilleur de chacun.

Nous travaillons pour vous

Nos inventions révolutionnent l'énergie depuis plus d'un siècle. Mais pour continuer à avancer demain, nous savons que nous devons repousser les limites aujourd'hui. Nous accordons la priorité à ceux qui acceptent le changement avec un package qui reflète à quel point nous valorisons leur contribution.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Would you like to play a key role in our business?

Are you passionate about making an impact?

Be part of our team!

Baker Hughes is the leading energy technology company, who delivers across the energy value chain through our market-leading business segments. Built on a century of experience and conducting business in over 120 countries. Our innovative technologies and services are taking energy forward! Making it safer, cleaner and more efficient for people and the planet.

Partner with the best

As a Global Nuclear Supplier Quality Lead, you will be responsible for building and leading a dedicated SQE team. You will be ensuring that all nuclear suppliers globally are supported by leaders and engineers with field presence, and deep regulatory awareness.

As a Global Nuclear Supplier Quality Lead , you will be responsible for:

Lead and inspire a team of Supplier Quality Engineers (SQEs), driving a culture of ownership and collaboration and coaching and mentoring the team, especially on nuclear related challenges

description:
Do you enjoy being part of a successful team? 
Would you like to work on industry leading projects?
 

Join our Team

Bringing cutting-edge physical and digital technologies together to create oilfield equipment is the beating heart of our work. Devising smarter systems that control and monitor oil and gas extraction, our subsea and flexible pipe capabilities are industry leading. Our team provides support for customer operations to ensure continuity for production.

 

Partner with the best

Systems engineering is a cross-functional engineering discipline centered on an approach, mindset, and process. All activities that consider both the business and the technical needs of the customers with the goal of providing a quality product that meets the user’s needs. The discipline that executes a robust process of design, creation, and optimization of systems, consisting of identification and quantification of system requirements, creation of alternate system design concepts, performance of design trade studies, selection and implementation of the best designs and verification that the design is properly integrated and executed. Process that proceeds from concept to production to operation.

As a GLOBAL ANALYSIS ENGINEER, you will be responsible for:

·       Responsible for the dynamic modeling and analysis of flexible riser systems to meet Client specifications and industry standards.

·       Assessing environmental and vessel data for implementation into a system model.

·       Providing detailed technical evaluations of riser systems as part of the project execution process.

·       Supporting development of methodologies and produce procedures for riser system analysis.

·       Reviewing, assessing and presenting design documentation results (Metocean Data, mooring reports…).

·       Producing comprehensive analysis reports for submission as part of either FEED study or Project Execution work. 

·       Interfacing with the engineering groups both internally and externally on the analysis outputs for the design of the riser system and ancillary equipment, to present a comprehensive technical package.

·       Attending client meetings in relation to the work performed.

o Manufacturing engineers
o Project managers

Preparing and maintaining technical documentation, reports, and design records.
Handling multiple projects simultaneously while meeting quality, cost, and schedule requirements.

Bachelor’s degree in electrical / Instrumentation / Electronics engineering or equivalent.
Minimum 5 years of experience in relevant industry including hardware engineering for automation / electrical control panels.
Strong experience in cabinet and panel design for industrial applications.
Solid knowledge of:
Component selection , Earthing and grounding practices and Cabling and wiring per IEC general guidelines
Experience using CAD, Eplan, MicroStation software to create, revise, review Project Drawings (System Interconnect, Power wiring, Layout drawings, Loop drawings, blocks, etc.).
Experience supporting FAT activities and interacting with inspectors or end clients.
Ability and willingness to travel for site surveys.

Knowledge of turbo rotary equipment control, protection and operation.

description:
Control Field Service Engineer 

Are you looking for the next step in your career?
 

Do you have a passion for delivering new technology and problem solving to our customers in the field?
 

Be part of our Team
 

Our Industrial and Energy Technology (IET) operates across 120 countries and serves the entire energy value-chain and industrial sector. We hold an extensive portfolio of rotating equipment, process flow, transmission technology and lifecycle services. Our Engineering Transformation team work to improve the quality of our Engineering processes.
 

Partner with the best

As a Field Service Engineer (FSE) you will represent BH both technically and professionally to ensure the equipment to be installed, maintained and started-up properly. Your key responsibilities will include:

Provide on-site technical direction on control systems installation, including loop checks, system tests during start-up, commissioning, troubleshooting and maintenance on customer owned sites in remote oilfield, power generation and industrial facilities (Power generation includes customer owned utilities, marine drives, petrochemical, paper, steel, automotive and transportation industries)
Supervise the positioning and wiring of control panels such as Unit Control Panel (UCP), auxiliary panels of any type, Direct Current Panel (DCP), battery charger and battery cells, Generator Control & Protection Panel (GCPP), Motor Control Center (MCC), etc., particularly electrical hook up, pneumatic hook up, primary hook up and field wiring done by client or sub-contractor
Check the functionality of the control sequencing for all auxiliary systems, relevant to the turbine and driven equipment such as lube oil system, hydraulic oil system, oil coolers, starting means (motor & torque converter/gas expander/hydraulic starter & pumps etc.), enclosure and building ventilation systems, Fire & Gas detection system, compressor seal oil system, compressor dry gas seal system, process gas coolers, fuel and process gas valves, anti-surge system, etc.
Leading Installation, Maintenance, Commissioning Site Activities with proper Customer/Company Schedule Targets Mindset following strictly Quality and HSE Rules
Establish through the immediate Report after the Daily HSE Toolbox Talking the critical activity tasks and remark any HSE aspect to be followed
Utilizing Problem Solving Skills, Engineering Instructions, Drawings, and Process Instructions during Turbomachinery’s Commissioning and Start-up Activities - Possessing the Technical Capability to troubleshoot and provide routine maintenance checkout for Gas Turbines Products
Preparation of job-planning documents based to Assignment’s Scope of Work (Installation, Upgrade, Outage)
Provide leadership and technical direction to skilled labor, performing work at customer sites, maintaining strong safety mindset to assure the executed work reflects the technical requirements within Baker Hughes and customer safety standards
Providing input for Daily Outage and Weekly Installation Reports
Communicate effectively with Service/Installation/Project Managers and Site Manager about job planning, job execution, job progression as well as personnel site arrivals and departures
Prepare timely and accurate technical reports for customer records and a reference for future field service interventions.
Actively participate to customer and/or contractor meeting.
Apply all Quality procedures and documentation applicable to specific activities, ensuring they are properly followed and updated
Ensure that Site Quality Check List/Job Cards/Field Procedure are applied, and relevant documentation is properly signed.
Ensure reports and drawings “marked-up” are completed.
Ensure all Non-Conformity (technical and materials) are properly addressed using Baker Hughes e-tools and follow up till resolution.
Ensure compliance with local/current legislation, requests & requirements present in the site Safety Manual

Fuel your passion
 

To be successful in this role you will:

Have Engineering Degree with minimum 10 years of relevant field experience.
Have strong knowledge on rotating equipment installation/ commissioning /maintenance/ Troubleshooting; Hands on expertise on of HDGT (Frame 5/2, 6B, 7E & 9E) field Instrumentation, Control logic and their auxiliaries.
High expertise and Hands-On Knowledge of Mark Vie turbine control panels.
Knowledge of PLC control panels
Experience on DLN (Dry Low NOx) systems mapping.
Be able to speak fluent English language (Speaking and writing. Crucial for Report, Customer interaction and communication with ENG HQ technical alignment)
Have strong customer service-orientation, and the ability to communicate effectively with a range of stakeholders.
Proven ability to work efficiently without direct supervision.
Proven analytical and quality improvement ability.
Strong interpersonal and leadership skills
Health, Safety and Environmental mindset and compliance.
This role requires extensive travel. Applicants must be willing and able to travel significantly (not less than 70%) without geographical restriction including offshore

description:

Are you a Project Engineer looking for an interesting and inspiring opportunity?
 

Would you like to work on Flexible Pipe Systems?
 

Join our Flexible Pipe Systems team
 

We devise smarter systems to control and monitor oil and gas extraction. Innovating in the energy industry, our subsea and surface pressure capabilities are industry leading. The Flexible Pipe Systems business supply specialist unbonded flexible subsea flowline and riser technology globally.
 
 

Partner with the best
 

As a Lead Project Engineer, you will own the project control activity globally and drive consistent functional specifications and common global processes for projects implementation. You will manage activities that are conducted to better understand or ultimately meet the expectations of the customer.
 

As a Lead Project Engineer, you will be responsible for:

Leading the review and approval of all engineering changes for assigned product lines including:
o Ensure BOM changes are complete and accurate with clear engineering substantiation for the change.
o Change addresses all interfacing components and systems.
o Assigning the appropriate CID reviewers & approvers
Communicating across direct organization. Presents to senior leaders in specific technical space and on cross functional teams on how technologies interconnect and contribute to overall strategy

Fuel your passion

Have a Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college (or a high school diploma / GED with proven experience in Engineering/Technology).

Comparing, standardizing, and implementing good practices between the three engineering sites.

title: Technicien(ne) mécanique – contrôle et essais (F/H)
description:
Vous êtes à la recherche d'une opportunité intéressante et inspirante ?

Vous avez envie de faire partie d’une équipe performante ?

Faites partie d'une équipe performante !

Chez Baker Hughes, nous transformons l'avenir de l'énergie. Présents dans plus de 120 pays, nous développons et déployons des technologies et des services de pointe pour faire progresser l'énergie. Depuis plus d'un siècle, nos inventions révolutionnent l'énergie. Aujourd'hui, nous apportons notre expertise pour rendre le pétrole et le gaz plus sûrs, plus propres et plus efficaces.

Collaborez avec les meilleur(e)s

En tant que Technicien(ne) mécanique – contrôle et essais (F/H),  vous serez en charge de contrôler la conformité de fonctionnement d’un appareil en test ainsi que de l’instrumentation et des accessoires qui le compose suivant une spécification d’essai.

A ce titre, vous serez chargé(e) de :

Identifier les contrôles et les procédures de tests/essais à réaliser, à partir du cahier des charges et des dossiers techniques.

Sélectionner le matériel de contrôle ou d’essais et vérifier sa conformité client.

Installer les appareils sur le banc de test et les périphériques (Instrumentation, outillages, moteur, lubrification,)

Préparer et configurer tous les systèmes d’acquisition de données (Adre, eurotherme…)

Conduire l’essai afin de contrôler la conformité de fonctionnement d’un appareil en test ainsi que l’instrumentation et les accessoires qui le compose

Analyser les mesures, diagnostiquer les causes de dysfonctionnement et effectuer les modifications de mise en conformité du produit si besoin.

Réaliser les opérations de démontage et remontage des appareils sur le banc de test.

title: ITC Program Manager
description:
Responsibilities: 

Program Management & Governance 

Lead and continuously enhance Baker Hughes’ global trade compliance program in alignment with company standards, U.S. and international export control regulations (including EAR, ITAR, OFAC, and BIS), and applicable local laws. 

Develop, implement, and maintain global procedures and internal controls related to trade compliance activities, ensuring consistent execution across regions. 

Establish performance metrics and reporting dashboards to monitor program effectiveness and risk exposure. 

Support periodic compliance reviews, risk assessments, and management reporting to the Global Compliance & Legal leadership. 

Collaborate with digital and data governance teams to strengthen system-based compliance monitoring and reporting. 

Denied Party Screening (DPS) Oversight 

Coordinate enterprise-wide denied/restricted party screening program, ensuring timely screening of customers, suppliers, partners, and transactions in accordance with Baker Hughes policy and applicable law. 

Maintain and enhance partner screening programs and systems including workflows, escalation matrices, and documentation protocols. 

Provide day-to-day guidance to business teams on handling potential matches, licensing requirements, and release procedures. 

Coordinate periodic reviews to validate data accuracy and screening effectiveness. 

Liaise with IT and Digital Technology teams to ensure automation, system integrity, and data governance. 

Training, Awareness & Communication 

Design and implement comprehensive trade compliance training and awareness programs across global functions. 

Deliver targeted in-person and virtual sessions for high-risk roles such as logistics, sales, procurement, and operations. 

Partner with Corporate Communications to launch periodic campaigns and awareness initiatives aligned with Baker Hughes’ Integrity Forward culture. 

Track completion metrics and continuously enhance training content to reflect evolving regulatory expectations and business operations. 

Collaboration 

Work with Trade Compliance & Business Personnel to map and develop Trade compliance processes and procedures. 

Participate in industry working groups to stay current on global trade developments and emerging enforcement trends. 

Coordinate and harmonize processes and standards between segments, business lines, and functions. 

Continuous Improvement & Risk Mitigation 

Drive process improvement initiatives leveraging automation, data analytics, and best practices. 

Benchmark the program against industry standards and recommend enhancements to maintain best-in-class compliance. 

Support the integration of trade compliance controls within the Enterprise Policy Hub and other cross-functional compliance frameworks. 

Contribute to the broader Compliance & Integrity organization’s mission to foster trust, transparency, and accountability. 

Previous Experience and Competencies: 

Education: ​ Bachelor’s degree in International Business, Law, Supply Chain, or related discipline; Master’s or JD preferred. 

Experience:​ Minimum of 7–10 years of progressive experience in global trade compliance, preferably within a multinational industrial, energy, or manufacturing company. 

In-depth knowledge of U.S. export control and sanctions regulations (EAR, ITAR, OFAC) and experience managing global screening programs. 

Working knowledge of international sanctions and trade regulation, including EU, UK, and China regulation. 

Strong working knowledge of SAP GTS or equivalent global trade management system. 

Proven ability to develop training, manage cross-functional initiatives, and influence across a global matrixed organization. 

Exceptional analytical, communication, and project management skills. 

High level of integrity, sound judgment, and ability to navigate complex compliance issues.

As a Project Contract Manager, you will be responsible for:

Supporting the project team to formalize contract variations, whenever risks/opportunities having impact on project costs occur.

Support the project teams in addressing and resolving contractual disputes and/or claims avoiding legal escalation and unlocking payments and unbilled milestones, including finalization and execution of settlement agreements.

Keep project claims tracker fully update, allowing periodic release of contract management metrics/KPIs

Inform promptly the contract mgmt. ldr and legal dept when disputes with Clients and partners are likely to result in litigation proceedings.

Support the contract mgmt. ldr and legal dept in the management of litigation proceeding.

Identifying, tracking and addressing to the commercial department any contractual lesson learned identified during the project execution.

description:
Are you a Field Service Engineer looking for an interesting and inspiring opportunity?

Do you enjoy being part of a successful team?
 

Join our Field Service team

Our Industry & Energy Technology (IET) team provides industry-leading products and services that optimize the extraction, production, and processing of energy. We help a diverse range of customers across the value chain to reduce operating costs and improve productivity. Our team plays an integral role by helping the business plan for the future.

Partner with the best

As a Field Service Engineer, you will be the primary on‑site contact for our global customers, delivering high‑quality technical support across installation, maintenance, commissioning, and troubleshooting activities. We have several global openings for professionals with strong experience and genuine passion for both the mechanical and control aspects of our rotating equipment.

You will work on a wide range of technologies, including Aeroderivative Gas Turbines, Heavy Duty Gas Turbines, Steam Turbines, Reciprocating and Centrifugal Compressors, and their associated auxiliary systems.

Your work will include borescope inspections, blade work, combustion and hot‑section replacements, engine swaps, and start‑up of control panels and sequencing systems.

This role requires strong leadership, technical versatility, and a commitment to safety and operational excellence. You will also have opportunities to expand your product knowledge and technical skills in a dynamic and innovative environment.

As a Field Service Engineer (Mechanical or Control), you will be responsible for:

Safely performing installation, maintenance, repair, and troubleshooting of rotating equipment and auxiliary systems.
Carrying out mechanical activities such as hot‑section replacements, top‑case work, alignment, bolting, hydraulic bolting, flange management, and component repair.
Executing control‑related tasks including start‑up of control panels, calibration, sequencing, DLN/DLE mapping, and combustion tuning.
Conducting  borescope inspections, blade work, combustion/hot‑section replacements, and engine swaps.
Using hand tools and power tools to perform general and advanced maintenance tasks.
Overseeing overhaul, troubleshooting, and commissioning activities at customer sites.
Providing e technical direction to internal teams, contractors, and skilled labor to ensure safe, compliant, and high‑quality execution.
Leading daily site activities, ensuring alignment with HSE standards and customer expectations.
Coordinating subcontractors and maintain clear communication with customers and internal stakeholders.


Fuel your passion

To be successful in this role you will:

Bring 4+ years of hands‑on experience working on aircraft engines, aeroderivative gas turbines, heavy‑duty turbines, or similar rotating equipment.
Hold an Engineering degree or a technical high‑school diploma, with proven experience in mechanical and/or control systems within the energy sector.
Demonstrate strong capability in installation, maintenance, overhaul, and troubleshooting of rotating equipment and auxiliary systems.
Have extensive experience with gas turbine maintenance, including hot‑section work, top‑case activities, and general mechanical troubleshooting.
Show solid understanding of control systems, including turbine control logic, sequencing, instrumentation, and automation.
Display an impressive customer service-orientation mindset and experience leading customers through tough decisions.
Be skilled at communicating complex technical information to customers and teams with varying levels of technical understanding.
Have a deep awareness of Health, Safety and Environmental compliance and potential risks.
Be a motivated self-starter and be able to make key decisions and innovate solutions.
Have a good English knowledge.
Be available to travel globally 70% of the time

We encourage you to submit your application, and we will be happy to evaluate your profile for opportunities in various locations.

Do you enjoy being part of team that provides high-quality project delivery for our customers?

Join a team that delivers essential projects
 

We devise smarter systems to control and monitor oil and gas extraction. Innovating in the energy industry, our subsea and surface pressure capabilities are industry leading. Our team is responsible for the successful development, deployment, and delivery of our cutting-edge, world class control systems.
 

Partner with the best
 

As Lead Product Planner you will be in-charge of planning a large subsea project. The planner will be accountable for the schedule quality and project on-time delivery. The position reports to the Materials Manager.
 

As a Lead Project Management Specialist  - Project Planning, you will be responsible for:

Scheduling Management: The planner is in-charge of the overall project schedule management, ensuring its quality (logic, clarity) and accuracy (update of dates, reflection of the scope of supply).

Coordinating: The planner will be collaborating with the other planners (product line planner & engineering planners) allocated to the project and with the execution functions (engineering, procurement, and manufacturing) to ensure the overall quality and accuracy of the schedule.

Supporting Project management: The planner is the right-hand of the project manager and, as such, will provide visibility on:
i) Creating lookaheads for activities to be completed in the future
ii) Risks in schedules and mitigation actions
iii) Opportunities in the schedule

Providing relevant reports to project management to ensure the project manager has all the tools to make the right decisions and drive on-time and on-budget project execution.

Interacting with the customer to provide schedule updates and explain the current situation, challenges, and opportunities.

Adhering to the approved processes and proactively drive the implementation of new initiatives that will lead to fully integrated planning


Fuel your passion
 

To be successful in this role you will:

Have a Bachelor / Master's degree or relevant experience.

Have experience working within planning, ideally in the oil and gas/subsea industry or a related large-scale mechanical manufacturing or controls equipment environment.

Have additional knowledge of Oracle MRP is considered a plus.

Have ability to understand the status of a project and link the schedule to the reality of the execution.

Have ability to quickly understand the risks and opportunities in the schedule and identify and drive appropriate actions.

Have strong expertise in planning a large project and using the Primavera P6 planning tool.

Installation und Inbetriebnahmen von 2D- und 3D-Röntgensystemen

Instandhaltung und Wartung von 2D- und 3D-Röntgensystemen und -komponenten

Reparaturanalyse und Vor-Ort-Reparatur von 2D- und 3D-Röntgensystemen und -komponenten

Aktive Mitarbeit bei der kontinuierlichen Verbesserung der Produktqualität und von internen Prozessabläufen

Zeichnen Dich professionelle Anwenderkenntnisse in der Diagnose und Reparatur von elektronischen und mechanischen Anlagen-Komponenten mit PC- oder Prozessor-Steuerungen aus

Partnering with business units to identify high-value automation and AI opportunities that improve efficiency, reduce risk, and enhance decision-making.

Assessing processes, workflows, and operational pain points to determine the best-fit automation or agentic solution.

Translating business problems into solution architectures centered around AI agents, orchestrations, and modern automation capabilities.

Fuel your passion
 

To be successful in this role you will:
 

Have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, Information Systems, or related field.

Have 7–10+ years of experience in solution engineering, automation, consulting, AI product development, or enterprise digital transformation.

Have strong experience architecting solutions using AI, automation, low-code/no-code platforms, and integrations.

Have ability to engage with both technical and business stakeholders, translating requirements into actionable solution designs.

Have demonstrated experience evaluating business processes and designing scalable, technology-enabled improvements.

Have excellent communication, consulting, and facilitation skills.

Have experience with platforms such as Microsoft Copilot Studio, UIPath, Gemini/Vertex tools, or similar automation/AI ecosystems.

Have background in process optimization (Lean, Six Sigma) or digital transformation.

Have understanding of data governance, responsible AI, and enterprise security requirements.

Have experience developing training or upskilling programs.

Have strong strategic thinking paired with hands-on solution engineering capability.

Have natural curiosity for emerging technologies and AI trends.

Have ability to influence and collaborate across highly matrixed environments.

Have passion for teaching, evangelizing, and empowering others to embrace AI-driven innovation.

Have bias toward action, experimentation, and continuous improvement.

description:
Sr Business Management Staff Manager - Business Operations

Are you a Valves Stream Leader motivated by deriving customer solutions and closing deals?
 

Would you like the opportunity to further develop your career with a global energy technology company?
 

Join our team!

At Baker Hughes our purpose is clear. We take energy forward making it safer, cleaner and more efficient for people and the planet. Our Sales teamwork in partnership with our global customers to build loyalty and develop sales growth. We take responsibility for the long-term success of the business by building trusted relationships and an understanding of our customers.
 

Partner with the best

The Value Stream Leader position will be responsible for wing-to-wing management of special new equipment from order entry to remittance for project management, engineering, supply chain management, manufacturing operations and people aspects of their Becker and Mooney Brand.

This position is responsible for providing organizational leadership, business development and client relationship management (Customer, Channel Partner, and Assoco). Major focus and interaction with customers and managing all activites and operations aspect of the value stream.

As a Value Stream Leader, you will be responsible for:

Overseeing all aspects of the business through strategic leadership and effective tactical management.

Collaborating with Sales and Channel Partners to align manufacturing capacity with strategic revenue growth.

Coaching, engaging, and directing staff to deliver operational results that are meeting and exceeding organizational expectations for the Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), including safety, quality, cost, delivery, training, compliance, on-time delivery, overdue backlog, NPS, communications, inventory, and cash.

Owning plant Value Stream P&L, budgets, forecasts, and developing and implementing strategy.

Reviewing monthly and annual financial statements for budgetary comparisons, assessing performance levels using gap analysis, and identifying action-oriented, corrective responses as necessary.

Collaborating with functional leaders (Quality, Human Resources, EHS, Materials, Sourcing, Engineering, etc.) for effective deployment of functional strategies, initiatives, and programs that are affecting the location, and ensuring all teams are strategically aligned with the regions and Company’s goals.

Leading operations with a view to improving manufacturing processes through improved asset utilization and strategic capital investment.

Creating and managing capital budgets, long-range site and facility master plans in order to meet growth objectives of your product line.

Supporting product launch and NPI in accordance with the organization’s launch initiatives.

Championing learning and implementation of Lean in your Value Stream.

Driving the identification, selection, and prioritization of projects and maintaining a productivity (lean) project pipeline on an ongoing basis.

Ensuring compliance with all required OSHA, ISO, and other required certification standards.

Making sure best practices are at the forefront of all projects such as equipment installation, safety, 5S, quality, lean, preventative maintenance, etc.

Establishing managerial leadership, credibility, and trust through clear communication and actions with all levels of the organization (Positive Employee Relations).

Enforcing ethical business practices and being a model for the Core Values of the Company.

Have a Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited university.

Have 5+ years of commercial customer-facing experience.

Have 5+ years of experience in leadership.

Have strong communication skills to interact with employees at all levels.

Have the ability to lead and motivate a team.

Have the ability to prioritize work in a fast-paced environment.

Have a thorough knowledge and understanding of lean principles and processes.

Have the ability to read and understand common financial reports.

Have proficiency in MS Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).

Desired Characteristics:

Have a self-starter mindset with strong financial and analytical skills.

Have manufacturing experience.

Have strong written and verbal communication skills.

Have the ability to translate ideas into clear, high-impact communications (e.g., emails, PowerPoint, papers).

Have excellent problem structuring, identification, and resolution skills.

Have strong attention to detail, passion for strategic thinking and problem solving, and ability to deliver rich business insights to drive decisions.

Have proven cross-functional project management and leadership skills, leading to positive organizational change.

Have superior program management, leadership, and influence skills with the ability to plan, track, and report progress.

Have the ability to work in a productive, collaborative, and cooperative way with a variety of people.

Have the ability to influence across functional teams (e.g., engineering, operations, sales, channel partners) and at senior leadership/executive levels, and maintain good judgment in fast-paced, high-stress environments.

Have a mechanical background and/or technical aptitude to work in a highly engineered production environment.

Are you excited by the prospect of working for an industry leader in Energy Technology?

Join our team!

Description

The Quality Manager will report solid line to the Regional Quality Manager and will be responsible for ensuring effective application of the Baker Hughes Quality Management System (QMS) on projects and services performed at site.

This role will ensure, through team and process management, that the products manufactured, delivered, and/or received by Baker Hughes meet the needs and expectations of customers, always in accordance with applicable standards, procedures, and technical requirements.

The Site Quality Manager will be responsible for:

Manage the project quality, quality control and assurance for onshore and offshore activities, seeking a collaborative, safe, and productive environment. 
Responsible for preparing the annual budget plan (AP) for Quality function including CoPQ forecast, Headcounts and expenses and manage all those provisions across the year.
Monitor team utilization and efficiency as per targets defined and apply improvement actions as needed.
Periodically evaluate team performance, recognize or define improvement plans for Quality team members.
Lead hiring processes for all quality positions at site.
Ensure appropriate content of information is timely communicated across all layers in the organization.
Interface with Supplier Quality and Sourcing organization to develop a robust quality plan to support business through of supplier’s improvement performance.
Assess, submit and provide infrastructure and resources for a productive and quality environment.
Ensure that functional reports are following the relevant global and customer requirements.
Chair quality sessions with customers locally for performance and satisfaction review.
Monitor and evaluate the SP&S KPIs performance in a monthly basis, and when needed to take and/or manage actions to improve the results to meet the business goals.
Manage customer issues’ resolution and non-productive time cases across the site.
Deploy a plan for management of non-conformances and its reduction to meet global targets.

Fuel your passion

Bachelor’s degree in mechanical or production or bachelor’s degree in business administration.
5 years of experience in Oil & Gas industry exercising directly or indirectly Quality duties. 
Previous experience in projects, people or process leader.
Continuous improvement mindset.
Knowledge in local customer quality requirements related to fabrication and/or services in subsea equipment.
Role model in customer interfaces.
Solid experience in quality tools for developing improvement actions (5whys, fishbone, FMEA, 5S, Lean, 6-Sigma).
Solid knowledge in Quality internal and external audits.

Strong leadership skills. 
Negotiation and influencing skills with internal and external stakeholders.
Fluent English.
Clear thinker and effective communication skills.
Problem solving skills.

Collaboration and ethic on everything that is done.

Join our Team!

Industry Energy technology (IET) part of Baker Hughes Company operates across 120 countries and serves the entire energy value-chain and industrial sector. We hold an extensive portfolio of rotating equipment, process flow, transmission technology and lifecycle services. Our mechanical Engineering Team uses cutting-edge technology to design gas and steam turbines, compressors and expanders.

Partner with the best

As a Welder, you will be responsible for:

Assembling pieces of metal together or repairing damage in metal components using heavy machinery that emits high heat, melting the metal into shape.

Reading drawings and Reading/Taking measurements to plan layout and procedures.

Determining the appropriate welding equipment or method based on requirements

Setting up components for welding according to specifications (e.g. cut material with powered saws to match measurements)

Operating angle grinders to prepare the parts that must be welded

Aligning components using calipers, rulers etc. and clamp pieces

Welding components using manual or semi-automatic welding equipment in various positions (vertical, horizontal or overhead)

Repairing machinery and other components by welding pieces and filling gaps

Testing and inspecting welded surfaces and structure to discover flaws

Maintaining equipment in a condition that does not compromise safety

Working within precise limits or standards of accuracy.

Using general hand tools, power tools needed for welding and precision measuring equipment.

Complying with all applicable quality, health, safety, and environmental directives and regulations

Having ownership for completion of QC Sheets, manufacturing forms, completion work forms

High School Diploma or equivalent. 3+ years experience in welding.

description:

Join our customer focused team

Our Industrial and Energy Technology (IET) operates across 120 countries and serves the entire energy value-chain and industrial sector. We hold an extensive portfolio of rotating equipment, process flow, transmission technology and lifecycle services. Our Engineering Transformation team work to improve the quality of our Engineering processes.

Partner with the best

As a Systems Technical Lead, you'll be a subject matter expert in the technical operations of Cordant Solutions™. This role supports project engineering and services through technical reviews, including system engineering design, network design, system integration, OT cybersecurity, explosive atmosphere design, functional safety design, and commissioning quality for machinery protection and condition monitoring hardware and software in OT environments. In addition, the role ensures compliance with regulatory and standards requirements for solutions engineered and serviced for specific customers and countries.

As a Systems Technical Lead, you will be responsible for:

•    Evaluating and reviewing project designs, including system architecture drawings, BoMs, and configurations, to ensure alignment with product capabilities, standards, and customer requirements.
•    Reviewing pre-commissioned CMS software configurations performed by the field services team.
•    Supporting field service engineers with site-related issues not directly attributable to products. Mentor project engineers and service engineers.
•    Supporting the NPI team with Alpha and Beta testing of both hardware and software.
•    Assisting the pre-sales team with non-standard technical requests, such as explosive atmosphere installations, OT cybersecurity, third-party system integration, technical regulations and standards, maritime applications, etc.
•    Driving continuous improvement in design, processes, and support initiatives such as variable cost reduction. Conduct training on products for internal functions as needed.

Fuel your passion

To be successful in this role you will:

•    Have a Bachelor’s degree in computer science, electrical, electronics, or instrumentation engineering.
•    Have a minimum of 10 years of experience in Bently Nevada or similar OEM environments, including hands-on project engineering, field commissioning, industrial networking, system integration, and OT cybersecurity.
•    Have CompEx, IECEx certification for hazardous area applications or related credentials.
•    Have Strong knowledge of Bently Nevada products. Have In-depth understanding of API 670 standard.
•    Have Solid foundation in computer networking and OT cybersecurity principles. Have Experience with explosive atmosphere installation standards such as IEC 60079-14 and functional safety standards such as IEC 61508 and IEC 61511
•    Have Working knowledge of IEC general safety standards: 61010, 61439, 62406, and 61000-6-X. Have Good understanding of technical regulations and standards processes.
•    Have Strong knowledge of OT protocols (e.g., Modbus, OPC) and APIs. Have Proficiency in network segmentation, firewall configuration, and secure remote access.
•    Have Hands-on experience with OT/ICS-specific security tools and backup systems. Have Knowledge of cybersecurity frameworks and regulatory standards (e.g., NIST CSF, NERC CIP).

title: Field Service Mechanical Engineer
description:
Field Service Mechanical Engineer – Americas BRUSH Team

Are you passionate about Mechanical Engineering? Are you a Mechanical Engineer looking for a new opportunity?

Join our Baker Hughes – Americas BRUSH Team

We are the leader in high-voltage rotating equipment services. Our Americas BRUSH Team delivers installation, maintenance, and repair solutions for generators, motors, and sync condensers across North and South America. With hubs in Houston and Brazil, we’re expanding to meet growing demand and support our customers with excellence.

Partner with the best

As a Field Service Mechanical Engineer, you’ll play a key role in delivering technical solutions at customer sites. From inspections and alignments to installations and rebuilds, you’ll ensure our equipment performs to the highest standards. You’ll collaborate with global teams and attend trainings in Italy, UK, and Czech Republic to stay ahead of the curve.

As a Field Service Mechanical Engineer, you will be responsible for:

Performing mechanical inspections, maintenance, and repairs on generators per OEM standards

Stripping down, rebuilding, fault-finding, and overhauling large generators and related equipment

The Lead Treasury Analyst plays a critical role in developing and executing enterprise‑wide funding, liquidity, and exposure management strategies. This position manages key analytical processes that safeguard Baker Hughes’ balance sheet, including FX and interest rate risk analytics, hedging execution, and Treasury Management System (TMS) governance.

As a Lead Treasury Analyst, you will be responsible for:

title: Technik testovania a opráv
description:
Technik testovania a opráv

Máte skúsenosti s testovaním elektrotechnických výrobkov a prácou s meracími prístrojmi, napríklad s osciloskopom?

Vykonávali ste vo svojej predchádzajúcej praxi opravy, nastavovanie alebo funkčné skúšky elektrotechnických výrobkov?

Spolupracujte s tými najlepšími 

Spoločnosť patrí do medzinárodnej korporácie Baker Hughes, ktorá poskytuje rozsiahle služby a technické riešenia v oblasti tažby a spracovania ropy a plynu. Má pobočky vo viac než 120 krajinách a zamestnáva viac ako 60,000 ľudí po celom svete.

Spoločnosť Baker Hughes Slovakia patrí do divízie Digital Solutions, ktorá je dynamickou divíziou celej korporácie a jej hlavným poslaním je poskytovanie riešení pre maximalizáciu ekonomickej výkonnosti prevádzkových aktív zákazníkov prostredníctvom rôznych inovácií, metód moderného riadenia, sensorových a inšpekčných technológií, zberu dát, informačného manažmentu alebo odborných kontrolných riešení.

Samotná spoločnosť Baker Hughes Slovakia, s.r.o. so sídlom v Novom Meste nad Váhom sa zaoberá výrobou ultrazvukových sond používaných v nedeštruktívnej defektoskopii, ako aj strojárskou výrobou častí do priemyselných testovacích zariadení používaných v petrochemickom priemysle.

Rozviňte svoju technickú zručnosť

Technik testovania a opráv zohráva zásadnú úlohu pri zabezpečení kvality a spoľahlivosti elektrotechnických výrobkov. Na tejto pozícii budete testovať ultrazvukové sondy, pracovať s meracími prístrojmi a vykonávať kontroly, ktoré sú kľúčové pre bezchybný priebeh výroby. Vašou úlohou bude vyhodnocovať parametre výrobkov, zaznamenávať výsledky meraní a vykonávať jednoduché opravy či nastavenia podľa interných špecifikácií.

Presná práca s technickou dokumentáciou, dôsledné merania a schopnosť identifikovať odchýlky priamo prispievajú k vysokej kvalite finálnych produktov. Vďaka vašej odbornosti podporíte plynulý chod výroby, spoľahlivé dodávky a neustále zlepšovanie procesov.

Vaše zodpovednosti budú zahŕňať: 

 vykonávať kontroly v elektrotechnickej výrobe pomocou bežných merných nástrojov, skúšobných pomôcok a meracích prístrojov - práca s osciloskopom

title: Dílenské plánování výroby (m,ž)
description:
Dílenské plánování výroby

Máte zkušenosti v oblasti koordinace a planovani?

Mluvíte plynně anglicky a česky?

Spolupracujte s těmi nejlepšími

Baker Hughes je přední globální energeticko‑technologická společnost, která poskytuje inovativní řešení zvyšující bezpečnost, čistotu a efektivitu energie napříč celým hodnotovým řetězcem. Společnost působí ve ice než 120 zemích a kombinuje hluboké znalosti odvětví s pokročilým inženýrstvím a digitálními technologiemi na podporu výroby energie, její transformace a dekarbonizace. S ice než stoletou tradicí spolupracuje Baker Hughes se zákazníky v ropném a plynárenském průmyslu, v průmyslových odvětvích I na rozvíjejících se energetických trzích, aby urychlila pokrok směrem k udržitelnější energetické budoucnosti.

Rozviňte svou vášeň

Specialista materiálového plánování hraje klíčovou roli v zajištění hladkého průběhu výroby prostřednictvím plánování, koordinace a řízení toků materiálu v celém výrobním prostředí. Tato pozice převádí signály poptávky (prognózy, zákaznické objednávky, plánované výrobní příkazy) do konkrétních materiálových plánů a zajišťuje včasnou dostupnost komponent na výrobní lince. Díky udržování přesných dat, optimalizaci zásob a podpoře neustálého zlepšování přispíváte k provozní dokonalosti a dodržování termínů dodávek.

Vaše odpovědnosti budou zahrnovat:

Plánování a rozvrhování materiálu tak, aby byly splněny výrobní požadavky a nedocházelo k výpadkům.

Převádění prognóz poptávky do materiálových objednávek ve spolupráci s výrobou, dodavatelským řetězcem a obchodními týmy.

Analýzu přicházející poptávky a identifikaci výjimek nebo příležitostí k využití stávajících zásob.

Udržování přesných plánů materiálu v souladu s požadavky zákazníků a provozními potřebami.

Sledování úrovní zásob, bezpečnostních zásob, stárnoucího materiálu a materiálu v přepravě, aby byla zajištěna optimální dostupnost.

Koordinaci priorit materiálu s týmy Product Line, Sales a Service Delivery (posuny termínů, urychlení dodávek).

Provádění analýz v oblasti materiálového hospodářství, včetně trendů spotřeby a celkového stavu zásob.

Podporu iniciativ neustálého zlepšování s cílem zefektivnit tok materiálu a zvýšit provozní výkonnost.

Abyste byli v této roli úspěšní, budete potřebovat:

Středoškolské nebo vyšší odborné vzdělání v oblasti supply chain, logistiky, výroby, nebo odpovídající praxi.

Zkušenosti s plánováním materiálu, řízením zásob, výrobním plánováním nebo správou objednávek.

Základní znalost SAP, MRP nebo podobných plánovacích systémů.

Silné analytické a problémové myšlení a důraz na detail.

Schopnost spolupracovat napříč týmy a ovlivňovat klíčové partnery ve výrobě a dodavatelském řetězci.

Schopnost dotahovat úkoly do konce, pracovat s pocitem naléhavosti a převzít odpovědnost.

Plynulou češtinu v psané i mluvené formě pro efektivní komunikaci ve výrobním prostředí.

Výhodou bude (není podmínkou):

Certifikace APICS nebo podobná kvalifikace v oblasti supply chain.

Praxe ve výrobním nebo průmyslovém prostředí.

Znalost metod neustálého zlepšování (Lean, Six Sigma).

Pracujte způsobem, který vám vyhovuje

Uznáváme, že každý je jiný a že každý chce pracovat a podávat nejlepší výkon jiným způsobem. V této roli můžeme nabídnout následující flexibilní pracovní uspořádání:

Možnosti flexibilní práce proberte prosím s náborářem

Spolupráce s námi

Naši lidé jsou srdcem všeho, co v Baker Hughes děláme. Víme, že jsme lepší, když se všichni naši zaměstnanci rozvíjejí, jsou angažovaní a mohou být sami sebou. Investujeme do jejich zdraví a pohody, školíme je, odměňujeme talent a rozvíjíme lídry na všech úrovních, abychom ze sebe navzájem dostali to nejlepší.

Co nabízíme vám

Naše vynálezy mění energetiku už více než století. Abychom mohli pokračovat i zítra, musíme posouvat hranice už dnes. Odměňujeme ty, kteří přijímají změny, balíčkem benefitů, který odráží, jak moc si jejich přínosu vážíme. Můžete očekávat:

Pracovní doba 7,5 hodiny denně

Příspěvek na doplňkové penzijní pojištění 15 600 Kč ročně

Zajímavé platové ohodnocení a čtvrtletní bonusy (dle splnění firemních a osobních cílů)

Směnný provoz s nadstandardními příplatky

Pravidelné každoroční navyšování mzdy

Firemní vzdělávání (povinná školení i rozvoj hrazený zaměstnavatelem)

Vlastní jídelna, výběr ze 6 jídel

Stravenkový paušál 115 Kč za odpracovanou směnu

5 týdnů dovolené

Flexi passy (volnočasové poukázky)

Výborná dostupnost MHD

Stabilní zaměstnání ve firmě s dlouhou tradicí

title: Senior Principal, Project Engineering - Systems
description:
Job Description

Are you ready to lead front‑end subsea engineering studies?

Are you able to drive systems architecture and field development?

Partner with the best

Baker Hughes stands as a leading global energy‑technology company, delivering innovative solutions that make energy safer, cleaner, and more efficient across the entire value chain. Operating in more than 120 countries, the company blends deep industrial expertise with advanced engineering and digital technologies to support energy production, transformation, and decarbonization. With over a century of heritage, Baker Hughes partners with customers in oil and gas, industrial sectors, and emerging energy markets to accelerate progress toward a more sustainable energy future.

Fuel your passion

As a Principal / Senior Subsea Systems Engineer, you will work within a multidisciplinary team to lead Front End Engineering and Development studies, partnering with product experts to provide systems‑level guidance across projects and technology programs. You will conduct trade studies, support field development, and take ownership of cost, schedule, quality, and HS&E performance. The role also involves contributing to process improvements, ensuring smooth hand‑offs to tendering and execution teams, and supporting regional sales and commercial teams through early customer engagement and technical expertise.

As a Principal / Senior Subsea Systems Engineer, you will be responsible for:

Leading front‑end subsea engineering studies, field development activities, and systems‑level trade‑off evaluations.

Providing technical leadership, mentoring junior engineers, and driving process‑improvement and data‑driven decision‑making.

Developing subsea system concepts and optimizing designs across the full lifecycle, from feasibility through decommissioning.

Managing interfaces across global product teams, delivery partners, and clients while ensuring quality compliance.

Liaising with customers to clarify requirements, manage expectations, and support early‑engagement and commercial activities.

Supporting tendering, detailed engineering, execution phases, and proposal preparation as a technical contributor or reviewer.

Representing Baker Hughes at external events, promoting new technologies, and enhancing internal systems‑engineering capability.

To be successful in this role you will:

Have a master’s or bachelor’s degree, ideally with experience in Oil & Gas operations, subsea equipment, SURF, or offshore renewables.

Have strong interpersonal and written/verbal communication skills.

Have broad knowledge of project and engineering management processes, systems engineering, and decision‑analysis frameworks (INCOSE, AACE, APM, PRINCE2 desirable).

Have proven project‑engineering experience within a multidisciplinary environment.

Have experience designing and selecting solutions across areas such as field architecture, flow assurance, process engineering, SPS, risers, pipelines, controls, constructability, and installation.

Be able to travel internationally for customer meetings, project needs, and short‑term assignments.

Work in a way that works for you
 

We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:

description:
CNC Machinist

Crafting Precision Components Through Advanced CNC Expertise

• Do you excel in machining highly detailed, one‑of‑a‑kind components

• Are you passionate about precision craftsmanship and solving complex machining challenges?

Partner with the best

Baker Hughes is a global energy technology company serving the oil and gas sector across more than 120 countries. The Commercial & Sales organization drives growth by building strong customer partnerships, commercializing hydrocarbons, and delivering integrated equipment and service solutions. With a focus on digital transformation and energy transition, the team leverages data‑driven insights to optimize sales performance and maximize customer value.

Fuel your passion

The CNC Machinist is supporting the production of high‑precision, small components used in specialized tooling applications. You are operating in a low‑volume, high‑mix environment where craftsmanship, adaptability, and problem‑solving are essential. You are contributing to the creation of custom, one‑off parts by applying advanced machining strategies, ensuring exceptional accuracy, and collaborating closely with engineering and quality teams to deliver best‑in‑class tooling solutions.

As a CNC Machinist, you will be responsible for:

Setting up, programming, and operating CNC mills, lathes, and related equipment to manufacture highly detailed components

Interpreting complex engineering drawings, 3D models, and manufacturing instructions to meet extremely tight tolerances

Machining one‑of‑a‑kind parts and custom tooling using advanced machining strategies for unique, non‑repetitive jobs

Performing in‑process inspections using precision instruments such as micrometers, bore gauges, and CMM equipment

Optimizing machining processes by selecting appropriate tooling, speeds, feeds, and cutting strategies

Collaborating with engineering, tooling, and quality teams to resolve manufacturability challenges

Maintaining equipment cleanliness, calibration, and performing basic preventive maintenance

Documenting setups, adjustments, and work performed to support repeatability for future tooling needs

Adhering to all safety, quality, and compliance standards

To be successful in this role you will:

Have 5+ years of CNC machining experience, including 3+ years working with tight‑tolerance parts (±0.0005" or tighter preferred)

Have the ability to read and interpret blueprints, GD&T callouts, and work instructions

Have experience machining small or intricate parts in a precision manufacturing environment

Have comfort working with one‑off parts, prototypes, or custom tooling with limited   process history

Have proficiency in CNC programming (G‑code); CAD/CAM experience (SolidWorks, Mastercam, Fusion 360) is a plus

Have strong knowledge of tooling selection, work holding, and machining best practices

Have the ability to detailed inspection and quality verification

Have a high school diploma or equivalent; technical training or apprenticeship preferred

Work in a way that works for you 

We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns: 
 

Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive.

Working for you 

Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we must push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:

description:
Senior Emissions Strategy Leader 

Are you looking to join a team where you can make an impact?

Join Our Team!

Baker Hughes is a growing energy technology company with operations in over 120 countries.  As the Senior Emissions Strategy Leader, you will lead a high-performing team to support the delivery of Baker Hughes’ sustainability and emissions goals, as a key commercial enabler, supporting the growth of Sustainability Advisory Services, strengthening and advancing the LCA community and EmInsights program, and ensuring the team delivers on time, with excellence, and in alignment with Baker Hughes’ eight behaviors.

Partner with the Best 

As Baker Hughes Emissions Strategy Leader, your key responsibilities are:

Team Leadership & Execution

Lead, coach and develop a diversified team to deliver strategic projects and solutions, ensuring timely, high-quality execution and operational excellence.

Foster a culture of collaboration, accountability, and continuous improvement, aligned with Baker Hughes’ eight behaviors.

Sustainability Advisory Services & EmInsights

Support the delivery and growth of Sustainability Advisory Services (GCea), including market segmentation, value proposition development, and client engagement.

Oversee the EmInsights program, ensuring the strategic rollout of verifiable emissions data and emissions data sheets, and supporting business model development and execution.

Act as a commercial enabler, translating technical solutions into business value for customers and the enterprise.

Enhance governance and controls for Sustainability Advisory solutions, collaborating with Commercial Operations leaders to drive robust, repeatable processes that ensure quality, consistency, and compliance with internal and external standards.

Support and develop the community of Baker Hughes LCA practitioners, fostering best practices in the use of the Baker Hughes life cycle assessment tool, FastLCA for accurate GHG emissions quantification, and maintaining alignment with evolving customer needs and external market requirements. Enhance governance and controls for the LCA process, including periodic updates and maintenance (i.e., annual emission factors updates).

Support the governance and controls of Sustainability Advisory solutions, collaborating with Commercial Operations leaders to drive a robust process

Stakeholder Engagement & Commercial Enablement

Build strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders, including Business Segments, Emissions Management, Commercial, and Sales teams; external customers, industry groups (as applicable) and external LCA community.

Support and educate GCea (GaffneyCline Energy Advisory) colleagues as they expand their role in commercial sales of LCA and emissions advisory services. Provide training, mentorship, and knowledge transfer to ensure GCea team members are equipped to represent Baker Hughes’ LCA capabilities and deliver value to clients.

Collaborate with GCea to develop and refine go-to-market strategies, value propositions, and client-facing materials for LCA and emissions quantification offerings.

Drive customer-facing impact by supporting proposals, tenders, and advisory projects, and by promoting Baker Hughes as a thought leader in emissions accounting and sustainability advisory.

Collaborate to embed sustainability expertise into business processes and solutions, supporting New Energy, Mature Asset Solutions, and Digital Delivery.

Process & Program Management

Oversee project management rigor, ensuring all deliverables are tracked, risks are managed, and milestones are met.

Ensure knowledge management, training, and capacity building for the team, with a focus on knowledge transfer and upskilling of the Sustainability team in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

Fuel Your Passion: 

To be To be successful in this role you will have: 

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Sustainability, Environmental Science, Engineering, or related field.

Minimum 3 years’ experience in emissions quantification, sustainability strategy, or related project management.

Proven experience leading teams and delivering complex projects on time.

Strong understanding of life cycle assessments, ISO standards (14040, 14044, 14067), and emissions quantification methodologies.

Excellent communication, stakeholder management, and problem-solving skills.
