title: Mechanical Technician – Cement workshop
description:
Er du en erfaren maskintekniker som ønsker å jobbe med spennende nye prosjekter?

Ønsker du å bruke dine mekaniske ferdigheter hos en verdensledende leverandør av energiteknologi?

Ønsker du å starte din karriere som mekaniker?

Bli med i Baker Hughes’ Assembly, Maintenance & Overhauls Team og få praktisk erfaring med å forberede og vedlikehold sement utstyr. Denne stillingen er hovedsaklig verkstedsbasert, men tilbyr noen offshore turer.

Dine arbeidsoppgaver:

· Vedlikeholde, forberede og reparere sementhoder og relatert utstyr til sement operasjoner.
· Bistå med inspeksjoner, feilsøking og testing av utstyr.
· Støtte prosessforbedringer, dokumentasjon og kvalitetskontroll.
· Opprettholde utstyrsregistre or arkiver som en del av kvalitetsprogrammer.
· Mulighet for offshore reiser for å støtte sement operasjoner.

Kvalifikasjoner

Mekanisk fagbrev eller tilsvarende.
Litt vedlikeholdserfaring er ønskelig, men ikke påkrevd: opplæring gis på jobben.
Grunnleggende forståelse av hydrauliske, mekaniske eller pneumatiske systemer er en fordel.
Nysgjerrig og villig til å lære.
Gyldig pass for sporadisk offshore reise.

Fleksible arbeidsordninger som passer for deg: 

Vi erkjenner at alle er forskjellige, og måten folk ønsker å arbeide for å yte sitt beste varierer. I denne rollen kan vi tilby følgende fleksible arbeidsmønstre:

Mulighet for offshore reise og vaktordning.

Å jobbe med oss

Våre ansatte er kjernen av det vi gjør hos Baker Hughes. Vi vet at vi er bedre når alle våre ansatte utvikles, engasjeres og kan være sitt autentiske selv på arbeid. Vi investerer i helsen og trivselen til arbeidsstyrken vår, tilbyr opplæring, belønner talenter og jobber kontinuerlig med å utvikle

ledere på alle nivåer for å få det beste ut av hverandre.

Vi tilbyr 

Våre oppfinnelser har vært banebrytende innen energibransjen i over et århundre. For å fortsette vår utvikling i morgen, forstår vi at vi må utfordre dagens grenser. Vi setter pris på de som omfavner endring, og vi belønner dette engasjementet med en omfattende pakke som gjenspeiler verdien vi legger i deres bidrag. Bli med oss, og du kan forvente:

Moderne retningslinjer for balanse mellom arbeid og fritid samt velværeaktiviteter.
Omfattende alternativer for privat helseomsorg.
Sikkerhetsnett med livsforsikring og programmer for funksjonshemmede.
Tilpassende økonomiske programmer.
Muligheten for ekstra valgfrie eller frivilige fordeler.

title: Service Pusher II - Integrated Solutions_FLD-K
description:
Partner with the best 
 

Baker Hughes es una empresa global de tecnología energética que presta servicios al sector del petróleo y el gas en más de 120 países. La organización Comercial y de Ventas impulsa el crecimiento mediante la creación de sólidas alianzas con los clientes, la comercialización de hidrocarburos y la oferta de soluciones integradas de equipos y servicios. Centrándose en la transformación digital y la transición energética, el equipo aprovecha los conocimientos basados en datos para optimizar el rendimiento de las ventas y maximizar el valor para el cliente.

Fuel your passion

El responsable del servicio de soluciones integradas dirige y coordina todo el trabajo de Baker Hughes en el pozo. Es el punto de contacto de Baker Hughes para el cliente y dirige todos los elementos de los productos, servicios y contratistas de Baker Hughes en el pozo. El objetivo principal es impulsar y garantizar un desempeño impecable en materia de salud, seguridad y medio ambiente, la entrega puntual y la excelencia constante en la prestación de servicios.

 

Job Description

Responsabilidades esenciales:

• Dirige las operaciones integradas de Baker Hughes en la plataforma en estrecha colaboración con el operador, el contratista de la plataforma y cualquier otro tercero. Supervisa las operaciones de acuerdo con el programa de actividad del pozo.

• Coordina y asesora a todo el personal de Baker Hughes en las actividades de HSE de la plataforma, la planificación operativa y la ejecución del trabajo. Primera línea de apoyo y referencia técnica para el personal de Baker Hughes en alta mar que realiza las tareas en el pozo.

• Garantiza que el proyecto se ejecute de forma segura, conforme a la normativa y eficiente.

• Punto de contacto de Baker Hughes para el cliente en el pozo. Participa en revisiones de operaciones, reuniones de seguridad y operaciones matutinas, etc.

• Proporciona entradas puntuales en el Centro de Trabajo para las actividades de Soluciones Integradas y aportaciones oportunas a los informes DBR, la evaluación de KPI y los planes de mejora.

• Responsable de la demanda, planificación y coordinación del personal offshore/onshore (cuando corresponda).

• Optimiza la utilización de los recursos humanos offshore/onshore (cuando corresponda) de Baker Hughes.

• Utiliza el centro de operaciones remotas de manera eficiente durante las operaciones (si corresponde).

• Dirige las investigaciones de fallas en los equipos offshore de Baker Hughes, las reporta y las comunica según corresponda.

• Garantiza que se recopilen y apliquen las lecciones aprendidas y las mejores prácticas.

Cualificaciones/Requisitos:

• Licenciatura en un campo relevante. Una amplia experiencia puede compensar la falta de educación formal.

• Más de 8 años de experiencia relevante en la industria del petróleo y el gas.

• Experiencia como jefe de equipo.

• Conocimientos exhaustivos sobre operaciones de servicio de campo, instalación y mantenimiento.

• Competencia para planificar, resolver problemas, organizar, dirigir y controlar operaciones complejas.

• Buenas habilidades de comunicación.

• Buenas habilidades organizativas.

• Manejo del inglés escrito y oral como idioma de trabajo.

• Promoción de una cultura de colaboración y trabajo en equipo entre múltiples líneas de productos, funciones, geografías y partes externas.

Características/habilidades deseadas:

• Gran capacidad de liderazgo situacional.

• Buenas habilidades informáticas.

• Buenas habilidades de presentación.

• Estructurado.

Trabajar con nosotros

Nuestra gente es el centro de todo lo que hacemos en Baker Hughes. Sabemos que somos mejores cuando todos nuestros empleados se desarrollan, se comprometen y pueden aportar todo su potencial al trabajo. Invertimos en la salud y el bienestar de nuestra fuerza laboral, capacitamos y recompensamos el talento y desarrollamos líderes en todos los niveles para sacar lo mejor de cada uno.

Trabajando para usted

Nuestros inventos han revolucionado la energía durante más de un siglo. Pero para seguir avanzando en el futuro, sabemos que tenemos que superar los límites hoy. Damos prioridad a recompensar a aquellos que aceptan el cambio con un paquete que refleja lo mucho que valoramos su aportación.

description:
Do you enjoy working in fast‑paced production environments?

Would you like to be part of essential manufacturing processes that keep operations running efficiently and safely?

Join our team!

Our Turbomachinery & Process Solutions team provides industry‑leading products and services that optimize the extraction, production, and processing of energy. We help a diverse range of customers across the value chain to reduce operating costs and improve productivity.

Partner with the best

As an Operator – Production I, you will be supporting daily production operations across material handling, chemical processing, and documentation activities.

You are assisting with transporting raw materials, drumming out products, collecting samples, and managing waste safely.

You are contributing to accurate production documentation while maintaining operational safety and following routine written instructions.

You are ensuring smooth workflow, supporting plant efficiency, and working in outdoor environments across all seasons while complying with HS&E guidelines.

As an Operator – Production I, you will be responsible for:

Reading, understanding, and following routine written instructions
Performing basic mathematical calculations
Transporting, loading, and unloading raw materials and chemical products
Drumming out product from reactors and blenders
Collecting and delivering samples to the QC lab

Working outdoors year‑round in various weather conditions
Operating a forklift and obtaining/maintaining certification

Can perform basic math
Can operate a forklift or willingness to obtain certification

Driving Warehouse Efficiency Through Precision Coordination and High‑Performance Team Leadership

Transforming Warehouse Performance Through Smart Workflow Management and Team Empowerment

Partner with the best
 

Baker Hughes is a global energy technology company serving the oil and gas sector across more than 120 countries. The Warehouse Team Lead is responsible for overseeing and coordinating all warehouse activities, ensuring efficient material flow, accurate inventory management, and timely execution of inbound and outbound operations. This role supervises warehouse personnel, manages documentation and ERP transactions, and acts as a key interface between Logistics, Project Management, and the Shop/Production team. The Warehouse Team Lead drives operational excellence, supports continuous improvement initiatives, and ensures compliance with safety and quality standards.

description:
About the Role
Join Baker Hughes as an Applications Engineer specializing in Electrical Submersible Pump (ESP) systems. In this role, you will design, plan, and optimize ESP applications to ensure flawless execution across pre-job planning, job execution, and post-job analysis. You will work closely with Service Delivery Coordinators and cross-functional teams to deliver technical programs that maximize well performance and meet client objectives.

 

Key Responsibilities
Lead the Manage the Job Cycle (MtJC) process for ESP operations.
Design and validate ESP job programs, including risk mitigation and contingency plans.
Perform offset job analysis, engineering modeling, and hazard identification.
Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to ensure all technical constraints are addressed.
Provide on-demand technical support during ESP installation, recovery, and troubleshooting.
Compare planned vs. executed jobs, document lessons learned, and recommend improvements.
Participate in incident investigations and root cause analysis (RCFA).
Advise on product improvement opportunities for repetitive failures.
Support sales with technical recommendations and application design.

 

Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Electrical, Petroleum) or related STEM field.
5+ years of experience in ESP systems: installation, recovery, troubleshooting, and optimization.
Knowledge of ESP configurations: Y-Tool, Dual ESP, encapsulated systems.
Familiarity with VSD programming, downhole sensors, and performance monitoring.
Proficiency in Autograph, SAP, Beck, and data visualization tools.
Strong analytical, organizational, and communication skills.
Ability to travel to rig sites and be on-call outside normal business hours.
English proficiency: B2–C1.
Preferred Skills
Experience presenting technical solutions to clients and peers.
Ability to lead cross-functional projects and mentor junior engineers.
Operational background in artificial lift optimization and run-life analysis.

 

Why Join Us?
You’ll play a critical role in maximizing production efficiency, reducing downtime, and implementing cutting-edge ESP technologies. This is your opportunity to make a measurable impact in one of the most dynamic segments of the oilfield services industry.

description:
Generator Technician
 

Would you like to further develop your career with a global energy technology company?
 

Do you enjoy working with Electro-mechanical equipment?

Join our BRUSH Power Generation Team!
 

At Baker Hughes our purpose is clear; We take energy forward making it safer, cleaner and more efficient for people and the planet. Our IET team provides industry-leading products and services that optimize the extraction, production and processing of energy. BRUSH Power Generation enhances Baker Hughes portfolio of electromechanical equipment, including electric generators, synchronous condensers, electric motors, and associated control power management systems.

Partner with the best 

As a Generator Technician you will develop and deliver programs to train and ensure competency of channel personnel, Baker Hughes employees, and customers (end users) on the assembly, testing and servicing of Flow Control & Safety Solutions products. 

As a Generator Technician, you will be responsible for:

Rotors - Assembly of the excitation lead into the rotor; installation, brazing of the winding, 1st pressing; wedging, 2nd pressing, insulating cover under the hoop, installation of hoops, rotor repairs - service orders, production of connections for the DAX stator, insulating the exciter rotors before winding, installation of the exciter rotors, soldering of exciters, exciter bandage ;

title: Operational Excellence Leader - Americas
description:
Would you like to work for a world class organization in energy?

Are you interested in working with dynamic teams?

Join the Team!
 

Baker Hughes is the leading energy technology company, who delivers across the energy value chain through our market-leading business segments. Built on a century of experience and conducting business in over 120 countries. Our innovative technologies and services are taking energy forward! Making it safer, cleaner and more efficient for people and the planet.
 

Partner with the best
 

The Operational Excellence Leader - Americas will be responsible for all resources, and logistics required to perform services and maintenance activities on customers' site/property. These activities contribute to, maintaining, repairing and refurbishing sold or existing products. Includes all types of maintenance service (preventive and remedial), manage maintenance facilities and field services engineering.

As an Operational Excellence Leader - Americas, you will be responsible for:

Safety & Process Safety Leadership

Champion a culture of safety, integrity, and operational discipline.
Lead implementation of Process Safety Management (PSM) across assets.
Ensure effective use of HAZOP, LOPA, MOC, JSA, and critical risk management practices.
Support reduction of TRIR, PSIFs, and loss‑of‑containment events.
Partner with HSE to strengthen risk controls and mitigate high‑potential hazards.

Drive the Operational Excellence Strategy

Develop, maintain, and execute the company’s Operational Excellence roadmap.
Identify operational gaps and lead cross-functional problem-solving.
Facilitate continuous improvement using Lean, Six Sigma, Kaizen, and reliability methodologies.
Prioritize initiatives based on operational value, risk reduction, and productivity.

Improve Operational Performance

Optimize production, execution, and reliability across upstream, midstream, or downstream operations.
Reduce non‑productive time (NPT) and improve rig, plant, or facility performance.
Lead initiatives that reduce OPEX and support cost-per‑BOE improvements.
Drive improvements in turnaround planning, maintenance execution, and equipment reliability.

Standardization & Operational Discipline

Establish, deploy, and monitor Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
Ensure compliance with industry standards such as API, OSHA, ISO, and internal governance frameworks.
Conduct audits and maturity assessments to ensure sustainability of improvements.

Digital Transformation & Data-Driven Operations

Implement digital solutions (predictive analytics, digital twins, dashboards, IoT).
Partner with IT/OT teams to enhance real‑time operational visibility.
Develop and track KPIs: OEE, downtime, production efficiency, NPT, cost per BOE, energy metrics.
Enable data-driven decision-making at all levels.

Change Management & Capability Building

Build organizational capabilities in continuous improvement and problem‑solving.
Coach leaders and frontline teams to adopt OPEX tools and behaviors.
Facilitate workshops, training sessions, and best-practice sharing across assets.
Guide stakeholders through operational and cultural change.

Project Leadership

Lead cross-functional, high-impact transformation projects.
Manage project pipelines, business cases, and benefit realization.
Ensure improvements are embedded and sustained through governance and follow-up.

Qualifications

Required

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Operations, or related field.
7+ years of operations experience in oil & gas (upstream, midstream, or downstream).
Experience with Lean, Six Sigma, or continuous improvement methodologies.
Strong knowledge of process safety and operational risk management.
Proven ability to lead cross-functional teams.
Strong communication, influencing, and facilitation skills.

Preferred (Not a must, but is a nice to have)

Lean Six Sigma Black Belt or equivalent certification.
Experience in digital transformation or analytics-driven operations.
Experience working across multiple assets or regions.
Advanced degree (MBA, MS in Engineering, etc.).

Operational leadership
Process safety awareness
Data analytics and KPI management
Problem solving and critical thinking
Project management
Influence and stakeholder engagement
Change management
Coaching and capability-building
Continuous improvement mindset
Resilience and adaptability

title: Pracovník výroby generátorů - navíječ (m/ž)
description:
Navíječ (m/ž)

Hledáte práci, kde vaše pečlivost a manuální zručnost přímo ovlivňují kvalitu špičkových generátorů?

Chcete být součástí týmu, který vyrábí klíčové komponenty pro energetiku po celém světě?

Spolupracujte s těmi nejlepšími

Baker Hughes je přední globální energeticko‑technologická společnost, která poskytuje inovativní řešení zvyšující bezpečnost, čistotu a efektivitu energie napříč celým hodnotovým řetězcem. Společnost působí ve více než 120 zemích a kombinuje hluboké znalosti odvětví s pokročilým inženýrstvím a digitálními technologiemi na podporu výroby energie, její transformace a dekarbonizace. S více než stoletou tradicí spolupracuje Baker Hughes se zákazníky v ropném a plynárenském průmyslu, v průmyslových odvětvích i na rozvíjejících se energetických trzích, aby urychlila pokrok směrem k udržitelnější energetické budoucnosti.

Rozviňte svou vášeň

Jako navíječ budete pracovat v navijárně statorů a rotorů, kde podle výkresů a technologických postupů zakládáte a tvarujete cívky, izolujete, pájíte a připravujete výrobky na elektrické zkoušky. Vaše pečlivost a manuální zručnost jsou klíčové pro kvalitu našich generátorů, které putují do celého světa. Budete součástí sehraného týmu a podílet se na výrobě produktů, které mají skutečný dopad na udržitelnou energetiku.

Jako navíječ budete:

Pracovat v navijárně statorů a rotorů podle výkresů a technologických postupů

Zakládat, tvarovat a izolovat cívky

Pájet a připravovat výrobky na elektrické zkoušky

Nasazovat obruče a provádět další související činnosti

Abyste byli v této roli úspěšní, budete potřebovat:

Vyučení v oboru elektromechanik nebo elektromontér výhodou

(uplatní se i automechanik, mechanik, zámečník nebo manuálně zručný člověk se vztahem k elektrotechnice – nové zaměstnance kompletně zaučíme)

Manuální zručnost a pečlivost

Ochotu pracovat ve třísměnném provozu

Schopnost spolupracovat v týmu a dodržovat pracovní postupy

Pracujte způsobem, který vám vyhovuje

Uznáváme, že každý je jiný a že každý chce pracovat a podávat nejlepší výkon jiným způsobem. V této roli můžeme nabídnout následující flexibilní pracovní uspořádání:

Možnosti flexibilní práce proberte prosím s náborářem.

Spolupráce s námi

Naši lidé jsou srdcem všeho, co v Baker Hughes děláme. Víme, že jsme lepší, když se všichni naši zaměstnanci rozvíjejí, jsou angažovaní a mohou být sami sebou. Investujeme do jejich zdraví a pohody, školíme je, odměňujeme talent a rozvíjíme lídry na všech úrovních, abychom ze sebe navzájem dostali to nejlepší.

Co nabízíme vám

Naše vynálezy mění energetiku už více než století. Abychom mohli pokračovat i zítra, musíme posouvat hranice už dnes. Odměňujeme ty, kteří přijímají změny, balíčkem benefitů, který odráží, jak moc si jejich přínosu vážíme. Můžete očekávat:

Pracovní doba 7,5 hodiny denně

Příspěvek na doplňkové penzijní pojištění 15 600 Kč ročně

Zajímavé platové ohodnocení a čtvrtletní bonusy (dle splnění firemních a osobních cílů)

Směnný provoz s nadstandardními příplatky

Pravidelné každoroční navyšování mzdy

Firemní vzdělávání (povinná školení i rozvoj hrazený zaměstnavatelem)

Vlastní jídelna, výběr ze 6 jídel

Stravenkový paušál 115 Kč za odpracovanou směnu

5 týdnů dovolené

Flexi passy (volnočasové poukázky)

Výborná dostupnost MHD

Stabilní zaměstnání ve firmě s dlouhou tradicí

title: Lead Front End Engineer
description:
Are you ready to shape the future of subsea field development?

Are you able to lead complex systems‑engineering studies across multidisciplinary teams?

Partner with the best

Systems engineering at Baker Hughes is a collaborative, outcome‑driven discipline that brings together customers, colleagues, and partners to define and optimize subsea developments. It requires a holistic, systematic approach to design one that considers reservoir performance, subsurface behavior, flow assurance boundaries, system operability, environmental conditions, constructability, design life, intervention needs, and eventual decommissioning. By integrating these parameters, we create subsea solutions that maximize value and minimize risk across the full project lifecycle.

Fuel your passion

As a Lead Front End Engineer you will work within a multidisciplinary environment to guide early‑phase engineering and field development studies. You will partner with product experts, lead trade‑off evaluations, and provide systems‑level direction across projects and technology programs. You will take ownership of cost, schedule, quality, and HS&E performance for the studies you deliver, while contributing to process improvements and ensuring smooth transitions into tendering and execution phases. You will also support regional sales and commercial teams, providing technical expertise during early customer engagement to help secure successful project awards.

As a Lead Front End Engineer, you will be responsible for:

Leading project engineering for system definition and layout from feasibility and concept definition through to FEED.

Developing subsea field concepts and optimizing system architecture across the full lifecycle including design, manufacturing, installation, commissioning, operability, and decommissioning.

Providing voice‑of‑customer input to R&D initiatives, field optimization activities, and hardware design reviews.

Defining and managing interfaces across Baker Hughes’ global product teams, delivery partners, and client organizations.

Reporting engineering progress, technical issues, and interface matters in project meetings and progress reports.

Supporting study managers with technical interfaces, change control, variations, and overall scope delivery.

Providing technical leadership on studies, projects, and assigned tasks.

To be successful in this role you will:

Hold a Master’s degree or a bachelor’s degree with demonstrable industry experience (experience with Oil & Gas operators, subsea equipment manufacturers, SURF contractors, or offshore renewables is desirable but not essential).

Demonstrate strong interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written.

Have broad knowledge of project and engineering management processes, systems engineering, and decision‑analysis frameworks (INCOSE, AACE, APM, or PRINCE2 desirable but not essential).

Bring proven experience in project engineering within a multidisciplinary environment.

Knowledge in design and selection across one or more of the following: field architecture, flow assurance, process engineering, Subsea Production Systems, risers, flowlines and pipelines, control systems, constructability, or installation.

Be available for international travel for customer meetings, project needs, and short‑term assignments.

Be based in London, Aberdeen, Bristol, or Florence, with flexible working options considered.

Note: No relocation assistance is provided.

Work in a way that works for you

We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:

One of our core values as a business is collaboration and, as such, whilst flexible work options are available, we believe there is a great benefit of having our teams co-located in one of our many office in the United Kindgom.

Working with us

Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. title: Technicien SAV (F/H)
description:
Aimez-vous faire partie d'une équipe qui garantit la plus haute qualité ?

Aimez-vous travailler selon des normes élevées pour atteindre vos objectifs?

Rejoingnez nos équipes

L’équipe de gestion de Turbomachinery & Process Solutions en France opère dans 120 pays et dessert l'ensemble de la chaîne de valeur énergétique et du secteur industriel. Nous détenons un vaste portefeuille d'équipements rotatifs, de flux de processus, de technologies de transmission et de services de cycle de vie. Nous supervisons et soutenons l'installation, la maintenance et la planification à long terme de nos produits de pointe sur les sites clients mondiaux.

Collaborez avec les meilleurs

En tant que Technicien SAV (F/H), vous évoluerez au cœur des opérations terrain, où vous réaliserez la maintenance, la qualification et le dépannage de nos équipements, en zone contrôlée comme en environnement ATEX ou pétrochimique. Vous utiliserez l’outil ValScope, assurerez la mise à jour des dossiers d’intervention, participerez aux réunions d’enclenchement et apporterez un support technique de premier niveau aux clients. Votre rôle vous amènera à travailler en horaires postés, à intervenir en hauteur ou dans des conditions climatiques variées, et à vous déplacer fréquemment en France et à l’étranger. Grâce à votre sens du service, votre capacité d’adaptation et votre rigueur technique, vous garantirez la bonne exécution des interventions et renforcerez la confiance de nos clients envers Baker Hughes.

En tant que Technicien SAV (F/H), vous serez responsable de:

Réaliser la maintenance, la qualification et le dépannage des matériels Masoneilan.

Utiliser l’outil ValScope pour la qualification et le diagnostic des équipements.

Intervenir en zone contrôlée, en environnement ATEX, pétrochimique ou nucléaire.

Effectuer des travaux en hauteur (crinolines, passerelles, nacelles, échafaudages).

Travailler en conditions extérieures variées : chaud, froid, humidité, soleil.

Utiliser des équipements spécifiques : appareils respiratoires, cagoules, tenue MURUROA, ARI.​

Alimentez votre passion

Pour réussir dans ce rôle, vous devrez:

Avoir de très bonnes connaissances des produits Masoneilan : robinets, actionneurs, instrumentations, matériaux.

Avoir des compétences solides en mécanique, pneumatique et électricité.

Avoir des connaissance dans les environnements nucléaires, chimique et pétrochimique.

Maîtriser les instrumentations de régulation et outils de diagnostic.

Être capable de lire des plans généraux et plans de coupe.

Maîtrisee les outils informatiques : Excel, Word, PowerPoint, SAP, Alfresco.

Être capable d'analyser, diagnostiquer et résoudre un problème technique ou EHS.

Travaillez d'une manière qui vous convient

Nous reconnaissons que tout le monde est différent et que la manière dont les gens veulent travailler et donner le meilleur d'eux-mêmes est également différente pour chacun. Dans ce rôle, nous pouvons offrir les modèles de travail flexibles suivants :

Travailler avec des horaires flexibles - en adaptant les horaires de travail de la journée pour vous aider à tout intégrer et à travailler lorsque vous êtes le plus productif

Travailler avec nous

Nos employés sont au cœur de ce que nous faisons chez Baker Hughes. Nous savons que nous sommes meilleurs lorsque tous nos employés sont développés, engagés et capables de se mettre pleinement au travail. Nous investissons dans la santé et le bien-être de nos effectifs, formons et récompensons les talents et développons des leaders à tous les niveaux pour faire ressortir le meilleur de chacun.

Travailler pour vous

Nos inventions ont révolutionné l'énergie depuis plus d'un siècle. Mais pour continuer demain, nous savons que nous devons repousser les limites aujourd'hui. Nous accordons la priorité à récompenser ceux qui adoptent le changement avec un package qui reflète à quel point nous apprécions leur contribution. Rejoignez-nous et vous pouvez vous attendre à : Des politiques contemporaines de conciliation travail-vie personnelle et des activités de bien-être Des options de soins médicaux privés complets Un filet de sécurité des programmes d'assurance-vie et d'invalidité

À propos de nous

Avec des opérations dans plus de 120 pays, nous fournissons de meilleures solutions à nos clients et des opportunités plus riches pour nos employés. En tant que partenaire de premier plan du secteur de l'énergie, nous nous engageons à atteindre des émissions de carbone nettes nulles d'ici 2050 et nous recherchons toujours les bonnes personnes pour nous aider à y parvenir. Des gens qui sont aussi passionnés que nous pour rendre l'énergie plus sûre, plus propre et plus efficace.

Rejoignez-nous

Êtes-vous à la recherche d'une opportunité de faire une réelle différence dans une entreprise avec une portée mondiale et des services et des clients passionnants ? Rejoignez-nous et grandissez avec une équipe de personnes qui sauront vous dynamiser et vous inspirer !
